loans.name: Pablo Alfonso

texts.es: El Sr. Pablo Alfonso M. L. él se dedica a la compra y venta de leche tiene tres camionetas propias que son sus medios de trasporte para la venta de la leche trabaja a diario   tiene  catorce años de dedicarse a esta actividad es casado actualmente tiene cuatro niños en edad escolar. Ha tenido  nueve créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para la  compra y venta de leche pero este lo está solicitando para ajustar para la compra de una descremadora, los créditos le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera él ha  mejorado su condición de su negocio  de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Pablo Alfonso M. L. works in the purchase and sale of milk. He owns three trucks which are his means of transport for his milk sales. He works daily and has been in this business for fourteen years. He is currently married and has four school-aged children. He has had nine loans through CEPRODEL and he has used each one for the purchase and sale of milk. However, he is requesting his loan to purchase a machine for skimming milk. The loans have benefited him in a great way since, as a result, he has improved the condition of his business and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a machine for skimming milk

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Huong T. N. is 27 years old with one daughter.  She runs a busy shop that provides photocopy services for local companies.  Running this business since 2004, loans have helped her do more business.  Currently, Huong wants a loan of 8,502,000 VND to buy another photocopy machine to meet the increase in customer orders.

loans.use: Buy another photocopy machine.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita F. is a widow who lives in Sitio Canonoy, Bgry. Miranda, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a general store, pig fattening and selling Avon products. Nenita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nenita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 16,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 20th loan, she is borrowing PHP 17,000,which she intends to use to purchase more stock for her general store and feeds for her pigs so that she can continue to save up for the future and their household consumption. Nenita F. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending-team page on Kiva to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Cruz Amarilis

texts.es:
Cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Esperanza Para  Superar  en el hermoso balneario de San Jacinto, rodeado de una playa hermosa lugar donde el Rio Portoviejo se une con el mar. Este lugar es visitado por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros.

La señora Cruz  es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque las personas que están en el son serias en lo que hacen, ella es la secretaria. Tiene 27 años de edad, esta casada y tiene un hijo de 8 años el mismo que está en la escuela, el marido es controlador de la cooperativa de transporte  Carlos Alberto Aray.
 
Es una ama de casa que para ayudarse en sus gastos se dedica a hacer trabajos de arreglo personal, pinta uñas, corta cabello, realiza tinturados, entre otros trabajos de belleza. Trabaja  en su casa y a domicilio. Además elabora forros para electrodomésticos los cuales los realiza bajo pedido. Trabaja todos los días  en sus actividades desde las 8h30 hasta las 14h00.

Este crédito es para comprar materiales tanto para elaborar los forros como también esmaltes y otros materiales de belleza. 

Sus sueños son tener un salón de belleza y una microempresa textil.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days the Communal Bank “Esperanza Para Superar” (Hope to Overcome) meets in the beautiful resort town of San Jacinto, which is surrounded by a beautiful beach and where the Portoviejo River meets the sea. This place is visited by many domestic and foreign tourists.

Sra. Cruz is a founding member of her Communal Bank and likes the fact that the people who have joined are serious about what they do. She serves as the group secretary. Cruz is 27 years old, married, and has an eight year old child in school. Her husband works as a dispatcher for the Carlos Alberto Aray transportation cooperative.

Cruz is a homemaker who helps with the expenses by providing personal makeovers, painting nails, cutting and coloring hair, and performing other beauty services in her home. She also makes covers for household appliances upon request. Cruz works every day in all of her activities between the hours of 8:30am and 2pm.

This loan will be used to buy materials for making appliance covers as well as nail polishes and other beauty supplies. Her dreams include opening a beauty salon and a small textile business.

loans.use: Purchase nail polishes, beauty supplies, and materials for making appliance covers

loans.name: Marlin Leonor

texts.es: Esta clienta es trabajadora de la alcaldía municipal de la ciudad en donde se desempeña como secretaria desde hace 13 años. esta Sr. Es casada y tiene a su cargo a 2 hijos los cuales los mantiene de su salario por lo que se le dificulta realizar las mejoras de su salario por tal razón está solicitando el crédito para la reparación de su cocina y el cambio de alguna laminas de zinc.
texts.en:
This member has worked at the town hall for thirteen years where she is a secretary. She is married and has two children who are her dependents. She provides for them out of her salary which makes it difficult for her to pay for the house repairs.

She has requested the loan to fix the kitchen in her house and to change some zinc sheets.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Chem

texts.en:
Chem C., 31, is married and lives with her husband and one young child in the Takeo province. 

She and her husband sell cow rope. On average, they make US $6 every day. Chem C. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase more cow rope for resale.

loans.use: To buy cow rope for resale.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen M. is from the village of Libertad, Misamis Oriental. She is 24 years old. Belen is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Belen owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling specialty food products like homemade milk candy or yema candy in the local community. Belen has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Belen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Belen is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Belen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Syovata

texts.en:
Syovata is a married woman who lives in a rental house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is rent.

She has been operating a retail shop for the past two years, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Syovata faces a major challenge in delayed payments by creditors. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, and sugar

loans.name: Ofelia's Group

texts.en:
Ofelia T. is from the village of Minallo. She is 37 years old. Ofelia is the group leader of a ten-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ofelia T..

Ofelia is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Ofelia runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Ofelia has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Ofelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ofelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ofelia is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Ofelia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jackilou

texts.en:
Jackilou P. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 24 years old. Jackilou is single and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, she deals in selling personal products, such as cosmetics and lotions from AVON and NATASHA, in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $225 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jackilou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Jackilou is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like blouses and shoes from AVON and NATASHA. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like blouses & shoes from AVON & NATASHA

loans.name: Ademar

texts.es:
Ademar Borbón U., tiene la edad de 22 años, esta soltero. El quiere comprar una motocicleta para su trasporte al trabajo. Con ésta compra él se está facilitando su trasporte al trabajo y así llegar a tiempo a laborar, el tiene mucha experiencia en el manejo de esta y en mantenimiento para tenerla en buenas condiciones para su buen desempeño. Piensa en el futuro y en su estabilidad  laboral por lo cual quiso adquirir este vehículo para ser puntual a la hora de llegada a su trabajo.
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Ademar Borbón U. is a 22-year-old single man. He would like to buy a motorcycle to use to commute to work. This would make his commute easier and allow him to arrive on time for work. He has a lot of experience with motorcycles and knows how to keep them in good working condition. Ademar has been thinking about the future and about having stable employment. This is why he has been thinking about getting a motorcycle, which would allow him to arrive on time to work. This is the first loan he will have received from FUDECOSUR. He has never received other loans from state banks before. FUDECOSUR has made it easier for him to receive the loan and the interest rate is much lower.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle

loans.name: Kitoola Women's Group-Lugazi

texts.en:
34-year-old Andrew T.'s business journey began with a modest farming business one and a half years ago.  It is from this farming business that Andrew obtained the capital to buy much of his start-up retail stock. His retail shop is located in Kitoola-Lugazi. 

Andrew is happily married and has  5 children.  He says his business generates 260,000 shillings for him monthly. With this loan, he says he is going to purchase more retail commodities to resell. Kitoola Women's group is the group he is affiliated with.

loans.use: To purchase of more retail commodities to resell

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is a married woman who lives in Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:   a general store, farming and pig fattening.  Her husband Rodolfo, who is 49 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have seven children who are 9 to 25 years old. Luzminda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Luzminda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,600, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000 to buy products to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. Luzminda is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 37-year-old married woman with five children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. Agnes has been buying and selling cassava flour for twenty years. She started out with 100,000 UGX and now has 1,000,000 UGX. Her hardships include seasonal changes, price fluctuations, debtors and transportation costs. Agnes' goals are to establish a big store and have a well-educated family. Agnes needs this loan to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour

loans.name: Juliana Mabel

texts.es: Juliana tiene 29 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa con su hermana en la zona urbana del distrito de Picsi, una pequeña comunidad urbana-marginal en vías de crecimiento cerca de Chiclayo. Se dedica a la fabricación de cerámica. Cuenta con más de 08 años de experiencia en este rubro y tiene una clientela establecida. Realiza esta labor en la vivienda de su hermana. Aprendió la actividad de su madre, es decir conoce a la perfección su rubro.  Actualmente, cuenta con una aumentación en los pedidos de sus productos y necesita comprar más insumos para hacer su cerámica y responder a la demanda de sus clientes. Por tal motivo, ha solicitado un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa. Juliana es muy honesta y trabajadora. Cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales de sus vecinos de la zona.
texts.en:
Juliana is 29 years old, single, and has no children. She lives at home with her sister in the urban section of the District of Picsi, a small marginalized community near Chiclayo that is experiencing growth. Juliana has been making ceramics for more than eight years and has built up an established customer base. She performs her work at her sister’s house. Juliana learned this trade from her mother, who is known for perfecting her craft. At the moment, she has experienced an increase in orders for her products and needs to buy supplies for her ceramics so that she can meet the demands of her customers. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

Juliana is honest and hardworking. She has good personal and work-related references from her neighbors in the area.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her ceramics business.

loans.name: Abou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abou S. est un homme marié de 32 ans et père d’un enfant, qui vit avec sa femme et son enfant dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni, relevant de  Sikasso  (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Très tôt, il a abandonné l’école pour mener  des activités économiques notamment l’achat et la vente de céréales. Il a appris cette activité auprès d’un de ses cousins.
Avec une expérience de 8 ans, Monsieur Abou S. maîtrise son activité et est très sollicité. 
Pour obtenir un fonds pouvant satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle, il décida d’intégrer Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à sa première expérience, pour acheter, 4 tonnes de céréales.
Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et dans les villages environnants et effectue sa vente au marché de Bougouni, à une clientèle composée de la population locale.
Monsieur Abou vend ses céréales au comptant, en détail et à crédit. 
Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000FCFA. Avec ce bénéfice, il compte agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. Abou S. is a 32-year-old married man and father of one child. He lives with his wife and their child in the district of Massablacoura, city of Bougouni, in Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

He quit school at an early age to pursue commercial activities such as the purchase and sale of grain. He learned this business from one of his cousins. 

With eight years of experience, Mr. Abou S. has a good command of his activity and is in high demand. In order to obtain the capital necessary to satisfy his customer base, he joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. This is his first loan with the MFI, and he plans to buy four tons of grain. 

He stocks up in Bougouni and surrounding villages, and sells his merchandise at retail to the locals, at the Bougouni market, for cash or credit.

With this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 60,000 FCFA, which he will use to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase grain for resale

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry, who is 43 years old and residing with his family in Kingstone Village, a slum, has been running his retail shop there for 10 years.  He also sells clothes on the same premises.  Henry, who also has rental units which earn him extra income, previously baked and sold cakes to earn a living.  He says that since he joined Faulu Kenya he has become financially stable. Henry has requested a loan for 60,000 Kes to expand his business premises and hopes to grow his business within five years and employ more people.

loans.use: to expand his business premises.

loans.name: Norbey Adolfo

texts.es:
Oriundo del campo, Norbey Adolfo R. se siente feliz de haber nacido en una familia humilde campesina que le enseñó a trabajar la tierra, por ello, desde muy pequeño aprendió los oficios propios de la agricultura lo que le ha permitido generar los ingresos básicos para sostener a su familia pues aunque hace poco se casó y aún no tiene hijos, todavía le ayuda a sus padres a cubrir sus gastos. 

Actualmente en un pedacito de tierra, Norbey cultiva café, plátano, fríjo y maíz, además cuenta con un criadero de cerdos de engorde con el fin de generar mayores ingresos y aunque sus jornadas laborales son extensas desde tempranas horas, este emprendedor trabaja con la convicción de ampliar su negocio hasta poder adquirir una finca grande que le permita mejorar su calidad de vida. 

Por ahora, Norbey necesita de un préstamo para comprar concentrado para sus cerdos y así lograr precios más bajos al adquirir mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Native of the countryside, Norbey Adolfo R. feels happy to have been born into a humble, peasant family that taught him how to work the land.  Because of this, from a very young age he learned farming skills that have made it possible for him to earn basic income to support his family. Even though he married recently and does not have children yet, he still helps his parents cover their expenses.

Currently, Norbey farms coffee, bananas, beans and corn on a small plot of land.  He also raises pigs to earn additional income.  Although his work days are long starting very early in the day, this entrepreneur works committed to expanding his business until being able to acquire a large farm that will allow him to improve his quality of life.

For now, Norbey needs a loan to buy feed for his pigs so that he can buy it for a lower price by buying in large amounts.

loans.use: to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Ny, age 58, is married and resides with her children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. Ny is a farmer, earning an income of $3.5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Their standard of living has been improved since Ny has had this business. She is requesting a loan of $1100 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Sopiato

texts.en:
Sopiato, 47 years old, married, and the father of three school-going children, is a sole proprietor businessman selling the traditional Masai clothes to the residents of Kajiado in Bissil market. In business for the last nine years, he earns an income of KES.13,000 per month.

Introduced to KADET LTD by an already-registered client of KADET, Sopiato is now applying for his second loan of KES.60,000 with which he plans to buy more Masaai clothes, sukas, jewelry and beads to sell. With the extra profits that arise, he will buy a plot of land and build a house for his family. In the future he hopes to grow his business and own a big boutique.

loans.use: to buy Masaai clothes, sukas, jewelry, and beads to sell.

loans.name: Digna

texts.es:
La Sra. Digna es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, es madre de dos hijos a los que ha tratado de darles lo mejor y una buena educación, se desempeña como Enfermera auxiliar en un centro de salud de la localidad donde ha brindado sus servicios por más de veinte años para la salud de las personas.
Cuenta con su propia vivienda, la que ha mejorado gracias a su salario y a los préstamos que le ha otorgado Ceprodel, una de las necesidades que tiene en estos momentos es adquirir un préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como ladrillos, cemento, etc. para acondicionar la cocina de su casa, por tal razón decidió solicitar su tercer crédito en Ceprodel con el objetivo de cumplir con su necesidad y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Digna is originally from the town of El Sauce. She is the mother of two children for whom she gives the best and provides a good education. Digna works as an auxiliary nurse at a health clinic in town, where she has attended to patients for more than 20 years.

She owns her home and has been able to make improvements thanks to her salary and the loans provided by CEPRODEL. One of her needs at the moment is to acquire a loan so that she can buy materials such as bricks, cement, and other items. She plans to renovate the kitchen in her home. For this reason, she is requesting her third loan from CEPRODEL so that she can complete this project and provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to pay for materials and labor so that she can renovate her kitchen.

loans.name: Marie Grace

texts.en:
Marie Grace 31 years old and is the mother of four children between the ages of four and nine. All of her children are in school. Marie Grace’s husband works in a hotel. For the past three years, she has run a stall where she sells foodstuff. Her business is going well and has enabled her to pay school fees for her children and save money.

Marie Grace is requesting a loan to buy more food items to sell and increase her profits. She hopes to be able to save money in the future.

loans.use: to buy foodstuff to sell

loans.name: Alejandrina Natividad

texts.es: Alejandrina tiene 23 años y tiene una hija (Yamiled de 1 año y 5 meses), ella nació en la ciudad de Echarate provincia de la Convención (Cusco, Perú), vive en la comunidad de Chogona a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Quillabamba. Ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio y ya es un año que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otras cosas más. El sueño de Alejandrina es abrir otra tienda.
texts.en:
Alejandrina, 23, has a daughter (Yamiled, seventeen months months old).  Alejandrina was married in the city of Echarate, La Convención Province, (Cusco, Perú).  She lives in the community of Chogona which is 45 minutes from the city of Quillabamba.

She has a small grocery store at home; she’s had it for a year and does very well.  On this opportunity she needs the loan to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, noodles and other things, for example.  Alejandrina’s dream is to open a second store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Ernesto Jose

texts.es:
Ernesto casado, su esposa amad e casa, sus hijos estudiantes, sus planes apoyar a sus hijos en que se preparen y tenga una profesión. Trabaja para una empresa privada desde hace tiempo. Requiere del mejoramiento de la infraestructura de su vivienda también el sistema eléctrico siendo de gran peligro para su familia.
Con el préstamo comprara materiales de construcción: cemento, bloques, piedras canteras, hierro, tablones de maderas, piedrines entre otros materiales para la construir la pared lateral de la casa. Obteniendo seguridad y comodidad.
texts.en:
Ernesto is married, his wife is the home-maker, his children are students.  His plan is to support their children to be prepared and have a profession.  He has worked for a private company for some time.  Their house requires the improvement of it's infrastructure and also the electrical system is a great danger to his family.

With this loan he will buy construction materials: cement, blocks, stone quarries, iron, wood planks, gravel and other building materials for the side wall of the house. He is obtaining safety and comfort.

loans.use: to buy materials.

loans.name: Enagnon (Sata) Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ENAGNON (SATA) est composé de trois personnes qui habitent dans la même maison. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Zéliatou est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Zéliatou est âgée de 27 ans et vit au Bénin. Zéliatou est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Ibrahim. Le couple a un enfant scolarisé et à leur charge. Zéliatou a très peu  fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de son enfant, Zéliatou mène comme activité depuis cinq ans la vente de tissus, de chaussures et des foulards. Zéliatou s’approvisionne  au Togo, État voisin du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Zéliatou sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ENAGNON (SATA), un premier crédit.
texts.en:
The group ENAGNON (SATA) is comprised of three persons who live in the same house. This is the first time that this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé for elevating their level of business. The group’s representative, by the name of Zéliatou, is the person with her hand raised in the photo. She is 27 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a retailer by the name of Ibrahim, and they have one  child, who is in school and in their care. 

To support herself and her children, Zéliatou has been running a business for five years selling cloth, shoes, and scarves. She gets her supplies from Togo, a country neighboring Benin. Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and her revenues, Zéliatou and the other members of the group ENAGNON (SATA) are requesting an initial loan.

loans.use: to buy footwear, cloth, and scarves

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is 35 years old and lives in Tangub City. He is married with one child.

Jerry has a electronics repair business and earns approximately 15,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. He has a requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase more equipment for his electronics repair business.

Jerry has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment for his electronics repair business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma, 29 years old, is married to Peter and they are blessed with one child. She owns a boutique in Kitengela where most of her clients are females. She has been in this business for the last three years and earns an income of KES 5,000 per month.

Fatuma is applying for her first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD. She plans to open another boutique in Arthi River with the whole amount. She plans to use the anticipated profit to pay fees for her child.

She hopes to become a wholesaler in Kitengela. She is ambitious and hardworking.

loans.use: to open another boutique in Arthi River.

loans.name: Orquídea

texts.es: Orquídea de 27 años de edad, reside en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeña hija de 5 años. Para ella lo más importante es su familia y es su principal inspiración. Orquídea trabaja duramente como empleada impulsando productos alimenticios.  Además para llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar, se dedica a la venta de productos con enchape de oro como: aretes, cadenas, pulseras, etc. ya que el poco dinero que gana en su trabajo no es suficiente para cubrir las necesidades del hogar, sus productos los ofrece a diferentes personas tanto en su trabajo como a vecinos, incluso en mercados como se aprecia en la imagen. Gracias a su carisma a logrado establecer muy buena clientela y ahora  muchas personas la prefieren porque ofrece variedad y buenos precios en sus productos. Últimamente ha notado que su negocio es rentable y que muchas personas demandan sus productos.  Es por esta razón que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito para comprar variedad de productos con enchape de oro (pulseras, aretes, cadenas, etc.). Le pide a Dios que su situación económica mejore y así poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Orquídea is 27 years old, and she lives in her own house with her life partner and her 5 year-old daughter. Her family is the most important thing to her, as well as being her main inspiration. Orquídea is an employee, and she works very hard promoting food products. Moreover, to provide for the family’s daily necessities, she engages in selling gold plated products such as earrings, chains, bracelets and so on, as the meager wage she earns with her job is not enough to pay for the necessities od her family. She offers her products to various customers: to her work colleagues, to her neighbors and in the markets as well, as we can see in the picture. Thanks to her charisma she has succeeded in gaining very good customers, and now many people chose her because she offers a variety of products at good prices. Lately she has realized that her activity is profitable, as many people ask for her products. This is why she has decided to ask for this loan, which will be used to buy various gold plated products (bracelets, earrings, chains, and so on). She hopes that her economic situation will improve, thus enabling her to offer a better standard of living to her family.

loans.use: To buy different gold plated products (bracelets, earrings, chains).

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
El señor Marcelino nació en la ciudad de Salvación del departamento de Madre de Dios ósea vive en la selva del Perú.   

El señor Marcelino tiene 59 años y tiene es casado y fruto de esta unión tiene cinco hijos, él es un padre trabajador que saca adelante a su familia y trabaja en la Región de la Provincia de Manu como vigilante, él también tiene un pequeño taller de carpintería donde elabora carpetas, sillas, mesas y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Marcelino requiere el préstamo para comprar madera. 

Las reuniones de las socias del Banco Comunal “Nueva Generación” son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Salvación. 

La selva de Madre de Dios guarda en su fondo muchas riquezas naturales. Los bosques de Madre de Dios son pródigos en entregar singular belleza. En los bosques grandes y misteriosos de Madre de Dios la caza es abundante. La selva de Madre de Dios es cortada por majestuosos ríos sobre los que se puede navegar en canoas o lanchas.
texts.en:
Marcelino was born in the city of Salvación in the heart of the Madre de Dios department.  He lives in the Peruvian jungle.

Marcelino, age 59, is married and has five children.  He is a hard-working father who gets his family ahead.  He works as a security guard in the region of the Manu province.  He also has a small carpentry shop where he makes desks, chairs, tables and other things.  He has been in this business for several years, and it is going very well for him.  Marcelino now needs the loan to buy wood.

The “Nueva Generación” (New Generation) communal bank meets once a month in the city of Salvación.  

The Madre de Dios jungle has a lot of natural resources at its core.  The Madre de Dios forests are lavish and present an extraordinary beauty.  Hunting is abundant in the large and mysterious jungles in Madre de Dios .  Majestic rivers, which one is able to navigate in canoes or small boats, cuts through the Madre de Dios jungle.

loans.use: to buy wood.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a 44-year-old married woman who lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol with her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells various items like coffee, sugar, canned goods and soap. She also sells vegetables and dried fish to the people in her community.

She has requested a loan to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods and vegetables. Carmelita hopes to earn better and be able to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods and vegetables.

loans.name: Gulzamzam's Group

texts.en:
Gulzamzam is the leader of this group. She is 47 and she brings up a son and a daughter, both of whom study at school. Ten years ago she broke up with her husband and with an initial investment of 2000 soms she started to sell fruits and vegetables to earn her livelihood. Gulzamzam mostly sells apples and with money received from the loan she plans to purchase more applies in order to increase the turnover of her business. In the future she wishes to open her own grocery store. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase apples for resale

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
La señora Adela tiene 68 años de edad, vive sola y tiene seis hijos que ya son independientes.

Ella es una mujer que desde pequeña le ha gustado trabajar mucho y dice que continuara durante Dios le preste vida. Cuando vivía con sus padres, ella trabajaba para que a ellos no les faltara nada, vendía de todo un poco, viajaba desde su cantón hasta la ciudad y compraba frutas, verduras, chorizo, entre otros.

Desde hace unos 14 años, vende queso, crema, cuajada y pan, día de por medio ella sale a vender casa por casa a pie, en su cantón y caseríos vecinos, lo hace de 2:00 de la tarde a 5:00 de la tarde. Adela se traslada a dos ciudades, para comprar el queso y la crema en libras, esto le genera ganancias.

Adela solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar 20 sacos de maíz, que le servirán para alimentar a sus animales, ya que ella engorda cerdos, y de la leche que cuaja, obtiene suero y esto mas el maíz da de alimento a los cerdos. También lo utilizara para consumo personal y algunas veces para vender. Adela es una mujer sola, por lo que siempre le gusta estar preparada por cualquier necesidad, ella siempre por esta fecha saca prestamos para tener provisiones y seguir trabajando. 

Adela desea cambiar el techo de su casa, por que en el invierno se moja demasiado su casa, más con el temporal de octubre se le quebraron dos cuartones de madera del techo. Por esta razón, ella confía que en el verano realizara ese cambio con la ayuda de Dios y Fundación Campo.
texts.en:
Adela is 68 years old. She lives alone and has six children that are already independent.
She is a woman that from an early age liked to work hard and says that she will continue as long as god gives her life. When she was living with her parents, she worked so that they never lacked anything. She sold a little of everything and traveled from her city to another city and bought fruits, vegetables, and chorizo (sausage), among others.
For about 14 years, she has sold cheese, cream, curds and bread. She goes out every other day to sell door to door on foot, in her city and neighboring farmhouses. She does it from 2:00 in the afternoon until 5:00 in the afternoon. Adela travels to two cities in order to buy the cheese and cream by the pound. This generates her profits.
Adela is requesting a loan of Fundación Campo (Field Foundation) in order to buy 20 bags of corn, which will serve to feed her animals, as she raises pigs. From the milk that curdles she obtains whey and this over the corn provides food for the pigs. Also she will utilize it to for personal consumption and sometimes to sell. Adela is a single woman. Due to that she always likes to be prepared for any need. She continues to date to take out loans in order to have provisions and to continue working.
Adela wants to change the roof of her house, because in the winter her house gets too wet, more so with the storm in October because two panels of wood broke on the roof. For this reason, she trusts that in the summer she will make this change with the help of God and Fundación Campo.

loans.use: to buy 20 bags of corn.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is a petty trader at Kwahinkrom. She is married to a farmer and has one child. Efua uses her income to assist her husband in paying the utility bills. She will use her loan to buy more foodstuffs for resale. With her new profits, Efua will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs for resale.

loans.name: Marième Diène

texts.fr: Madame Marième est âgée  d 53 ans et vit au Sénégal. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 24 et 30ans. Elle s’active dans l’enseignement depuis 1981 comme professeur de français. Mais parallèlement  elle pratique l’activité de commerce depuis plus de 10ans. Son choix du domaine de l’enseignement se justifie  par sa volonté de vouloir s’occuper pour gagner des revenus qui lui permettent de satisfaire ses besoins. Elle  est membre d’un des  guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis juillet 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de poissons à revendre. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de compléter son salaire  afin de  pouvoir couvrir les charges mensuelles de la famille.
texts.en:
Marième lives in Senegal. She is 53 years old, married and the mother of 3 children aged between 24 and 30. She has been a French teacher since 1981 and has also been involved in commerce for over 10 years. She chose to become a teacher because she wanted to earn an income which would allow her to take care of her needs.

Marième has been a member of a UIMCEC branch since July 2011. She is requesting a loan of 100 000 francs so that she can buy fish for resale. She will use her profits to supplement her teaching salary so that she can cover the monthly household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”REYNITA DE BELEN DE CCORAO;  El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Ccorao en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Sabina;  La socia tiene 38 años de edad, La socia es casada, La socia tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja comprando y vendiendo artesanía en la feria artesanal, la socia compra todo tipo de arte desde textiles, adornos en arcilla como vasos, ceniceros, silbatos en formas de aves, llaveros entre otras expresiones de arte. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de artesanía y de textiles para aumentar su mercadería.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Sabina belongs to the "Reynita de Belen de Ccorao" communal bank, located in the district of Ccorao, in Calca province, in Cusco department. 

She is 38, married, and has two children. She buys and sells handicrafts in the handicrafts market. She buys all kinds of art; including textiles, clay decorations such as small cups, ashtrays, bird-shaped whistles, as well as keychains and other forms of art.

She is applying for the loan to buy handicrafts and textiles, in order to add to her merchandise. She is grateful for the loan, and promises to make payments in accordance with her loan schedule.

loans.use: To buy handicrafts and textiles to add to her merchandise

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
For some time now Ekua has been engaged in the production of Fante kenkey. Fante kenkey is common dish popularly known in the Central Region of Ghana.
 
Ekua will use the loan to purchase bags of maize to make kenkey to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize to make kenkey to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 44 years old, and married with five children. With two children in school, Susan works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell.  Susan has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, shampoo, milk, egg, noodles, bread, etc. 

In the future, Susan would like to save enough money so that she could be able to send her two children to college.

loans.use: To buy more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Saroeurng

texts.en: Saroeurng, 41, is married and resides with her husband and six children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working as a weaver for over seven years and is successful in her career. Her husband is construction worker. Her daughter is a garment worker. Since the factory is far away from home, Saroeurng is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to commute to work. By doing so, her daughter would easily go to work on time and save some money on her transportation expense. In the future, Saroeurng would like to build a new house and support her children to study until they get Bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to commute to work.

loans.name: Hacienda Campamento Group

texts.es: jghghgh
texts.en: DFADFASD

loans.use: COMPRA DE ABARROTERIA EN GENERAL

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 42-year-old man living in Kyenjojo,Uganda. He is a very hardworking man who deals in local brew and also sells produce such as maize and coffee. The good father that he is, he desires to see his children educated up to the University level. Unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuation affect his business growth. His dream is to add value to his business by processing the goods.

Patrick intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Aashi

texts.en:
Aashi is a 39-year-old poor lady. The financial condition of her family is not good and their living standards seem not fit for human beings. She wants to establish her house and change the living standards of her family. Her whole family depends upon a single earning person. Her husband drives an auto rickshaw which is their single source of income. 

She wants to buy an additional rickshaw for her son as well. He wants to assemble a new auto rickshaw from a maker. He has collected almost the full amount but is short of the total. 

Therefore, Aashi wants to receive a loan for her husband so he can complete the pending work on his auto rickshaw. In this way she will encourage her husband, so that he can drive his new rickshaw and can generate income for her family. 

Aashi hopes that her husband will be stable in this profession and drive the auto rickshaw for a long time. She is very thankful to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: purchase a new auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Rosa Patricia

texts.es: Rosa es madre de dos hijos que aun están pequeños, se dedico a cuidarlos en los primeros años de vida con el apoyo de su esposo, luego tomo la decisión de estudiar una carrera profesional, Licenciatura en Derecho la cual ha culminado con mucho éxito y trabaja como auditora de calidad en el área de costura en una zona franca. Solicita el crédito para pagar el curso de titulación de su carrera el cual está por emprender y para eso necesita cancelar el monto total del mismo, este es uno de los grandes sueños y meta de Rosa, ella desea que sus hijos se sientan orgullosos de su madre y ella poder servirle a la sociedad empleando sus conocimientos.

loans.use: Doña Rosa solicita el crédito para superarse profesionalmente, pagara el curso de titulación de la carrera de Derecho.

loans.name: Nosakhare

texts.en: Mrs. Nosakhare Obasuyi is 49 years old woman. Who is a dynamic client of LAPO. She had proved her worth of experience in her line of business. She needs the money ($500) to keep her business booming.

loans.use: To buy more of kitchen utensil for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She would like to purchase a hybrid dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Start Farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Teresia would like to buy clothing and materials to make dresses to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Suhartatik

texts.id:
Suhartatik has a business making Lontong. Lontong is rice cake wrapped in banana leafs, and usually eaten with lamb curry, soto soup, sate meat shewers, etc. With a capital of Rp100,000 (about US$11) Suhartatik buys rice, banana leaf, etc, that she then processed into lontong. Everyday from 8:00 AM to 5:00PM Suhartatik could produce 20-30 packages of lontong. These lontongs would then be delivered to foodstalls. The profit she made for Rp50,000 (about US$5.50) was used to support her husband to pay for hosuehold expenses, electricity, water of about Rp70,000(about US$7.70)/month. Suhartatik and her husband lives in a simple house built by themselves from beton and cement floor. All three children have their own family, and live on their own. Loan from DINARI will be used to increase her capital, with the hope that her income would increase.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Suhartatik mempunyai usaha membuat lontong. Lontong adalah nasi yang dibungkus dengan daun pisang yang biasanya dimakan dengan gule kambing, soto, sate dan lain-lain.. Dengan modal Rp. 100.000,- Suhartatik membeli beras, daun pisang, dan sebagainya yang kemudian diolah menjadi lontong. Setiap hari dari jam 08.00 wita sampai jam 17.00 wita Suhartatik dapat membuat 20-30 bungkus lontong. Lontong-lontong itu kemudian diserahkan ke warung-warung. Keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp. 50.000,- yang digunakan untuk membantu suaminya memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya, yaitu membayar listrik dan air PDAM sebesar Rp. 70.000,- perbulan. Suhartatik dan suaminya tinggal di sebuah rumah sederhana yang dibangun sendiri dengan bahan beton dan lantai semen. Ketiga anaknya sudah berkeluarga dan mempunyai tempat tinggal sendiri. Pinjaman dari DINARI dipakai untuk menambah modal usahanya, dengan harapan penghasilannya meningkat.

loans.use:
To increase capital for buying items like food ingredients

Untuk menambah modal usaha seperti membeli bahan makanan.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine A. is a 31-year old widow who lives with her four school going children (she lost her husband due to an HIV-related illness) in Rongo town Kenya .  She has taken and successfully repaid two previous microfinance loans from KMET.  She sells second hand clothes along Rongo Homabay road. She initiated her business in1998 with US $15. Her business has since grown with a daily income of US $50. She is now planning to move to a more spacious place due to increased clientele.   Christine is a community-health worker trained in home-based care by KMET in 2005.  She is, thus, well-known within her community for her health-care work.  She requires US $600 to further purchase more stock of second hand clothes and pay rent for her new shop.

loans.use: Purchase stock of second hand clothes

loans.name: Agnesi

texts.en:
This is Agnesi M.. She is 37 years old and married to husband Ositari, with whom she has two children, Isaka, 19 and Raheli, 10. She owns a kiosk selling various small items in the rural town of Boko Mnemeia, 30km outside of Dar es Salaam. Agnes is requesting a loan of $425 which she will use to increase the quantity and range of her stock, with the aim of increasing her modest monthly earnings of approximately $50.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback arrangement as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, and they are therefore termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client, extending a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for a small kiosk.

loans.name: Juraeva

texts.en:
Juraeva M. lives in Spitamen; she is married and has 4 children.  Juraeva M. has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2005.  She recommended herself as a serious and strongly-motivated client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures.  Loan sums are continually increased, which shows business stability and income increase.  

Mrs. Juraeva M. is very experienced in her business and it is the family business.  She is engaged in vegetable oil and cottonseed oil selling.  Besides this, she is also engaged in the business of livestock raising and selling, milk production and work out.  She dreams to purchase a horn pedigree bull.  

Now Mrs. Juraeva M. requests a loan of $850 for business development, which will permit her to significantly increase the family income and widen the business of vegetable oil selling.  She wants to widen the existing business because it will increase the family income and permit her to give a good education to her children.

loans.use: For business development

loans.name: Aybeth

texts.es:
Aybeth is a hard worker with perseverance. Her desires to better herself push her ahead and keep her from being brought down by her economic situation. For this reason, she decided to start up a store in her house. The income from the store is not enough to support the household and her children, who also work at the store and study to have a better future. She supports her husband and maintains the house and children, even though she’s in the last months of her pregnancy. She’s very happy with the store, hoping to grow the business and trusts that it will happen. She pays attention to the quality of service she offers and the quality of products she has, in order to increase sales. At this time, school days are approaching and she’d like to increase her stock by adding school supplies and hardware items. In order to get these supplies, she is asking for a loan. Support Aybeth as she moves forward fighting for a better future for her children.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

Aybeth, es muy trabajadora y empeñosa, sus deseos de superación la animan y empujan a sobresalir y a no dejarse abatir por las circunstancias de carencia económica y es por esta razón que ha decidido recientemente implementar una tienda en su casa, las ganancias que percibe muchas veces son insuficientes para sostener un hogar donde sus niños hacen su parte trabajando y estudiando para superarse y tener un buen futuro. Ella apoya a su esposo en el sostén de sus dos hijos con su desempeño diario a pesar de que se encuentra en los últimos meses de embarazo. Su nueva ocupación la mantiene muy contenta porque espera crecer y confía en que así será; la atención cálida que ofrece día a día, los precios y la calidad de sus productos son detalles que cuida para asegurar el incremento de las ventas en su tienda. Para esta época en el que se acerca de la campaña escolar desea incrementar sus ganancias con la venta de algunos útiles escolares y también de mayor cantidad de abarrotes para lo cual solicita un préstamo. Apoya a Aybeth a seguir adelante para seguir luchando por un futuro prometedor para sus hijos.

loans.use: Increase capital in order to offer school supplies and hardware items in the store.

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lê Thị L. is healthy and active at her age. She has 5 children. All are grown up, married and moved out. She takes out loan to finance her fish selling business. In addition, she raises few poultry and pigs. Her monthly income is 200USD. She is applying a loan of 400USD to finance her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Mặc dù tuổi đã cao nhưng chị Lê Thị L. còn khoẻ mạnh và là lao động chính trong gia đình. Việc vay vốn trả theo tuần cũng thuận lợi với điều kiện gia đình nên vòng vốn nào chị cũng vay đầu tư vào việc buôn cá tại chợ địa phương. Ngoài ra chị L. còn chăn nuôi gà, lợn. Từ những dự án thiết thực đó kinh tế gia đình ngày càng phát triển. Các con của chị đã trưởng thành, 5 người con đã xây dựng gia đình và đều có nhà riêng. Vòng vốn này chị tiếp tục vay 400USD để cá bán. Thu nhập bình quân của chị là 200USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy fishes

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Señor Oscar Nicolás Martínez is married to Señora Juana Teodora Torales, and they have one son. Oscar has had a business to repair and maintain electronic equipment since 2006. Over time he has grown his business, gaining customer recognition for the good work he delivers.

With his business, Oscar is the family’s only source of income. He wants to invest some savings in order to start a copetín (a place where fast food is sold) where his wife would take care of selling fast food and soda pop. In addition to the money that they have saved and designated for this, Oscar needs a loan with which they will be able to acquire the utensils and supplies needed in order to see his plan realized.

The shop would open in a location that belongs to Oscar’s mother, and it would be free, so they won’t have to spend money to rent the location. Oscar has high expectations and hopes that this will help generate good income, more than they currently earn, since they now have a son and they want to begin to save for his education.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Oscar Nicolás Martínez esta casado con la señora Juana Teodora Torales y tienen un hijo. Oscar tiene un negocio de reparación y mantenimiento de equipos informáticos desde el año 2006, el cual ha crecido con el tiempo consolidando su clientela reconocimiento por el buen trabajo que realiza.

Como el negocio del señor Oscar es la única fuente de ingreso de la familia el desea invertir unos ahorros para montar un copetín (lugar de ventas de comidas rápidas) en donde pueda atender su esposa y vender comidas rápidas y gaseosas. Además del dinero que tienen ahorrado y destinado para esto, Oscar necesita un crédito con el que podrán adquirir todos los utensilios e insumos necesarios para poder ver su meta realizada.

El mismo será abierto en un local que pertenece a la madre de Oscar, y que está libre, por lo que no gastarán en alquiler del local. Oscar tiene muchas expectativas y desea que esto los ayude a generar buenos ingresos, más aun ahora que ya tienen un hijo y desean empezar a ahorrar para los estudio del mismo.

loans.use: To buy a freezer, chairs, display cabinets, tables, table cloths, meat, flour, soda pop, etc.

loans.name: Mariam's Umoja Group

texts.en:
Mariam is 28 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 5 and 2 years old. Mariam sells clothes and chips. She started in 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

In the past, Mariam has taken out and successfully repaid a loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Bashira, Shani, Salima and Shani D., who sell beverages, food sales, clothes, and small market sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mrs. Heng M. sells a type of Khmer cake in Anlong Thnot Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Her husband, Mr. Yin Bich, is unemployed and assists his wife to make the Khmer cakes she sells. Mrs. Heng M. and her husband have six children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while four others attend school. The youngest is too young to work or study.

Mrs. Heng M. does her best to earn enough to support her family and give them better living conditions. However, she still does not have enough money to build a new house to replace their old one. Thus, Mrs. Heng M. has asked for a loan to help the family afford the cost of building a new house.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Pualoa

texts.en: Pualoa - known as Losi - Ulafala, 39, is married with three children. Her husband works for the government as a public servant. She has 2 years of experience in the groceries business. Losi sells to the village people and general public 7 days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~$187 USD). SPBD loans are Losi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her earnings will be used to improve her business and help out with her family's expenses.

loans.use: Pualoa would like to to restock her existing grocery store.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 31 years old, married, and has 3 children, 13, 10 and 7 years old. Amina became a bites (chapati & rice bread) seller in 2007 and now works every day from 6 a.m. to 12 p.m., earning a monthly profit of about US$20.

In the past, Amina has taken out a successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes to receive another loan to buy more items for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of items for a food sales business

loans.name: Abu

texts.en: This is 50-year-old Abu T.. Abu was born in Makeni and is married with 5 children. Abu has sold second-hand clothes (called "junks" here) for the past 15 years now. He is seeking a loan of Le. 3,000,000 to enable him to buy more bundles of “junks” clothes. With a variety of  “junks” clothes in his shop, Abu will make more sales, increase the profit he makes, and consequently improve his family's well-being.

loans.use: Buy more bundles of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Las Reynas Group

texts.es:
Victoria es la coordinadora del Grupo “Las Reynas”, ella inició el negocio por la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su casa y de sus hijos, también porque ya no pudo seguir trabajando ya que no tenía quien le cuidara a su hijo. Empezó vendiendo frituras y dulces, poco a poco fue implementando los productos para poder ofrecer mas y mejores cosas a sus clientes es por eso que empezó la venta de tacos y comidas, que es lo que mejor le ha redituado y a lo que se dedica actualmente.

Ramona inició el negocio por la necesidad de ayudar a los gastos de la casa y para sacar a sus hijos adelante y tener mejor calidad de vida. Empezó vendiendo ropa a sus hermanas y tías después se ponía en un mercado rodante y ahora ya van y le compran a su casa y ya tiene aproximadamente 5 años con el negocio.

Griselda inició el negocio por la necesidad de salir adelante y ayudar a su marido con los gastos de la casa. Empezó vendiendo ropa en su casa y poco a poco se fue metiendo a los mercados rodantes y es así como a podido mantener a su familia.

Bertha inició el negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos y también para tener algo en que entretenerse ya que ya no trabajaba y necesitaba distraerse y al mismo tiempo obtener algún ingreso adicional al de su esposo. Comenzó hace tres años vendía paletas de hielo y frituras en la plaza, pero gracias a que le ha ido bien ya tiene su puesto en su casa.

Ellas necesitan un préstamo por US $1100 que pagaran en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y poder continuar con su negocio. Con tu apoyo ellas seguirán progresando.
texts.en:
Victoria is the coordinator of the group "Las Reynas" (The Queens). She started her business to help her husband with the expenses of the household and children, and also because she could not continue employment since she had nobody to care for her son. She started selling fried foods and sweets, and gradually added products in order to offer more and better items to her clients, starting to sell tacos and meals. These provided better profits and are what she is now selling. Ramona started her business to help with the household expenses and to help her children get ahead and have a better quality of life. She started selling clothing to her sisters and aunts, and later set herself up in a street market. Now they come and buy from her in her home, and she has been in business for about 5 years. Griselda started her business in order to get ahead and to help her husband with the household expenses. She started selling clothing from her house, and gradually moved into the street markets and in this way has been able to support her family. Bertha started her business in order to help her husband with the expenses and also in order to have something to fill her time since she was not working and needed something to do and to earn some income in addition to that of her husband. Three years ago she started selling frozen treats and fried foods in the plaza, which has been going well for her since she still has her stand in her house. They need a loan of $1100, which they will repay in 6 months, in order to buy merchandise and be able to continue their businesses. With your help they will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en: Mrs. Chhin S. was born in 1974 and she lives in Samraong Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a vegetable farmer who owns 2 hectares for cultivating. In her plantation, she faces a small problem because her field is infertile soil which affects her crop, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to amend her field to make her plants more productive. Her husband, Mr. Chhun Tith, helps his wife in the plantation. Mrs. Chhin S. has two children who are both attending the local school. Her husband is in the photo.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to amend her field

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice A. is married and has three children. She resides with her family in Tema-Ashaiman in the Greater Accra region of Ghana. She is 38 years old.  She runs a clothing shop and for the past five years, she has sold ladies' and children's clothing such as blouses and skirts, lingerie, and underwear. She needs a loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase a large quantity of high-quality clothing to upgrade her inventory. She says she would be grateful for that assistance. She is a member of the group called Morning Star. Members of this group agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To upgrade her clothing inventory.

loans.name: Lufuka C-Nansuna Sarah Group

texts.en:
Sarah N. is 32 years old. She was formerly a waitress in the Speke Hotel Kampala. She now operates a restaurant and a charcoal selling stall in Lufuka. She earns a weekly profit of at least UGX 80,000 from both businesses, which have been in operation since 2004. From her profits she settles her rent bills at the rate of UGX 60,000. Sarah is using the loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal to boost her charcoal selling business. Her strength in business is the ability to attract new customers while retaining old customers by offering them quality services.

However, she is not contented with these businesses because her dream is to run a wholesale shop of fast moving consumer goods. She hopes that by achieving her dream, she will be in position to set up a modern residence for her family and also see her children through best schools. She is a loving mother of four and also a caring guardian to her late brother's two children. Her loving husband is a businessman in the clothing sector and has always supported her in the businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora María Eugenia es originaria del municipio de Nagarote en la ciudad de León y desde hace 15 largos años se ha dedicado a elaborar tortillas las que son comercializadas en su casa de habitación donde las ofrece a sus clientes que desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana llegan a comprarlas.

La señora María Eugenia es madre casada y con sus tres pequeños hijos en edad escolar y es por este motivo que ella al ver la necesidad de invertir en su negocio en la compra de la leña y el maíz para hacer las tortillas,, ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito y espera que le sea otorgado sin ningún problema para continuar con su negocio en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Nagarote.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Eugenia is originally from the Nagarote municipality of León city. She has been making tortillas since she was 15 years old, and she sells them from her home where she offers tortillas to her customers beginning in the early morning hours when they arrive to buy them. María Eugenia is a married mother with three small school-aged children and it is for this reason that she sees the necessity to invest in her business by buying firewood and corn to make the tortillas. She has approached Ceprodel to ask for a loan and she hopes that it will be granted without any problem so that she can continue with her business in her home in the Nagarote municipality.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn and firewood

loans.name: Furaha Group

texts.en:
Asia has had a small store selling charcoal and firewood in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for many years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $50. She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more fuel for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to expand her business. Asia is 27 years old, married, with four children aged 8, 6, 3 and 2.

Asia will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Mwatima, Mwajuma C., Mwanahamis and Mwajuma S.. Each woman has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Yessi

texts.es: Yessi tiene 21 años de edad, está separada hace un año de su pareja, tiene un niño con el cual actualmente vive en la casa de sus padres, que es donde realiza su negocio. Desde muy pequeña apoyó a sus padres en el cultivo de sus chacras, y desde que decidió formar una nueva familia empezó a dedicarse a la agricultura. Paralelamente se dedica a la atención de su bodega, la cual hace 2 años le trasfirieron sus padres, desde entonces Yessi está tratando de incrementar su mercadería, en cuanto a la adquisición de bebidas y abarrotes, ya que están resultando muy rentables más que la venta sola de abarrotes. Este negocio le encanta porque su dinero está en constante movimiento, esto le alienta a seguir en este negocio, por ello le pone todo el empeño a abrir antes de las 6 de la mañana y se queda hasta las diez, ya que ha esas horas realiza el cultivo de sus plantas. Asimismo ayuda a pastar los ganados a su madre.  Sus miras a futuro son incrementar la mercadería de su negocio y sembrar arvejas y demás productos en grandes cantidades, para de ese modo convertirse en una prospera comerciante. Yessi es muy activa en su banco comunal llamado “Campo Verde”, tiene el cargo de tesorera. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo demostró responsabilidad en la labor encomendada y en los pagos que viene realizando sin caer en mora. El dinero que solicita es para surtir su bodega con abarrotes y demás golosinas. Yessi está agradecida con las personas que hacen posible este préstamo porque le permite seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Yessi is 21 years old and separated from her husband one year ago. She has a son and together they live in her parent's house where Yessi has her business. Since she was little, Yessi has helped her parents in the fields and since she decided to form her own family, she has dedicated herself to agriculture. At the same time, she also attended to her store which she has run for the last two years since her parents transferred it to her. Yessi tried to increase the merchandise in the store, including acquiring more drinks and groceries which has resulted in better sales and profits than just groceries alone. Yessi loves this business because money is constantly in motion and this encourages her to keep with the business. For this reason she opens the store before 6 am every day and stays until 10 pm (at which time she cares for her plants). At the same time, she helps her mother graze cattle. Yessi's hops for the future are to increase the inventory in her store, plant peas, and sell more products in greater quantities so that she can become a prosperous businesswoman. Yessi is very active in her village bank, called "Campo Verde", where she is the treasurer. This is her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and in this time she has shown her responsibility through the work in this position and by making her payments on time. The money she is soliciting is to stock her store with groceries and candies. Yessi is grateful to the people that make this loan possible because it allows her to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es: El señor José Manuel Paíz, tiene la edad de 36 años habita en el barrio la Francia N 0 2 , junto a su esposa la cual es ama de casa ella le apoya con las actividades del hogar , cuando hay producción ella de apoya en la venta de dicha cosecha . ellos tiene a su cargo dos hijos uno de ocho años y el otro de seis los dos son varones , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus pequeños y aumentar la producción agrícola , don José desde hace quince años se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad es la falta de financiamiento y el mal tiempo que eso le perjudico mucho ya que no vendió  la producción con resultados factibles , él inicio las labores agrícolas con el apoyo de su padre , el solicita financiamiento para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes para mejorar sus cultivos y lograr una producción buena.
texts.en:
Mr. José Manuel Paíz is 36 years old and lives at N 0 2 in the La Francia neighborhood with his wife. His wife is a housewife and she supports him with the household activities and when there is a harvest she supports him in the harvest. They have two sons, one 8 years old and the other six years old. His future plans are to improve his family’s living conditions and increase his agricultural production. Since he was 15 years old José has been farming. His greatest challenge is the lack of financing and the bad weather damaged crops so he couldn’t sell his crops with optimal results. He began farming with his father’s support. He is seeking financing to buy supplies and fertilizer to improve his crops and achieve a good crop production.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy farming supplies to have a better production

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline O. is a 46 year-old mother of five. Her husband, Joel, has been buying and selling livestock for almost 15 years. Their house is near the livestock market of Sibalom, the center of trading in Antique province. However, her husband’s income cannot support the needs of her growing family.   She wants to help her husband support the education of three of her children (one in college, one in secondary school, and one in preparatory school). 

Evangeline applied for this loan to buy one piglet and feed for the pig she is now raising from her first loan from ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.).  She wants to save money to increase her husband's capital and to expand her piggery in the future.

loans.use: To expand a piggery.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en: Eric M. is thirty-three years old and married with two children. He lives with his wife and the children. Currently one child is in school and the other is still breastfeeding. Eric is a local manufacturer of soap. He combines materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil to make his soap. He is not able to produce in large quantities for lack of funds. He wants to take advantage of the loan facility to buy more raw materials and processing equipment to scale up production. He hopes to raise his income to support his children's education. He belongs to the village bank called Nkwagyedom, which means 'savior of the many'.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for making soap.

loans.name: Badiratu

texts.en:
Badiratu U. is 58 years old and and married with five children. Badiratu earns her living by selling goats.

She hopes to obtain a loan amount of N75,000, which she will use to purchase more goats to sell.

She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more goats to sell

loans.name: Basilides H.

texts.en:
Basilides H. A. makes a living primarily from planting and harvesting corn. She is 52 years old, married and has nine school-age children. They are from the village of Yahong, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. Basilides has been in business for over 20 years and earns approximately 800 PHP a month.

In May 2009, Basilides joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Basilides is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anasthasie

texts.fr:
T. Anasthasie est née le 14 Avril 1965 à Cotonou, Capitale Economique  de la République du Bénin. Anasthasie est mariée à LABITE Lucien, déclarant en douane.
