Anasthasie est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Anasthasie a fait les études jusqu'au lycée. Ensuite, Anasthasie suivi une formation en secrétariat bureautique. Anasthasie reçut son parchemin et travailla avec dans une structure privée pendant neuf (9) mois. 
Anasthasie a choisi délibérément d’abandonner le secrétariat pour se lancer dans le commerce de divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, etc.) et des cartes de recharge téléphonique. 

Anasthasie a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit de ALIDé et elle a bien remboursé ce crédit. Anasthasie a besoin de moyens  financiers pour diversifier son activité avec la vente de produits vivriers précisément le maïs. Anasthasie sollicite donc un deuxième prêt de ALIDé pour l'achat de sacs de maïs.
texts.en:
T. Anasthasie was born on April 14, 1965 in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. She is married to LABITE Lucien, a customs agent, and is the mother of three children who are all in school. She attended classes up to high school. Then, she had office secretarial training, received her certificate, and worked in a private organization for nine months. Anasthasie consciously decided to abandon secretarial work to get started in the commerce of various goods: candies, cookies, canned foods (milk, sardines, tomatoes), sugar, pasta, laundry detergents, dish soap, and bath soap, batteries, candles, etc. and also mobile phone recharge cards. Anasthasie has already benefited from an ALIDÉ loan and has repaid it. She has need of funding to diversify her business by selling staple foods, corn to be exact. She's therefore requesting a second loan from ALIDÉ to buy sacks of corn.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy six 100-kg sacks of corn

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad H., 48, a separated mother of two, runs a store with her married daughter where she sells charcoal, firewood and mineral water. She also cooks and sells pancit (a noodle dish) and rice cakes for snacks. Every weekend, she buys dressed chicken in bulk and sells it to her neighbors. Natividad earns P15,300 monthly.

Natividad has applied for a loan to buy sacks of rice and other merchandise for her store.  With additional income, she prays that she will be able to renovate her house.

loans.use: sacks of rice

loans.name: Virginia Blanca

texts.es:
La señora Virginia Blanca S. A. tiene 31 años. Tiene 3 hijas, la mayor de 15 años, la segunda de 11 años y la menor de 9 años de edad.  Las tres acuden a la escuela de la zona, y las tres tienen muy buenas notas en la escuela porque dicen gustarles mucho aprender. Ayudan con el cuidado de las vacas todas las tardes después de la escuela. 

La señora Virginia vive en la zona de Monte Canto  en Cochabamba, en su domicilio es donde tiene su ganado lechero con el cual produce leche. Toda la producción de leche entrega diariamente a una empresa local que elabora toda clase de productos lácteos. Su esposo falleció hace no más de 2 años, quien era el que más trabajaba con el ganado, pero con lo sucedido ella y sus hijas se hacen cargo total del cuidado de las vacas.

El préstamo será destinado a la compra de ganado lechero para poder incrementar la producción actual de leche que tienen, y así poder mejorar sus ingresos y por consecuencia su nivel de vida. La señora Virginia espera poder incrementar su ganado de tal forma que gane lo suficiente para contratar a alguien que la ayude con el cuidado de las vacas y así no tener que depender de sus hijas y poder darles más tiempo para que se dediquen a estudiar y poder salir de la escuela con buenas notas y entrar a la universidad y así cumplir con el sueño de su esposo.
texts.en:
Virginia Blanca S. A. is 31 years old. She has 3 daughters, the oldest is 15 years old, the second oldest is 11, and the youngest is 9. The three children attend the school in the area and receive very good grades because they say they enjoy learning. They help take care of the cows in the afternoons after school. Virginia lives in the Monte Canto zone in Cochabamba, and in her house is where she has her milking cow who produces milk. All the milk that is produced is delivered daily to a local company that manufactures all types of dairy products. Her husband passed away less than 2 years ago, and he was the one who worked with the milking cow. But when he passed, she and her daughters had to start taking care of the cows. The loan will be used to purchase another milking cow in order to increase the milk production that they have, and that way they will increase their earnings and consequently their quality of life. Virginia hopes to be able to increase her earnings to the point when she can hire someone to help take care of the cows, so she does not have to depend on her daughters. This way they can dedicate more time studying and succeeding in school with good grades, attend a university, and complete the dream of her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a milking cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For growing corn

loans.name: Cyd Therese

texts.en:
Cyd Therese D. is from the town of Sapang Dalaga. She is 29 years old. Cyd Therese is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Cyd Therese owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Cyd Therese has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Cyd Therese joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cyd Therese is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Cyd Therese from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Las Bendecidas Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Las Bendecidas” esta representado por la señora Mónica y  integrado por 15 miembros los cuales se dedican a la venta de verduras, refrescos, comida, cosméticos entre los varones se dedican a la elaboración de pan y a la construcción de viviendas. La competencia dentro de su rubros es alta, pese a eso saben sacar adelante la actividad económica a la que se dedican. El crédito esta destinado al crecimiento de sus negocios con la compra de mercaderías, insumos y herramientas para mejorar más sus ingresos que les permitirá darles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias van cursando su primer ciclo dentro de la institución pero estan contentos de que se les brinde un apoyo económico que ayudada a generar mejores ingresos y a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
The “Las Bendecidas” Microfinance Institute, represented by Monica, is comprised of 15 members who sell vegetables, beverages, food, and cosmetics. The men in the group are in the bread making or home construction business. Despite the fact that competition is high, they know how to get head with their businesses. The loan will be used to expand their businesses by purchasing merchandise, supplies and tools so that they can increase profits, allowing them to offer their families a better quality of life. As far as their loan experience goes, the members are currently in their first loan cycle in our institute, but they are happy that they have been given the financial support that will help them generate better profits and improve their families’ quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Moju

texts.en: Moju lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She is 50 years old and married with 5 children. She sells kerosene in retail to her customers within her community. She hopes for the loan amount of N160,000 to purchase more kerosene to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Juliah

texts.en: Juliah is a 29-year-old mother of one who operates a clothing sales business in Nairobi’s Pipeline area. She has been in this business for three years. Juliah is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to add stock of new clothes to her business. She hopes to open multiple branches and educate her children to the highest level. She describes herself as hardworking and serious. About Faulu Kenya Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy more clothing stock.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora P. is currently in the business of selling various items in a retail shop, like coffee, beans, soap, etc., and is requesting a loan to stock more goods in her shop to sell. Flora is 35 years old and is married, with a husband that is a policeman. She has 4 children, and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more goods in her shop to sell

loans.name: Flavia

texts.es:
Flavia, de 41 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida.

El trabajo al que se dedica es la elaboración de “empanadas”, desde muy temprano por la mañana trabaja amasando y horneando sus deliciosas bocadillos, para luego distribuirlos a los distintos puestos y tiendas donde tiene contrato. Sus empanadas son muy solicitadas por las personas, es por eso que cada vez tiene más pedidos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que le brinda, ya que después de hacer las empanadas aprovecha para realizar otras actividades que le den buenos ingresos, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que levantarse temprano por las mañanas, ya que esto la cansa mucho. 
Para el futuro, espera poner una tienda donde pueda vender ella misma sus deliciosas empanadas.

Este es el primer préstamo de Flavia con MFP, está muy feliz por la oportunidad de crédito y sabe que tiene que invertir el dinero en su negocio para que sea más productivo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy activa. Los mil soles solicitados los invertirá en comprar más harina para poder producir una mayor cantidad de empanadas.
texts.en:
Flavia is 41 years old. She is a cheerful and hardworking woman who lives in her own home. What she wants most is to succeed in life.

Flavia makes empandas. She begins very early in the morning kneading the dough and baking these delicious snacks. Later she distributes them to different vending posts and stores that have a contract with her. Her empanadas are highly sought after by people, which explains why she receives many orders.

What Flavia enjoys most about her work is the freedom it provides. After she finishes making empanadas, she takes advantage of the time to pursue other activities to earn more income. She has been in the food business for 10 years and says the hardest part is getting up early since she gets tired often. In the future, she hopes to open a store where she can sell her empanadas directly.

This is Flavia’s first loan with MFP. She is very happy to have this opportunity and knows she has to invest the money into her business in order to be more productive. Flavia is a very active member of her Communal Bank. She will use the money to buy more flour so that she can produce a large quantity of empanadas.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long S., age 49, is a widow who works very hard to earn money for her family. She makes a living selling various kinds of fruits in a local market. She also sells beef soup from her home after she finishes selling fruit, and earns $5 a day from her work. Long S. receives help from her daughter, and is committed to make her business more successful and increase her income, She is applying for this loan to buy additional supplies and ingredients to sell to her customers

loans.use: To expand her business and make it more efficient and stable

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella B. is from the village of Cabaruan. She is 36 years old. Estrella is married, with children. To make a living, Estrella owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling Avon cosmetics products in the local community. Estrella earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Estrella joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estrella is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Estrella from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a forty-year-old, widowed, mother of three children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercially dominated community. Margaret works very hard to be able to provide for her family. She is a food vendor. She prepares and sells a local dish called ‘banku’. It is served hot, with soup. She sells on a tabletop by the roadside in her community. Margaret procures bags of maize and other ingredients from nearby communities. She has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to purchase maize, in bulk.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar, es una mujer muy respetuosa, vive en el distrito de Callería, región Ucayali, tiene 52 años, es madre de seis hijos, de los cuales uno depende de ella.
Pilar se dedica a la administración de su tienda de comestibles , esta actividad la realiza en su casa, es viuda. Pilar forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Américas”, desde hace cinco años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la implementación de su bodega, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1500 soles, que será invertido en la compra de productos para su bodega y arreglar su motocarro. La meta de Pilar es arreglar su negocio y ampliarlo dando servicio de fotocopias.
texts.en:
Pilar is a respectable woman who lives in the District of Callería, Ucayali Region. She is 52 years old, widowed, and the mother of six children, one of whom is still dependent on her. Pilar is committed to managing her grocery store, which is located in her home. She joined the “Las Américas” Communal Bank five years ago. The first loan she received was for 300 soles and was used to keep her store running. She now needs a loan of 1500 soles to buy products for her grocery store and to repair her motorcycle taxi. Pilar’s goal is to remodel her business and expand it by providing photocopy services.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store & pay for repairs to her motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Claudia Judith

texts.es: Claudia Judith L. D. A. D. 32 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador, capital del país. Vive junto a su esposo quien le ayuda en el negocio, y junto a sus tres hijos D. 9 y 4 años D. edad. Claudia posee una panadería, la cual desD. hace nueve años funciona en su casa, su esposo le ayuda a elaborar el pan, que posteriormente sale a repartir a todos sus clientes, incluso al mercado llamado La Tiendona, en donD. obtiene pedidos muy grandes. El deseo D. Claudia es crecer aún más en el negocio, D. manera que pueda atender mayor cantidad D. clientes, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo, a través del cual pueda comprar harina por mayor, levadura y todos los productos que se utilizan para la elaboración del pan, en cantidades grandes para obtenerla a menores precios. Esto sería D. mucho beneficio tanto para su negocio como para su familia quien depenD. absolutamente D. la panadería, ya que esta es la única fuente D. ingresos que poseen, razón por la cual se esfuerza día con día para brindar el mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Claudia Judith L. D. A. is 32 years old and resides in the department of San Salvador, the country's capital. She lives together with her husband who helps her with her business, and their 3 children. Claudia has a bakery which has functioned in her house for 9 years. Her husband helps her to make the bread, and later he leaves to proviD. it to all their customers, including the La Tiendona market, where she obtains large orders. Claudia's wish is to grow her business even more, in a way that allows her to attend to a larger quantity of customers. For this reason she is seeking a loan with which she can buy flour, yeast and all the products she uses to make the bread, in large quantities to obtain smaller prices. This would be of great benefit for her business as her family depends absolutely on the bakery, as it is the only stream of income they possess. This is theb reason why she works each day to proviD. her customers with a better service.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour and other ingredients to make bread

loans.name: Redempta

texts.en:
Redempta L., 42, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Jose L., a messenger, they are blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been selling ready-to-wear clothing for quite some time now.

Redempta has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times from CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her business.     

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 25,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying more clothes that she can incorporate into her product inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying more clothes that she can incorporate into her product inventory

loans.name: Nou

texts.en:
Mrs. Nou C. (pictured above), 55, and her husband, Mr. Chamroeun Chen, 60, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1980 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. The daughter has full-time employment and the two sons are attending University in Phnom Penh City. 

Nou sells Cambodian cake in her village. Her husband has been a primary school teacher for 30 years. Nou is requesting her first loan of $400 to add to her own money to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.use: To add to her own money to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.name: Agustin Guillermo

texts.es:
Agustín S. E., quien  Labora como Colector de Ruta en el Mercado Roberto Huembes de Managua, el tiene un hijo a su cargo,  y  este  se encuentra en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado siete crédito con CEPRODEL durante siete  año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales para el sistema eléctrico de su casa ya que este se encuentra en mal estado.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Agustín works as a sanitation engineer in the Roberto Huembes market in Managua. He is married has a school-aged son who he cares for. He has had seven previous loans through CEPRODEL over a seven year period and has used the loans to improve his home. He is asking for this loan in order to buy parts and material for the electrical system in his home, which is in need of repair. He wants to provide better living conditions for his family and a better life for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is a 25-year-old single man living with his parents and three brothers. He started his business by selling electricA. equipment from his home.  In 2008, he then rented a small shop to display his electricA. products. Now he also sells electricA. tools and home electricA. products. He works with his father and brothers to satisfy the family's needs. 

Samer is now requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase more products so he can offer a wider variety to his clients. He has informed the Loan Officer that he's planning to open a larger shop in the future and he's working hard to get to this point.

loans.use: To purchase more products for resale

loans.name: Paz Y Desarrollo Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. MARLENE, TIENE 40 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES CASADA Y TIENE 03 HIJOS, HACE OCHO MESES FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO "PAZ Y DESARROLLO", INTEGRADO POR 13 PERSONAS MUY ENTUSIASTAS Y TRABAJADORAS RESIDENTES DE LA ZONA DE COLLIQUE EN EL DISTRITO DE COMAS; QUIENES ELIGIERON A LA SRA. MARLENE COMO PRESIDENTA DE LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO.
ELLA REALIZA DOS ACTIVIDADES PARA OBTENER INGRESOS ECONÓMICOS, UNO ES LA VENTA DE ABARROTES, ACTIVIDAD A LA QUE SE DEDICA HACE 4 AÑOS Y POR OTRO LADO CONFECCIONA CARTERAS TEJIDAS HACE CUATRO MESES.
NOS COMENTA QUE A ELLA LE GUSTABA MUCHO EL TEJIDO Y SOLO LO PRACTICABA COMO UN PASATIEMPÒ, HASTA QUE UNA DE SUS CLIENTAS LE SOLCITÓ LE CONFECCIONE UNA CARTERA, ASI EMPEZÓ Y AL VER QUE PODÍA OBTENER INGRESOS EN ESE TRABAJO SE CAPACITÓ PARA PERFECCIONARSE. .
CON ESTOS NEGOCIOS HA PODIDO AUMENTAR SU MERCADERÍA DE ABARROTES Y COMPRAR LOS MATERIALES  PARTA LA CONFECCIÓN DE SUS CARTERAS.
UNA DE SUS METAS ES INSTALAR UN TALLER DE CAPACITACIÓN Y DAR CLASES DE TEJIDO A LAS PERSONAS QUE LO NECESITEN.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ UNA PARTE EN SU TIENDA DE ABARROTES Y EL RESTO EN MATERIALES PARA SUS TEJIDOS.
texts.en:
Marlene is 40 years old, married, and has three children. For eight months she has been part of the "Paz y Desarrollo" ("Peace and Development") group, which is made up of 13 very enthusiastic and hard-working residents of the Collique zone in Comas District. They chose Marlene to be President of their Board of Directors. She earns income through two businesses. One is grocery sales, which she has been doing for four years. For four months she has also been making knitted bags. She says she enjoyed knitting very much and only did it as a hobby, until one of her customers asked her to make a bag for them. That's how she got started, and she trained to improve her skills and see if she could make money with this work. With these businesses, she has been able to increase her inventory of groceries and buy the materials to make her bags. One of her goals is to build a training workshop and give knitting classes to people who need to learn. She will invest part of the loan in her grocery store and the rest in knitting materials.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of groceries and craft materials

loans.name: Banquito Nueva Alianza Group

texts.es:
ALCOM "BANQUITO NUEVA ALIANZA"

La alcancía comunal "BANQUITO NUEVA ALIANZA" está formada por 9 socias que trabajan con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, por 3 años y 4 meses, tiempo en que ellas han crecido socialmente y economicamente.
Erlicia es una de ellas, siendo madre de un pequeño niño, convive con su pareja que con su trabajo la apoya en lo que pueda.
Ella comenzó años atrás viajando a Trujillo, una ciudad conocida por elaborar buenos zapatos, para conseguir zapatos de calidad y a la vez baratos, con los cuales regresaba a Lima y los ponia en venta en su casa o salía a promocionarlos cerca de su casa entre vecinos, conocidos o por referencias; pero cuando tuvo a su primer hijo, no podia salir mucho de casa, por lo que con sus pocos ahorros y ayuda de su pareja abrió una bodega en casa, así podría cuidar a su bebe y tambien vender en su bodega para tener un ingreso más en casa.

Ahora Ercilia se dedica casi totalmente a su bodega que poco o poco a crecido, aunque cuando se presenta la oportunidad de que su pareja se quede cuidando al niño, ella puede nuevemente viajar a Trujillo para traer zapatos y así venderlos.
Ahora ella está planeando estudiar todo referente a los zapatos, para su confección y así ella misma producirlos y lograr completar uno de sus sueños, ser una gran empresaria en la confección y venta de zapatos.

Nota: en la foto se puede observar las socias que conforman este grupo, una de ellas vino acompañada de su pareja que se encuentra tambien en la foto.
texts.en:
The Alcancía Comunal “Banquito Nueva Alianza” (New Alliance Community Bank) is composed of 9 members who have been working with EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD for 3 years and 4 months: during this time both their social and economical conditions have improved. Ercilia Elena is one of them: she has a very young child and lives with her partner, who helps her through his job the best he can. A few years ago, she went to Trujillo, a town renown for the good quality of their shoemaking, to buy quality shoes at a good price and then sell them back in Lima from her house, to her neighbours and acquaintances. However, after she had the baby she couldn’t leave the hose that often, and for this she opened a small shop in the house with her savings and the her partner’s help. She was then able to take care of her child while keeping on selling shoes to bring one more income into the household. Right now Ercilia Elena dedicates herself almost completely to her shop, who has kept on growing little by little, and she takes advantage of the times when her partner is home and can look after their child to go back to Trujillo to buy shoes and sell them. She is planning on learning everything there is to know about shoes, especially how to make them and so begin producing them and succeeding in achieving one of her dreams: being a big entrepreneur in the production and sale of shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products to furnish her stall

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma G., 56 years old, is a married woman who supports her family by operating a general store. She lives in Barangay Talusan, Sagay City, Negros Occidental, with her husband, Roberto, who is 60 years old, and their eight adult children.

Norma has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1994 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 10,000.

Norma is now borrowing Php 29,500 to sustain the growth of her general store. This will be her 18th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 29,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.

Norma aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.


 About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital

loans.name: Wencelada

texts.es:
La Sra. Wencelada G. de 51 años de edad es vendedora de artículos  de almacén, ella es muy conocida en la zona de Villarrica. Tiene un hijo mayor de edad quien les ayuda en el reparto del producto. Empezó hace mas de 1 año con la ayuda de su pareja el Sr. Pedro G., quien trabaja haciendo fletes en la zona del mercado de la ciudad, cuenta con un carrito y un caballo.

Solicito dicho préstamo para la  compra de carbón en grandes cantidades, ya que estamos en la temporada de frío y es cuando aumentan los pedidos del producto; así como bolsas más pequeñas de diferentes pesos y así con su mayor distribución incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Wencelada G., 51 years old, sells basic household items for a living, and she is very well-known in the zone of Villarrica. She has an older son, who helps in the distribution of her products. She began this business over one year ago with the help of her partner, Mr. Pedro G., who works doing deliveries in the commercial zone of the city. They have a small car and a horse. Wencelada is applying for this loan to buy charcoal wholesale in large quantities, because it is already the cold season, and this is when the requests for this product increase. She wishes to buy smaller bags of charcoal of varying weights, and increase her income by selling these through her excellent distribution system.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale items for retail sale, such as large bags of charcoal to split up and sell in smaller quantities.

loans.name: Juliet Rose

texts.en:
Juliet Rose D. C., age 30, has been a member of ASHI since 2006. Her current request for a loan will be used to finance a business she plans for herself: a general store. She wants to help her husband support their family. For the past three years she has been busy taking care of their three small children, but now that the youngest child is three years old, she would like to do her part in earning money to provide for her family. 

Manuel, Juliet’s husband, is a construction laborer. He supports his wife’s decision to manage her own business. He believes that if his wife can procure capital for starting up her business, she has the capacity and ability to make it grow and become profitable. He knows that she is motivated by the desire to see her children happy and well-educated. Both Manuel and Juliet would like to see the children eventually graduate from college, an opportunity that they themselves did not have.

Juliet intends to purchase inventory items for her store. This will include foodstuffs, beverages, grocery items, and basic commodities.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs, beverages, grocery items, and basic commodities for her general store

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
Mrs. Rin S. (in the photo), 46, and her husband, Mr. Kosal Yoem, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River. They have been married since 2000 and have two sons. Both of the children are still young.  

Rin has been selling porridge and Khmer noodles in front of her home for 20 years. Her husband has been selling bananas for five years. He buys them from his fellow villagers and transports them to Phnom Penh to sell in the market. Rin is requesting her first loan for $700 to help her husband purchase bananas under contract for resale.

loans.use: To purchase bananas under contract for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Family expenses

loans.name: Zoya

texts.en:
Zoya is married with two children. She sells clothing at the central market in Novomoskovsk and has been in this business for ten years. During this time she has obtained many repeat customers who come again and again to buy clothing from her.

There is a high demand for this type of goods, so Zoya is going to continue developing her business. She has got enough energy and enthusiasm for this. Zoya also hopes that two her sons will continue this business in future.

Zoya would like to borrow 12,000 UAH to purchase seasonal clothing. She hopes to increase her sales and make additional income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: El Sr. Julio Cesar N. S.   él  es Trabajadora activo  de la Alcaldía Municipal Villa el Carmen desempeñándose como contador general, tiene  siete año de trabajar para esta empresa, es casado actualmente tiene dos niños en edad escolar. Ha tenido  ocho créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Julio Cesar N. S. has been employed as an Accountant by the City of Villa El Carmen for the last seven years. He’s married and has two school age children. He’s had eight CEPRODEL loans that he used to buy building materials and supplies for home improvements. They have been of great benefit to him in that they have improved his and his family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For paving stones, sand and cement.

loans.name: Luan

texts.en: Luan T. N. is 38 years old with 2 children. One of them is studying at Sport University. Paying for education fees is a big problem for her. To solve this difficulty, she has opened a shop that sells fresh vegetables in the local market. She can earn 100,000 VND profit per day. She joined SEDA in 2009, with a loan of 2,204,000 VND, which she used to expand her shop. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 5,014,000 VND to  invest in her shop.

loans.use: To invest in her shop.

loans.name: Cherryl

texts.en:
To make a living, Cherryl P. produces rice to sell. She is 33 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She is from the village of Bagacay, Sibutad. Cherryl has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,800 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2010, Cherryl joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Cherryl has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC which was used as additional capital for her business. Cherryl is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to redeem her pawned rice field. This will be her second loan from PMPC. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To redeem a pawned rice field

loans.name: Arv

texts.en: Arv K., 54, is widowed and resides with her three children in Kandal Province, Cambodia, an area known for fertile farmland for growing vegetables. K. produces roofs traditionally made from palm leaves, earning an income of USD 2 per day. The family has to spend USD 30 on food, USD 8 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 10 on other necessary expenses every month.  K. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase more roofs to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more palm leaf roofs to resell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina P. is a married woman who lives in Yulo Street, Brgy. 8, Isabela , Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating one business venture: a used clothing  business.  Her husband Alfredo P., who is 53 years old, works as a driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 6 children who are between 23 and 29 years old. 

Gina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 18 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 19th loan, she is borrowing PHP 30,000, which she intends to use to buy more used clothes to sell so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs. Gina P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase stock of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Phon N., 26, is married and lives with her husband in Takeo province. She is a garment factory worker and makes US $2 every day, while her husband sells coconuts and makes palm sugar. On average, he earns US $4 of profit a day. This couple has three children.

Phon N. would like to take out a loan of US $1,000 to invest in her husband’s palm sugar business.

loans.use: Buy equipment to make palm sugar and reinvest more.

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en:
Emelinda A. is from the village of Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 50 years old. Emelinda is married and has 9 adult-aged children. To make a living, Emelinda owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorela or habal-habal [motorcycle transport] services, as her husband is the driver to local community members. Emelinda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Emelinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelinda is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase tools needed to maintain the service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Emelinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools needed for maintenance of the service

loans.name: Mikoroshini Group

texts.en:
Monda K. is in his early thirties and is married. For the past five years, Monda has been running a broiler farm, where he breeds and sells broiler chickens. The business is open between 07:00 am and 05:00 pm and earns Monda a low monthly profit.

This will be Monda's first Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Mothisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. Monda aims to use this loan to increase the working capital of his business. He also aims to buy more broiler chicks to increase his stock. 

Monda will share this loan with his loan group Mikoroshini, which totals 11 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Monda can be seen in the front row leaning on the bench.

loans.use: Increase the capital of the business and buy new broiler chicks.

loans.name: Ihbayar

texts.en: Ihbayar S. is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in the Tuv province of central Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, within his father's fence. His oldest son attends a local secondary school and his youngest son is in a kindergarten. His wife is a seamstress and produces a variety of clothes out of her home according to her customers' orders. Using his own truck, Ihbayar operates a coal-trading business in his town. He began his business in 2008, and since then, he has made enough money to buy a new truck for his transportation business. His business earnings have enabled him to provide for his entire family. For the near future, he plans to buy his own house and fence. He is requesting a 800,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) loan in order to purchase necessary machinery parts for his truck and a large amount of coal to sell.

loans.use: To purchase necessary machinery parts and a large amount of coal

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina R. is from the village of Dicayas. She is 66 years old, married, and has 4 adult children. Florentina operates a family member's business, running a sari-sari (variety) store in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Florentina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,900 PHP from PMPC. Florentina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional goods to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Florentina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods

loans.name: Henry

texts.es:
Henry M. G., es el productor del mejor queso en Canalete de Alajuela.
El tiene más de 10 años  de estar en el negocio de la ganadería, siempre le ha ido muy bien pero  asegura que desea  pasar a otro nivel,  y comprar 3 vaquitas más. 
Es por eso que el necesita un préstamo de de  ₡598000 (Quinientos noventa y ocho mil colones). 
Esta inversión le permitirá aumentar y mejorar su producción, además espera poder vender las crías de sus vacas a  muy buen precio en la subasta de su Cantón
El es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Henry M. G. is the producer of the best cheese in Canalete de Alajuela. He has been in the cattle farming business for more than 10 years. It has always gone very well for him, but he assures that he wants to get to a higher level and purchase three more cows.

This is why he needs a loan for 598,000 Costa Rican Colones (CRC). This investment will allow him to increase and improve his production. In addition, he hopes to be able to sell the babies from his cows at a good price at the auction in his canton.

He is a member of the Canalete Communal Loan Company (Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete), one of the 100 member organizations within EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is in a business of selling retail goods. She is 39 years old and married with 2 children. All of her children go to school. She has taken a loan to stock more retail goods to sell. Anita hopes to pay for her children's school expenses with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: To stock more supplies of retail goods to sell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen O. O., age 31, is a seller of spare parts. His business is located in the busy town of Kakamega, which is in the region of Kenya known for production of sugarcane and is usually well known as the sugar belt region. He and his wife have one child to whom they hope to be able to offer a good education to the university level. 

Stephen has been in this business for the last two years and reports that his business is profitable. Despite financial constraints. he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 50,000 to buy auto parts to grow the business and meet the demand of his customers. He hopes to expand his business and in future open a larger auto parts supplier shop. He describes himself as hardworking, patient, and polite.

loans.use: To expand his spare parts business

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es: Ingrid tiene 32 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos pequeños en una casa heredada de sus padres. Desde su niñez ha estado dedicada a las tareas del campo, sus padres y su esposo la apoyan en esta tarea, es así que ahora  también siembra papa, maíz y verduras como espinacas, productos que son vendidos en la ciudad, asimismo almacena una parte para su consumo propio. Como es un trabajo arduo y lento, por lo que tiene que esperar un tiempo considerable hasta que pueda cosechar, mientras tanto aprovecha el tiempo comercializando prendas de vestir a sus clientes fijos que tiene,  que generalmente son personas que ya conoce y que son muy responsables en sus pagos. Afirma que le agrada realizar estos trabajos porque tiene disponible los alimentos para su propio consumo, además que se genera  ganancias futuras de la venta de los productos cosechados, por tanto seguirá con esa actividad por mucho mas tiempo. Es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y considera que su paso por el banco comunal fue una experiencia muy exitosa que la ayudó a adquirir el habito del ahorro y la responsabilidad de controlar bien sus cuentas. En esta ocasión el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de semillas de papa y sacos de abono.
texts.en: Ingrid is 32 years old. She lives with her husband and their two little children in a house inherited from her parents. Since her childhood, she has worked in the fields. Her parents and her husband support her in this work. Thus she has now also planted potatoes, corn, and greens such as spinach, products that are sold in the city. In the same way, she stores part of her crops for their own consumption. As it is an arduous and slow work, in which she has to wait a considerable time until she can harvest, she meanwhile takes advantage of this time to sell articles of clothing to her regular customers, who are generally people whom she already knows and are very responsible in their payments. She confirms that she likes to do these jobs because she has at hand the foods for their own consumption, in addition to the future earnings from the sale of the products she harvests. Therefore, she will continue with this activity for a long time. This will be the third time that she has had a loan with MFP, and she feels that going through the communal bank was a very successful experience that helped her acquire the habit of saving and the responsibility of controlling her bills well. At this time, she will use the loan she is applying for to invest in the purchase of seed potatoes and sacks of fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy seed potatoes and sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Zaheyya

texts.en:
Zaheyya is a young woman from Ramallah, married and a mother of one daughter and three sons. Zaheyya's husband runs an ornamental bird and flower store. He sells birds, their feed, and accessories needed when buying a bird.

Zaheyya took out a loan from FATEN so that her husband can purchase a larger variety of birds and feed for them.

Zaheyya's husband is photographed instead of her as she is a conservative woman.

loans.use: to purchase ornamental birds, feed, and bird accessories.

loans.name: Silvina

texts.es: La Silvina L. Domínguez es una mujer muy emprendedora que desde hace 1 año opto por poner un negocio en su misma vivienda, para tener un ingreso para sus gastos familiares.  La tienda es de abarrotes es denominada “Estanquillo Hernández” en la que ofrece variedad de producto para el consumidor como lo son los refrescos, botanas, tortillas de maíz, leche y mas. Esta es su única fuente de ingreso por lo que pide el apoya para comprar mayor producto para surtir su negocio.
texts.en: Silvina L. Domínguez is an enterprising woman who, a year ago, decided to set up a business in her own home to generate income to cover household expenses.  The grocery store is called "Estanquillo Hernández" and offers a variety of consumer products such as softdrinks, snacks, corn tortillas, milk, etc.  This is her only source of income, so she is in need of a loan to buy more products to stock the store.

loans.use: To buy products for her store

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen S. V. is 41 years old, married and the father of one.  

He runs Bridge Restaurant to earn a living. He has managed to stabilize the business through Faulu Kenya.  

He hopes to move the business to the city center, where he would be able to get more customers. 

He is now requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to buy crates of soda, seats and tables.

loans.use: To buy crates of soda, seats and tables.

loans.name: Fatima Del Socorro

texts.es: Este cliente es originaria de la comunidad el Hatillo es casada y tiene 1 hijo de 3 años, actualmente vive en león, su profesión es maestra de primaria y esta laborando en el colegio de hermita de dolores en león, donde tiene 5 años de ejercer esta profesión, con la empresa lleva 8 financiamientos recibidos para mejoras de vivienda y desarrollo familiar los cuales le han permitido mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida, ya que dicha inversión va dirigida para la compra de cerdos de desarrollo y compra de chinero para el hogar , la accesibilidad para llegar a su  centro de trabajo le es bastante favorable ya que le queda a 150 mts de distancia las que recorre saliendo a las 6 de la mañana para estar puntual con su horario normal.
texts.en:
The borrower is originally from the community of El Hatillo. She is married and has a 3-year-old son. Currently she lives in León. She works as a primary school teacher at the school Hermita de Dolores in León, where she has been for 5 years. 

She has received 8 loans with this business to make improvements to her home and for family development, which have allowed her to improve her living conditions and quality of life. This loan will go toward the purchase of developing pigs and a china hutch for her home. 

Her job is very convenient to her home, since it is only 150 meters away. She leaves at 6am to arrive on time for her normal schedule.

loans.use: to buy developing pigs and a china cabinet.

loans.name: Violeta Lucas

texts.pt:
Violeta Lucas nasceu na Cidade de Inhambane, Provincia do mesmo nome,Sul de Moçambique. tem 48 anos de idade, solteira estudou ate a 12ª classe não ingrenou no ensino superior por falta de condções, não tem filho pois ela é esteril. Responsabiliza se pela sua mãe e sobrihno. 

Saiu de Inhambane quando teve bolsa para Alemanha antiga RDA, onde fez uma formação proficional de dactilografia. Apois a Independência regressa a Moçambique onde comeca atrabalhar no Distrito de Namaacha na Escola Secundária como dactilógrafa onde trabalha a mais de 20 anos das 7:30 as 15:30h auferindo um valor mensal de 2.960.84mt. vive num quarto no internato da mesma escola então inicia sua obra com o fundo solicitado no BIM no valor de 20.000.00mt, mas não conseguiu concluir devido ao elevado custo do material e aproxima se a Hluvuku e Kiva solicitando um empréstimos para dar continuidade da mesma.


Ja teve emprestimo no BIM, pagou com miuto sucesso, conhece a Hluvuku atraves dos colegas que são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu quarto na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção( cimento, areia, portas e janelas e outros) para continuar com o melhoramento da sua casa. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 5.000.00mt, 8.000.00mt, 15.000.00mt para habitaéção.  

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para acedera outros créditos no futuro.
Pretende solicitar novos  empréstimos para concluir a sua casa.
texts.en:
Violeta Lucas was born in the city of Inhambane in the province of the same name in southern Mozambique.  She is 48 and single.  She finished through the 12th grade and didn’t enroll in higher education because of a lack of financial resources.  She doesn’t have children because she is sterile.  She is responsible financially for her mother and nephew.

She left Inhambane because she had a scholarship in former Western Germany, where she received formal training as a typist.  After the independence, she returned to Mozambique where she began  to work in the district of Namaacha in a high school as a typist where she has worked for more than 20 years from 7:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m.  She makes a monthly salary of 2,960.84 meticals.  She lives in a room at the boarding school at the same school.  She started work on her home with funds requested from BIM in the amount of 20,000 meticals.  She wasn’t able to finish it because of the high costs of materials, and she approached Hluvuku and Kiva to request loans to continue it.

She had a loan with BIM, which she paid back successfully.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through colleagues who are clients of the institution.  This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which she will use to buy construction materials (cement, sand, doors, windows, etc.) to continue improving her home.  The previous loans were in the amount of 8,000 and 15,000 meticals and were used for her home.

She promises to make her payments on time so she can take out additional loans in the future.  She hopes to request new loans to finish her home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, sand, doors, windows, etc.)

loans.name: Garduwo

texts.en: Garduwo is 47 years old and lives in the Jacob town area. She is married and has four children aged 4-17 years old, all of whom live with her and attend school. Garduwo has been involved in selling oil, rice, and pepper for the past five years. Her main challenge is that customers buy smaller amounts during the rainy season. She started this business with a small amount of money from her husband. It helps her send her children to school. Garduwo has requested this loan to purchase more oil, rice, and pepper. In the future, she wants to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, and pepper.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is married with two children. Corazon is 38 years old and lives in La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She sells a variety of products such as toothpaste, soap, and shampoo to earn a living and has had this business for 12 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5000 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of 3000 to purchase more variety of products such as soap and anything needed for household chores.

Corazon has been a member of PMPC just this year.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of products such as soap, toothpaste and any other household needs.

location.town: Liloy-La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna is a 34-year-old married young woman who lives in Jabalia refugee camp, which is located in Gaza Strip. She wants a loan of $1,000 to purchase home furniture since her husband, who is a Palestinian National Authority employee, has a decent salary that doesn't help him buy furniture in cash.  FATEN's loan is repaid on a monthly basis and will enable the family to have better furniture than what they have now, taking into consideration that Lubna lives in a refugee camp that is characterized by poverty. Lubna is in urgent need to get the loan in order to have the furniture, which will improve her daily life.

Lubna is a conservative woman. Therefore, her husband is photographed instead in the furniture shop.

loans.use: to purchase home furniture.

loans.name: Lorena Del Rocío

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Lorena, tiene 34 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación que tuvo tiene tres hijos de 17, 11 y 1 año, su hijo de 11 años estudia en escuela y el mayor trabaja.

Ella junto a su hijo se dedican al comercio, ellos venden mariscos, nos cuenta nuestra amiga que antes ellos recorrían la ciudad ofreciendo sus productos pero que luego que quedo embarazada de su último hijo ella solo vende en su casa y que su hijo es el que recorre con los productos en una moto de su propiedad por la ciudad y por los campos más cercanos, ellos llevan más de cinco años dedicados a esta actividad y gracias a Dios les va bien.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado, conchas, camarón, cangrejos, langostinos, etc. ya sea en el mercado mayoristas en Portoviejo o en Manta  hasta donde a veces  viajan para comprar mejores productos y más barato. Lleva dos años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le han brindado.
 
Sus metas son comprar un carro para llevar más productos.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'San Esteban' community bank meet in the town of Charapoto.  This town is known for its traditional culture and for the fact that it is located just a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we meet 34 year-old Lorena who is separated but has three children from her relationship.  Her children are aged 17, 11 and 1.  Her 11 year-old son is in school and her eldest son works.

Together with her son, Lorena sells seafood.  Our friend tells us that they used to go round the streets of town selling their products but since she became pregnant with her youngest child she now only sells from home.  Her son is the one who now drives a motorcycle that he owns through the streets of the town and the nearby countryside selling their products.  They have been in this business for more than five years and, thanks to God, it is doing well.

Lorena will use this loan to buy fish, seafood, shrimp, crabs, prawns, etc. either in the wholesale market in Portoviejo or in Manta.  Sometimes they travel there to buy better products more cheaply.  Lorena has been a member of her community bank for two years.  She likes it because of the help that they have given her.

Lorena's goal is to buy a car so that she can transport more goods.

loans.use: to buy fish, shellfish, shrimp, crabs, prawns, etc.

loans.name: Ramona Gladys

texts.es:
La señora Ramona, de 59 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Leon,es casada,tiene tres hijos, todos ellos mayores de edad,ella es comerciante y aprendio el oficio de costurera tambien, ello logro bachillerarse de la escuela secundaria.Hace 35 años ella se desempeño como costurera  pero hace 6 años dejo de dedicarse a la costura y decidio poner su negocio de pulperia el cual lo tiene en su casa ,lo puso con capital propio que tenia ahorrado y el apoyo de su esposo asi fue que logro tener su venta.
Requiere el prestamo para comprar inventario de productos tales como arroz,frijoles,carne,aceite,azucar,maiz.
Con esta inversion quiere abastecer su pulperia de productos para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes ,ofrecer nuevos productos  que no vendia antes para atraer mas clientes.Ella desea ampliar su negocio,poner una tienda de mercaderia en general,comprar dos vitrinas, comprar un freezer para vender carne. Su proxima meta es cambiar el techo de toda su casa y hacerles mejoras de infraestructura para ser mas atractivo su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Ramona is 59 years old and lives in the city of Leon.  She is married and has 3 children, all of whom are adults.  She is a merchant, but also learned the seamstress trade and she graduated from high school.  She worked for 35 years as a seamstress, but 6 years ago she decided to retire from this trade and open her own store which is located in her house. She started it with her own capital that she had saved and the support of her husband.  

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as rice, beans, meat, oil, sugar, and corn.   She wants to stock her store with products to satisfy her customer's demands and offer new products that she hasn't sold in the past to attract new clients.  She wants to expand her business, carry general merchandise, buy two showcases, and buy a freezer for meat.   Her next goal will be to replace the roof on her house and make other infrastructure improvements so that her business is more attractive to customers.

loans.use: purchase merchandise such as rice, beans, meat,oil, sugar, and corn.

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en:
Sophia is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 20 years, she has operated a mahamri (dumplings) selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 15,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and charcoal. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and charcoal.

loans.name: Muhtarkan

texts.en:
Muhtarkan, 58, is a resident of Tup. Unfortunately she is a widow; she has raised a daughter and a son. The daughter works in a kindergarten; she is married and lives separately with her family. The son works in construction; he lives with and takes care of his mom. Due to the high level of unemployment in Kyrgyzstan, in 1995 Muhtarkan started breeding cattle to make money. In rural areas it is the main source of income. With the loan Muhtarkan wants to purchase two cattle for breeding, fattening and reselling. In the future she wants to see her son get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase two cattle

loans.name: Noah

texts.en:
Noah, aged 32 years, is married and has three children. He lives in Narok town, Kenya. He has been an animal trader for the past four years. 

He is a humble client. He knew KADET LTD through other clients registered in his area of dwelling. He was introduced to KADET by another registered client and this will be his first loan with KADET. He intends to spend it by buying animals for sale.

He anticipates plowing the profit generated back into the farm, and he dreams to be a big farmer. He can do more if provided with resources.

loans.use: to buy animals for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a room

loans.name: San Lorenzo Group

texts.es:
En este  grupo se salieron  unas de sus imtegrantes por que sus negocios no funcionaron era mas lo que invertian en comprar lo que necesitan que lo que ganaban , pero a pesar de eso estan felices por que lo intentaron.
Las persona que entraron al grupo son: la señora Margarita,la señora Donaciana, la señora Sixta y el señor Candido quienes ya tiene su negocio pero desean hacerlo mas grande.
La señora Felicitas se dedica a la venta  de pan  ,e guta  ucho su negocio por que le deja muy buenas ganancias ya que desde muy pequeña se ha dedicado a la venta de pan po que mama ha eso se dedicaba.
En las fechas que tiene mas ventas es cuando hay bodas, bautosos y muertos ya que es cuando le encargan el pan tres dias antes .
Pidio el prestamo para comprar mas ingredientes para hacer pan como son: harina,huevo,manteca,levadura y royal.
Esta muy agradecida con su madre ya que fue ella quien le enseyo ese negocio y esta muy orgullosa de si misma por poderlo manegar , por que sus clientes estan muy contentos por el buen servicio que les brinda  y por hacer ese pan tan delicioso y por manos de una persona indigena que  tiene ganas de superarse.
Se siente contenta por que cuendo hay vacaciones y van personas al pueblo  le compran pan ya  que cuando  que cuando se van a regresar le compran por mayoreo para  que las otras personas lo prueben.
Le da las gracias a funadcion por el apoyo que le ha dado y por el interes que muestra por sus compañeras del grupo.
texts.en:
This group is called San L..  One of its members dropped out because her business didn’t work out; she was investing more in purchases than what she was earning in profits.  Despite this, however, she’s happy to have attempted it.

The people who joined the group are: Margarita, Donaciana, Sixta and Cándido who already have businesses and want to make them bigger.

Felicitas sells bread.  She likes her business very much because it produces good profits.  She’s sold bread since she was a little girl because her mother was also in this occupation.

The dates when she sells most is when there are weddings, baptisms or the Day of the Dead because orders are placed three days ahead of time.

She requested the loan to buy more ingredients to make bread like: flour, eggs, shortening, yeast and Royal baking powder.

She is very grateful to her mother because she taught her this business and she’s very proud of herself for being able to manage it and because her customers are very happy for the good service she provides and because the bread she makes is so delicious and made by an indigenous person who wants to improve herself.

She feels happy because when it is vacation season people come to the town and buy bread from her and buy it at wholesale to take it back to where they came from so other people can taste it.

She thanks the Fundación for the support it’s provided and for the interest it shows for her fellow group members.

loans.use: to buy bread baking supplies.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a farmer and a father of 7 children with the last three still in school. He lives with his family in the Kitale area of Western Kenya where he has been practicing mixed farming for 30 years. He currently employs one farmhand and produces beans, maize, milk and vegetables for the local market.

William has requested a loan of 52,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable him to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says farming has been his sole source of income and the loan will enable him to provide his family with increased income. He wants to acquire three more dairy cows in the future.

William acknowledges the challenge posed by fluctuating milk prices and rampant animal diseases.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Wily

texts.en:
Wily is 40, married and has three school-age children. He owns and manages their farm, planting and harvesting corn and vegetables for sale. As a responsible father, he wants to continue sending their children to school and give them a bright future. Although being a farmer is not easy, through his patience and perseverance, he can support his family. 

He plans to expand his corn plantation to increase his yields. But due lack of capital, he is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and pay labor costs required in planting corn. 

He said that his loan will greatly help him to expand his corn plantation. He is expecting to have a plentiful harvest this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and to pay labor costs required in planting corn.

loans.name: Marina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Marina, trabaja como secretaria en un instituto, es madre soltera y vive junto a su madre, lleva 11 años trabajando todos los días desde las siete de la mañana hasta las tres de la tarde, ella provee para su familia todo lo necesario.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de arena, cemento, ladrillo, para la construcción y reparación de la vivienda donde habita con su familia. 
La aspiración de marina es que a través de un esfuerzo puedan mejorar las condiciones de su familia
texts.en:
Marina works as a secretary in a school. She is a single mother, and lives with her mother. For eleven years she has been working every day from 7:00am to 3:00pm. She provides her family with everything they need. 

Currently, she is applying for a loan in order to buy sand, cement, and bricks for construction and repairs on the house where she lives with her family.

Marina's ambition is that through effort, she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy sand, cement and bricks.

loans.name: Venney

texts.en:
Venney is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. 
For the past three years, Venney has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells food and home supplies to local customers. To help expand her business, Venney has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sugar, soap, and cooking oil, and will help Venney to generate greater profits and pay her children's school fees. Venney hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 
Venney is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Venney's future prospects by helping her learn how to save and manage her money.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, soap, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Consolee

texts.en: Consolee is 67 years old and has three children. She sells cassava in a shop she has run for four years. She would like to buy more cassava to sell in her store and also add new products such as beans and sorghum. Consolee will use any profits to create savings and support her family.

loans.use: to buy more cassava for sale.

loans.name: Grima

texts.es:
Grima, de 30 años, es una mujer amable y muy trabajadora, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos de 11 y 3 años, ellos comparten sus vidas juntos en la casa propia que pudieron comprar en base a esfuerzo y arduo trabajo. EL trabajo de Grima consiste en la compra y venta de madera, desde muy temprano sale de su casa a los diferentes aserraderos de la ciudad en donde busca los mejores trozos de madera para así poder comprarlos y llevarlos a realizar el proceso de acabado, el resultado que obtiene son tablas, listones y otros, toda esta actividad las realiza con su ayudante, el productos terminado es enviado a sus clientes de la diversas ciudades del país, lleva ya cinco años con este trabajo y esta muy contenta por que le permite tener ingresos buenos a la economía de su hogar. Al principio era muy complicado para ella realizar este trabajo ya que es pesado y muy cansado, pero con el tiempo fue acostumbrándose y ahora trabaja sin ninguna dificultad y a un buen ritmo, desea poner un negocio en su casa ya que esta en proceso de crear un nuevo negocio que le permita generar más ingresos. Este será el crédito número 5 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio, ella por su parte se compromete una vez mas a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual así como lo hizo en sus créditos anteriores, esta muy feliz de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy amables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 3000 soles, comprará madera para su aserrado y su posterior envío a diversos lugares del Perú.
texts.en:
Grima, 30, is a kind, hardworking woman living with her spouse and two children who are 11 and 3 years old.  They share their lives together in their own house that they were able to buy thanks to much effort and hard work.  

Grima’s work consists in buying and selling lumber.  She leaves home very early to visit the city’s various sawmills looking for the best cuts of wood to buy and take to finish.  The results she obtains are boards, slats and others.  She does all this work with help from an assistant and the finished products are sent to customers in various cities in the country.  She’s been in this business five years and is very happy because it allows her to earn good income for her home’s economy.  At the beginning it was very complicated for her to do this work which is very heavy and exhausting but in time she got used to it and now she works problem-free and with a good pace.  She wants to set up a home-based business that will allow her to earn higher income.

This will be MFP loan #5.  She is very happy to know that she can count on having financial support because that way she will feel sure to advance with her business.  She commits once again to make her payments punctually like she did with previous loans.  She is very happy to belong to her communal bank because all the members are very kind and supportive.  She will use the requested 3000 soles to buy lumber for her sawmill to then send to various places in Perú.

loans.use: to buy more lumber.

loans.name: Charles Murabu

texts.en:
Charles is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. He sells fruits, a business he began using the savings he made from employment at a hotel. 
He is applying for a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to purchase fruits and groceries to sell. 
The main challenge he faces is the seasonal weather. He intends to open a restaurant and a fast food business in the future. He will use the extra income from the business to develop his plot.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fruit vending (banana) and fruit farming business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years now.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers for her bananas. In the future, Jennifer would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her bananas.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Eva is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. 

Eva has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Eva is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Eva hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a 41-year-old widow from southern Israel. She raises sheep and sells the milk and labane cheese she produces.

Miriam needs this loan to purchase additional sheep to meet production demands.
