Miriam wants to continue and see her business strengthen and expand. She strives one day to build homes for her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional sheep to meet production demands

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: La señora Paula es casada y vive con dos hijos dependientes, sus habitaciones, tienda de barrio y granja pequeña se hallan ubicadas en Sumumpaya a ocho kilómetros de la ciudad de Cochabamba, una zona netamente lechera,al mismo tiempo con sus remanentes de la leche ha construido una habitación extra hacia la calle para habilitarla como tienda de barrio donde vende artículos como arroz, pan, leche, huevos, azúcar, refrescos y gaseosas y es para esta actividad que necesita un poco de capital porque los clientes y vecinos que adquieren los artículos no siempre pagan al contado, ella tiene un sistema de crédito cada 15 a 30 días y necesita capital por tal motivo, con la tienda le da trabajo a su hija que le ayuda también con la crianza de las vacas.
texts.en:
Paula is married and lives with two dependent children. 

Their rooms, neighborhood store and small farm are located in Sumumpaya, 8 km. from the city of Cochabamba, an area known for its dairy. 

With the milk profits she has built an extra room facing the street used as a neighborhood store.  She sells items like rice, bread, milk, eggs, sugar, soft drinks and soda water. 

The clients and neighbors who buy the goods do not always pay in cash so she needs a bit of capital. She has a 15 to 30 day credit system which is why she needs some capital. 

The store also gives work for her daughter who also helps with raising the cows.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Jamoliddin

texts.ru:
Чамолиддин молодой жизнерадостный мужчина 38 лет. Он женат и имеет шестерых детей. Чамолиддин живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Чамолиддин очень добрый и отзывчивый человек, который всегда готов помочь тому, кто нуждается в помощи. 
Семья Чамолиддина всегда занималось выращиванием скота. Он покупает на базаре скот, потом откармливает его и перепродает. Жена Чамолиддина всегда помогает ему в этом. Если у скота рождается потомство, то Чамолиддин оставляет его у себя. Полученное молоко они продают своим соседям. Соседи всегда довольны, потому что продаваемое Чамолиддином молоко всегда свежее и вкусное.  Вот уже 11 лет он занимается этим делом, от этого дела он получает хороший стабильный доход.
В данный момент Чамолиддин хочет приобрести корм для скота на зиму, для этого ему нужны денежные средства.
Он заранее благодарить «Арванд» за предоставленную помощь и надеется положительный результат.

loans.use: for the purchase of livestock feed

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Mrs. Vero A., a 55 years old woman living in a semi-rural area in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria, sells firewoods for a living, married with six (6) children. She hopes for the above amount for the expansion of her fire wood business.

loans.use: To buy more of firewoods for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She would like to buy 6 bundles of iron sheets and 2700ft of timber

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha lives in her own home on Ricardo Bustamante Street in the Villa Nuevo Potosi neighborhood. She is 45 years old. Her husband has health problems and lives in Santa Cruz so Martha cares for their children in La Paz. She has been selling fruit for ten years. This loan is to increase her working capital. At this time she sells the fruit wholesale as it arrives from El Alto and sells the remainder at her stand on Buenos Aires Avenue in La Paz. Her previous history with IMPRO gives her favored status so she can receive this loan.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer

Martha vive en casa propia en la calle Ricardo Bustamante de la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí; tiene 45 años de edad, el esposo tiene problemas de salud por lo cual el vive en Santa Cruz, ella se hace cargo de sus hijos en la ciudad de la Paz, se dedica a la venta de fruta desde hace mas de 10 años con lo cual mantiene a su familia. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital ya que ahora vende al por mayor cuando llega la fruta en la Ciudad de El Alto y lo que sobra vende en su puesto ubicado en la Av. Buenos Aires de la ciudad de La Paz. Su antecedente histórico con Impro, la califica como cliente preferencial y puede acceder un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Amarilis

texts.en:
Amarilis P. F., 43, makes beautiful paper wreaths for funerals and for All Saints' Day. She makes them to order and also sells in her father's casket shop. The three-foot-diameter wreaths come in whole array of colors. She can make up to a dozen in a day and sells as many as four dozen a month for a profit of 300-400 Quetzals (US$40-$50). With this credit she will buy the materials for her products: paper, paint, and the plastic packaging. At some point she wants to expand into making papier mache piñatas and candles, but the materials for those are more expensive.

Amarilis is married and has three children, all in school. She's thankful that all are in good health. She's a member of the group of women "Barrio Llovizna" and is on her third loan.

loans.use: Purchase paper, paint, plastic packaging for artificial funeral flower wreaths

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Sam O., 37, and her husband live in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia with their 3 children. Sam O. is a grocer and earns $5 a day, whilst her husband is a fisherman and earns $3.50 a day. Of their 3 children, one works at a garment factory and 2 are students. Sam O. is requesting this $600 loan so that she can repair her house, in order to provide her family with a safer and more comfortable environment. In the future she would like to open a stall at the local market for her grocery products.

loans.use: To repair their house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase 10 bales of used clothes to expand her business.

loans.name: Mirna Enith

texts.es:
Mirna belongs to a community bank called La Familia. She lives in Asentamiento Humano Juanita Alcántara C 11, in the district of Calleria within the state of Ucayali. She is married, 50 years old, and a mother of 3 who are still dependent on her. She is a primary school teacher and a wife of a chauffeur, but their income is insufficient to meet their living costs. This is the reason Mirna decided to invest in timber with the first loan of $100 she received from Manuela Ramos. This was in association with her son-in-law.

Currently, her timber sales have increased due to the demand for this resource in the large region she resides. Every morning, Mirna wakes up early to make breakfast and brings her children and grandchildren to school. She is very happy.

The next loan will be paid back in 4 months. She will buy 2 cylinders of fuel to transport her timber. One-third of the loan (S/. 600) will be used for transport costs. She will also buy 1 power saw and the rest will be invested in various timber (Quinilla, Cedar, and a bit of mahogany).

Mirna is very grateful to Manuela Ramos since it has been the means for the loan to be granted to her. She was enabled to develop her timber business and tend to other things that she could not: move her timber and sell them.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Mirna pertenece al banco comunal La Familia, vive en el Asentamiento Humano Juanita Alcántara C 11, del Distrito de Calleria del departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 50 años y es madre de 3 hijos que aun dependen de ella, está casada. Es profesora de primaria y su esposo es chofer, pero el ingreso que tienen no alcanza para los gastos del hogar, es así que Mirna, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 (US$ 100.00) decidió invertir en el negocio de la madera, esto en asociación con su yerno.

En la actualidad, su negocio de compra y venta de madera ha aumentado debido a la demanda de ese recurso en nuestra región, ya que nuestra ubicación geográfica es muy grande. La señora Mirna se levanta temprano para hacer el desayuno y después lleva a sus hijos y algunos nietos a la escuela, esto la hace muy feliz.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,800, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 2 cilindros de combustible para transportar su madera, pagará S/. 600.00 en transporte, comprará 1 motosierra, y el resto lo invertirá en madera (Quinilla, Cedro y un poco de Caoba).

Mirna está muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos, ya que por medio del préstamo que le dieron, ella pudo aumentar la compra de madera, así mismo de algunas cosas que le hacían falta para poder trasladar su madera y venderla acá.

loans.use: Buy fuel, one power saw, and timber

loans.name: Abdurahmanov

texts.en:
Abdurahmanov I. lives in Spitamen; he is married and has 3 children.  He has been a client of MicroInvest since 2005 and he recommended himself as a serious and strongly-motivated client.  Loan sums are continually increased, which shows business stability and income increase.  

Mr. Abdurahmanov is engaged in food production (preparation of the different pies and doughnuts, national pies named “cheburecky” and sambusa).  He is very experienced in this business.  

Working in the trade sphere he has stiff competition, which is why he wants to widen the existing business by new recipes preparation.  It allows him to increase the family income and to plan new business development.  Mr. Abdurahmanov requests a loan of $300 to further develop his business.

loans.use: For business development

loans.name: Adolfo Candido

texts.es:
Adolfo is 49 years of age and married. His wife is 42 years old. They reside in the Lomalinda neighborhood of Sierra Maestra, a rural area near the city of Managua. Adolfo is a small merchant that is dedicated to the manufacture and sale of coal and to the breeding and fattening of hogs, pelibuey sheep and chickens. He also cultivates the wheat himself that he feeds to his animals. The wife of Adolfo is dedicated to the preparation and sale of food, which she sells at noon and at night. These activities occupy Adolfo’s entire day since he has to take time to care for his animals and he also leaves to sell in the markets, chiefly coal. They need money to buy hogs and pelibuey sheep to fatten and sell. Also they will buy necessary vegetables for the preparation of the foods that they sell daily. In this manner this couple has done well and generated the necessary income to live. Adolfo puts a lot of effort into this activity, because he enjoys the interaction with his animals.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Adolfo tiene 49 años de edad, es casado, su esposa tiene 42 años, habitan en el barrio Lomalinda, Sierra Maestra. Un lugar rural de la ciudad de Managua. Adolfo es un pequeño comerciante que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de carbón, a la crianza y engorde de cerdos, pelibuey y gallinas. También el mismo cultiva el trigo con el que le da de comer a sus animales. La esposa de Adolfo se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida, estas ventas la hace al mediodía y por la noche. Esta actividad le ocupa todo el día a Adolfo ya que tiene que dedicarle tiempo al cuido de sus animales y también sale a vender a los mercados, principalmente el carbón. Necesitan el dinero para comprar cerdos, pelibuey para su engorde y venta, también comprarán verduras necesarias para la elaboración de las comidas que venden a diario. De esta manera es como esta pareja ha salido adelante y generar los ingresos necesarios para vivir. Adolfo le pone mucho empreño a esta actividad, porque le gusta mucho la interacción con sus animales.

loans.use: To buy hogs and pelibuey sheep to fatten and sell.  Also to buy vegetables for preparing foods for sale.

loans.name: Jesus Nuestra Esperanza Group

texts.en:
Dulce (pictured center with a black blouse) is a sweet 50-year-old woman who lives with her husband and grandchild in the village of Las Avispas Mamon. She has three adult children (ages: 35, 30, 28). Currently, she sells popular varieties of beans and vegetables at a small roadside stand, but she has big dreams for her future. She wants to open up a school/community center for homeless children in the area. She said that she already knows exactly what building she wants to buy, but she is just waiting to save up enough money to get it! She told us that she has wanted to do this for several years, but now she believes it will happen soon.

This community is located in Puerto Plata, on the north coast of the Dominican Republic. The group is pictured above with their loan officer at Esperanza's office in the capital city of the province. This will be the first loan for the entire group, and they are all very excited. The women come from both Haitian and Dominican backgrounds, and ages range from 23 to 50. This is a very dynamic and diverse group of women, and Esperanza is confident that they will be a great asset to each other and the community as a whole.

Oh behalf of the women, and Esperanza, we would like to thank you for your support and generosity!

loans.use: Purchase food staples for cooking

loans.name: Jovina

texts.es:
Jovina is single. She has had a general store in her own house for 6 years. She has many customers and is well-regarded in the neighbourhood for the good service she offers her clients.

In her store she sells items such as sugar, milk, yogurt, juice, soft drinks, candy, fruit, vegetables, rice, bread, eggs, oil, flour etc.

The loan she is asking for will be used to buy larger quantities of items in order to get cheaper prices and thus be more competitive. The investment will allow her to earn greater profits that she will be able to save. She is planning to construct a larger room opposite her house in which to locate her store.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

Jovina es soltera, tiene una despensa en su domicilio particular desde hace 6 años, tiene mucha clientela y es muy reconocida en el barrio por el buen trato que brinda a sus clientes.

En su negocio vende artículos como azúcar, leche, yogurt, jugos, gaseosas, golosinas, frutas, verduras, arroz, panes, huevos, aceite, harina, etc.

El crédito solicitado es para compra de mercaderías en cantidad, teniendo en cuenta que de esa forma consigue mejor precio y puede ser más competitivo. Dicha inversión le va a permitir obtener mayores beneficios que podrá ahorrar, pues la menta de Jovina es poder construir un salón más grande frente a su casa para ubicar su despensa ahí.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, flour, meat

loans.name: Halima's Mkombozi Group

texts.en:
Halima is 40 years old and is a married woman with 4 children. Halima owns a small salon, which she started in 1993. Every day, she works from 8am to 10pm at her business.

In the past, Halima has taken out and repaid two loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more salon items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Riziki, Pendo, and Kuruthum, who have a cafe and a shop, and sell clothing.

loans.use: To buy more salon items for her business

loans.name: Ghulam Ishaq

texts.en:
G. Ishaq, son of G. D., is a 24-year-old young man. He is married and has two children. Because of the war in his home country of Afghanistan during the last 30 years, he could not attend school or continue his limited education, so he has worked instead with his father as a farmer.

Unfortunately, he does not have enough money to buy many seeds and other necessary goods in order to increase his crop yield and to thereby generate greater income for his family. As such, G. Ishaq is seeking a loan in the amount of $650 (30,000 Afghanis) to accomplish this purpose, and he will repay the loan in 24 months.

loans.use: To increase his crop yield by purchasing additional agricultural seeds

loans.name: Tolusefulu

texts.en: Tolusefulu I., 52, is married with six children. Her husband does the fishing and gets some help from his two boys. She has many years of experience in the fishing business. She sells to the village and general public 4 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~$187 USD). SPBD loans are Tolusefulu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her earnings will be used to improve her fishing business and help out with family expenses.

loans.use: Tolusefulu would like to purchase another fishing net and canoe for fishing and also to improve his home.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 32 years old and married. She became a clothing (khanga) seller in 2004. Every day, she works from 9 a.m. to 10 p.m. at her business, earning a monthly profit of about $110 from the sales.

Amina now hopes to receive a loan to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of additional clothes (khanga) for sale

loans.name: Kung

texts.en:
Mrs. Kung S. is a villager in Preak Roka Village in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She is a cow breeder who is raising two cows. She is a 43-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is a garment factory worker while the other is attending school. 

Since her first child's workplace is far from home, and Mrs. Kung S. usually spends a lot of money on travel, Mrs. Kung S. is asking for a loan to to buy a motorbike for her child. She hopes to increase her income and savings in this way.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her child

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Mrs. Kim S. T. is a villager in Thmor Reap Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She rears pigs and currently has eight of them. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she is requesting a loan to buy five more piglets for breeding. She will buy more pig feed with the rest of the loan. Her husband, Mr. Him Chanthar, is a soldier who earns  a modest income to support the household. Mrs. Kim S. T. is 41 years old and the mother of three children who all attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy five more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Yon

texts.en: Mr. Yon K. is a villager in Pdaouv Chum Kiet village in Kampong Cham Province. He owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Kean Pho, is a pig breeder. She is on the left of the photo. Mr. Yon K. does not have enough money to earn a living. Thus, Mr. Yon K. decided to ask for a loan to buy five piglets to add to his business. He hopes to increase his income and improve his living conditions with this loan. He is 32 years old and the father of three children, two of whom are attending the local school, while the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy five piglets to add to his business.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita K. is 42 years old. She is a wife and mother of three children. Currently all the children are in school. Selling for the past ten years, she has gained lots of experience in her business. She treks to farming communities to buy her stock of maize from the farmers. This saves her from middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at a higher price. She wants to use the loan to buy maize in bulk to meet the daily demands of her customers. She hopes to save enough money to sponsor her children's education. Rita is a member of a community group called ‘Angels Trust Group’. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Khursheda

texts.en:
Khursheda A. has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2005. Khursheda is 30 years old. She lives in Khujand. Khursheda is married with 3 children. In the local bazaar, she sells roller towels, jack towels, tea towels and bath towels, fabric, and warm plaids. She has been engaged in this business for 2 years.

Mrs. Khursheda A. is applying to KIVA, requesting a business development loan of 4000 STJ for 2 months for business travel to China (importing a new assortment of goods). She thanks KIVA for support.

loans.use: business travel to China

loans.name: Pedro Sergio

texts.es:
u nombre es Pedro Sergio G. su edad es de 64 años, su estado civil es casado, Don Pedro tiene 4 hijos de los cuales todos son casados y viven de manera independiente, su compañera de vida labora de costurera ejerciendo la actividad económica en su casa de habitación  ya que ambos les gusta realizar trabajos humildes pero dignos, los propósitos de Don Pedro es mantener estable su negocio debido al precio del combustible que no se encuentra estable y esto ocasiona inestabilidad para su familia, sus sueños son de que sus hijos cuenten con otra fuente de ingresos para que el día de mañana este no sea un inconveniente para ellos mismos su deseo es de tener suficiente dinero para suplir las necesidades de su familia por lo que en estos momentos la compra para los productos básicos es mas costosa por lo que cada día la vida esta mas difícil y es por eso que necesita luchar para mantener a su familia.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es conduciendo un taxi, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 27 años, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, Don Pedro inicia este negocio por la necesidad de adquirir una fuente de ingresos para su familia ya que tenia que proporcionar el sustento diario por lo que por medio de un amigo adquirió el derecho de la ruta con un dinero que le prestaron por un familiar sin intereses y con las ganancias que generara  el negocio pagaría el dinero por lo que desde esos momentos se convirtió en una persona emprendedora por lo que tenia a sus 4 hijos a su cargo y tenia que prepararlos profesionalmente durante estos 27 años Don Pedro a cambiado su unidad de transporte en 4 ocasiones y esto sucedió a la exigencias de la cooperativa donde esta afiliado y debido a la necesidad de ofrecer un mejor servicio a los usuarios por lo que todavía necesita realizar un financiamiento destinado para             las reparaciones del vehiculo por lo que tiene que buscar los repuestos en Managua ya que ahí le resulta mas favorable la compra de estos repuestos.
texts.en:
His name is Pedro Sergio G.. He is 64 years old and married. Don Pedro has four children, all of whom are married and live on their own. His life partner works as a seamstress in their one-room house, since both of them wish to do humble but dignified work. Don Pedro's goal is to keep his business stable even though the price of fuel fluctuates and causes instability for his family. His dream is for his children to have another source of income so that in the future this fluctuation doesn't cause them any problems. For himself and his partner he dreams of having enough money to provide for his family's needs, since purchasing basic staples has become more expensive. This makes life more and more difficult and obliges him to struggle to support his family. He earns a living as a taxi driver. He's had his business for 27 years. Don Pedro began the business in order to create a source of income for his family, since he needed to provide for their day-to-day needs. Through a friend he managed to acquire the route rights with money loaned to him interest-free by a relative, and with the profits the business generates he'd repay the loan. So from that moment he became an enterprising person, having four children to take care of and prepare for the world of work. Over the past 27 years Don Pedro has changed vehicles four times, as required by the cooperative with which he is associated, in order to offer better service to his clients. He seeks financing to pay for vehicle repairs, for which he'll have to look for parts in Managua, since they can be found at more affordable prices there.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: vehicle repairs

loans.name: Alima

texts.en: Alima G., 45, is married and has five children in high school. Alima lives with her family at Madina, in Ghana. She runs a small provisions store in her neighborhood. She has been in business for twelve years. Alima buys her goods from wholesalers in the city and treks to markets in nearby towns. She says that she also supplies her products to other food vendors in her community. Alima would like to have a larger working capital. She wants to buy goods in bulk whenever she travels to the city to save her the problem of frequent trips. Alima is in a loan group called “Miracle”. The group members guarantee each another as collateral to insure the loan.

loans.use: To procure provisions

loans.name: Bulat

texts.en:
This is Bulat S.. She is 34 years old and her main activity is raising cattle. She learned this skill from her brother who was involved in this business for more than 5 years. He raised cattle and sold them to meat suppliers who paid quite well. S. is married and has two children, a boy who is 13 years old and a girl who is 11 years old. Both are pupils and they dream of becoming doctors in the future. Tto support her children, Serafina decide to borrow from MicroInvest to increase the number of cattle. She presently has 3 cows but she wants to sell them to the meat suppliers. 

S. thanks MicroInvest for the loan, and MicroInvest thanks the Kiva lenders who help our entrepreneurs.

loans.use: increase the number of cattle

loans.name: Leung

texts.en:
Leung C. is 45 years old and resides with her husband in the Kampong Chhnang province. Since 2005, she has had businesses making rice wine and raising pigs. On average, she makes $5 per day. Her husband stays at home and helps her with making the wine and raising pigs. This couple has seven children.

Leung C. is asking for a loan to purchase food to feed the pigs and rice to make wine.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and rice

loans.name: Kaiva

texts.en: Kaiva G., 52, is married and has seven children. For the last three years, she has made a living in the fishing business, selling her catch to the public every day of the week. She has three previous loans with SPBD, and expects her weekly net cash flow to be about $354. SPBD loans are Kaiva’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets, gear and boats

loans.name: Protazio's Group

texts.en: Protazio Z. is one of the executive members of Kasenyanku group in Mpigi. He is a very hard-working man and has sixteen children, eleven of whom are in school. The rest are still young. Protazio has a shop that sells new clothes like gomesi (a puff-sleeved dress) for ladies, trousers for men and women, shirts, dresses and skirts. It is due to his hard work and determination that he was able to set up this shop, having worked in daily markets with no store of his own from which to sell his own goods. He is grateful to his customers for his business and to Pearl Microfinance, a Kiva field partner, for without them, he would be badly off.  He is again asking for a loan to purchase additional inventory. His dream of having many shops selling the same goods still prevails.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María es una mujer muy comprometida con el progreso de su familia, la cual está conformada por su esposo y sus dos hijos menores de edad, con quienes vive hace 15 años en la casa que junto a su esposo lograron adquirir. Al poco tiempo de casada abrió una tienda en su casa, la cual va progresando con el paso de los años, ya que en sus inicios sólo vendía productos de primera necesidad, más ahora tiene instalada una librería en un espacio de su tienda, donde exhibe algunos cuadernos y útiles escolares. Su progreso fue a causa del trabajo que realiza todos los días a partir de las 6 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, tiempo que está a disposición de sus clientes y de su familia. Sin embargo, el espacio que tiene es muy reducido y requiere de algunos arreglos, pues posteriormente desea instalar un bazar para incrementar sus ventas y ofrecer a sus vecinas productos, que en su mayoría, son difíciles de obtener por la lejanía de los mercados y centros comerciales. Este es su treceavo crédito con MFP, los años que lleva en su grupo, aproximadamente 7, la han ayudado a mejorar sus habilidades sociales y de negocio. Los 2000 soles que solicita los requiere para mejorar su pequeña librería, pues le hacen falta algunos muebles y útiles de escritorio, que son altamente demandados.
texts.en:
María is a woman who is very committed to the progress of her family, which includes her husband and her 2 young sons. Together with her family, she has lived for the past 15 years in the house that she and her husband were able to acquire together. Shortly after their wedding, she opened a store in their house, which has grown more successful over the years. Beginning only by selling basic staple products, today she has installed a book store section in a part of her store, in which she displays folders and other school items. Her success is the result of the work that she carries out every day from 6 in the morning to 7 at night, time during which she must attend to both her customers and her family. None the less, the space that she has is very small and is in need of some repairs, so she wishes in the future to install a proper storefront. Doing so would enable her to increase her sales and offer products to her neighborhood that, for the most part, are difficult to obtain on account of the far distance of the markets and malls. This is her thirteenth loan with MFP. She has been with the group for approximately 7 years, during which time they have helped her to improve her position both socially and with regard to her business. The 2000 soles that she requests is what she requires to improve her small book store, which is in need of various pieces of school furniture and school supplies, all of which are highly demanded by her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: The two people shown in the picture are Mrs. Chan S. and her husband. She is 48 and lives in Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia, where she has been running a business selling a few products for kids in front of her home for a year. As another income source, her husband works repairing vehicles in the village. The modest couple has one child who is married and already took a suitable job as a local rice farmer. Recently, the rains are falling down during this approaching rice season, so Chan S. is looking for a loan on Kiva for her child to use as capital to invest in the rice-growing business.

loans.use: To invest in a rice-growing business

loans.name: Crecer Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Crecer, el Banco inicia su tercer ciclo con 17 socias.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. cereales, refrescos, abarrotes en general, ropa, panes, loceria, comidas, golosinas y embutidos.
	
Como es el caso D. Judith es conviviente, tiene 22 años y 1 hijo, Judith se dedica a la preparación D. pasteles como alfajores que prepara en un horno alquilado, sus ventas los realiza D. manera ambulatoria.
	
Mientras que Soledad es soltera, tiene 31 años y 1 hijo, Soledad tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, verduras, actividad que realiza todos los días.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles  haciendo un total D. 5,700 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. harina, manteca, bebidas, arroz, azúcar, golosinas, ropa.

Los sueños D. las socias son ahorrar para ampliar su negocio, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos, tener una pastelería y construir su casa.
texts.en:
The Crecer ("To Grow") Village Bank is beginning its third loan cycle with 17 members. The group members are involved in a variety of economic activities. They sell grains, drinks, general grocery items, clothing, bread, dishes, prepared meals, sweets and cold cuts. For example, Judith is 22 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their son. She bakes sweets, like traditional alfajor cookies, in a rented overn. She sells her desserts on the street. Soledad is 31 years old and is the single mother of one boy. Soledad runs a stO. from her home, where she sells basic grocery items and vegetables seven days a week. The group members are requesting different individual loan amounts, such as 300 or 450 soles, and the total group loan amount is 5,700 soles. The group members will use their loans to buy flour, lard, sodas, rice, sugar, sweets and clothing. The group members dream of saving money to expand their businesses, of providing their children with a good education, of opening a cake shop and of building their own homes.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy flour, lard, sodas, rice, sugar, sweets and clothing

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina A., 62, is a widow with a grown daughter (who is also a businesswoman).

Celestina owns and manages a togue (mung bean sprouts) and lumpia (spring roll) wrapper making business in Concepcion Dos, Marikina City. The business was started by her husband 20 years ago and has been the family's sole source of income ever since. Celestina and her four employees (one of whom is shown in the picture with Celestina) deliver their products to nearby markets in Commonwealth, Parang, Tumana, and San Mateo as early as 2 o'clock in the morning. The businesses consumes four bags of mung bean sprouts (totaling 100 kilos) and 50 kilos of flour every day. Celestina earns a daily net income of 1500 to 2000 Philippine pesos (or about $30 to $40 US dollars). The loan she's requesting will be used to buy more mung bean sprouts and flour because her family's present capital is no longer enough to supply her growing business.

Celestina dreams that through this business, she will be able to buy the house and lot she is now renting.

loans.use: Mung bean and flour

loans.name: Karín

texts.es: Karín tiene 25 años, es una joven que trata siempre de apoyar a sus padres, con quienes vive y con quienes disfruta gratos momentos. Desde que terminó sus estudios quiso tener un negocio propio y sus padres le ayudaron a instalar un puesto de zapatos en el mercado de su localidad. Lugar donde vende desde hace 2 años y en este tiempo ha logrado ganar gran cantidad de clientes, quienes la visitan todos los días, teniendo como ventaja sobre su competencia los precios cómodos que ofrece. Pero para incrementar sus ventas, comienza su jornada desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde y su mercadería la compra en centro de la ciudad, aunque la mayoría de las veces la adquiere a través de comerciantes amigos de otras ciudades donde fabrican calzado de muy buena calidad y a precios bajos, posibilitando mejorar sus ingresos y la calidad de sus productos. Ahora Karín tiene pensado ampliar su puesto para ofertar nuevas marcas de zapatos. Como parte de un banco comunal lo que más le agrada es el compromiso y esfuerzo que ponen sus compañeras de grupo, ya que hay un buen grado de compromiso por mejorar, y durante los 13 préstamos que ha tenido con Microfinanzas PRISMA ha pasado por muchas situaciones difíciles que ha logrado superar. Los 3000 soles que solicita los invertirá en la compra de un exhibidor para sus nuevos modelos de zapatos que adquirirá.
texts.en:
Karín is a young lady of 25 years who always tries to support her parents, with whom she lives and enjoys spending pleasant moments.

When she finished her studies, she wanted to have her own business and her parents helped her to set up a shoe stall at the local market. She has been selling shoes there for two years and during that time she has managed to gain many loyal customers who visit her every day, as she offers lower prices than her competitors. In order to increase her sales, she starts already at 9 a.m. and works until 6 p.m. She buys some merchandise in the city center, although most of it comes from merchant friends in other cities, where shoes of a very high quality are produced at a low price. Thus she can earn more money and yet offer good quality to her customers.

Now Karín is planning to expand her stall and offer new brands of shoes. As a member of a community bank, she particularly enjoys the commitment and effort of her group members. During the 13 loans she has had so far with Microfinanzas Prisma, she went through many difficult situations that she managed to overcome. She will invest the 3000 nuevos soles of her loan in the purchase of a showcase for the new shoes that she will buy.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a showcase for her shoes

loans.name: Celina

texts.en:
Celina is a member of the Idunda borrower group in Kihesa,Iringa,she is 36 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 4 children.Her children are aged 15,9,17.2 years.she also cares for other 2 dependents.

Celina started her own business selling tomatoes,potatoes,anions 12years ago,she works 9 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Celina`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more tomatoes,anion,potatoes.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Celina hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes,anions

loans.name: Nelva

texts.es: Nelva tiene 28 años, es una amorosa madre de familia, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Roger de 28 años y sus dos hijas gemelas Tania y Erika de 7 años, a quienes desea dar una buena vida. El negocio de Nelva es el alquiler de cabinas de Internet, ella brinda este servicio desde muy tempranas horas, su local es muy concurrido, sobre todo por los jóvenes de su barrio, quienes al ver el buen trato que reciben y la comodidad de las cabinas, no dudaron en hacer de este lugar su preferido. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es atender bien a sus clientes, ya que sabe que de ellos dependen sus ingresos. Lleva 2 años con este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su local, ya que no le da mucho tiempo para salir a pasear con sus queridas hijas, por eso espera que en el futuro su negocio crezca y le genere mejores ingresos. Es el quinto préstamo de Nelva con MFP y tiene muchas ganas de pagarlo a tiempo y sin demora, ya que desea acceder a más préstamos. En su banco comunal es muy tranquila, pero siempre participa en las decisiones que toman entre todas las socia. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados planea hacer arreglar los muebles para computadora que tiene, ya que con el tiempo se han ido deteriorando.
texts.en:
Nelva is 28 years old and a loving mother to her family. She lives in a rented house with her husband Roger and their twin daughters, Tanya and Erika, who are 7 years old. She hopes to give them both a good life. Nelva manages an Internet café. She offers her services starting in the early morning hours because her location is very popular among the young people in the neighborhood. They enjoy being treated well and the convenience of the cubicles, so they don’t hesitate in making her business one of their favorite places to visit. What Nelva likes most about her job is serving her customers, because she knows her income is dependent on them. She has been in business for 2 years and the hardest part of her job is having to be present at her business the entire day, which does not give her much time to spend with her daughters. She hopes that her business continues to grow in the future and generate more revenue.

This will be Nelva’s fifth loan with MFP. Since she wants to access more loans in the future, she is eager to make her payments on time and without any delays. Her Communal Bank operates in a calm manner because everyone participates in all of the group decisions. With her loan of 800 soles, she plans to refurbish her computer furniture since it has deteriorated over time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Refurbish her computer furniture

loans.name: La Pampa Group

texts.es: El grupo “La pampa” es un grupo nuevo que esta representado por la señora Basilia e integrado de 16 miembros,  de las cuales algunas ya trabajaron bajo esta modalidad en grupos anteriores. La mayoría se dedican a diferentes actividades, los hombres algunos son transportista, y otros empleados, entre la s mujeres se dedican a la venta de abarrotes en tiendas propias, otras a la venta de empanadas, comida, refrescos, a la elaboración de pan, cometidos, perfumes y pescado. La competencia dentro de sus rubros es alta, pese a eso saben sacar adelante la actividad económica a la que se dedican. El crédito esta destinado al crecimiento de sus negocios con la compra de mercaderías, insumos y herramientas para mejorar más sus ingresos que les permitirá darles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias van cursando su primer ciclo dentro de la institución pero están contentos de que se les brinde un apoyo económico que ayudada a generar mejores ingresos y a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia
texts.en:
"La Pampa" Group is a new 16-member group that is led by Basilia; some of the members have been a part of other past group loans. The majority of the group works in different activities. Some of the men are taxi or bus drivers, among other jobs. Some of the women work in small shops selling groceries, while others sell empanadas (meat or vegetable filled pastries), food, refreshments, bread, perfume, and fish. The competition among these lines of work is high, so it is very important to excel at their trade. The loan is to be used for the growth of their businesses through the purchase of merchandise, supplies, and tools to better their incomes, which allows them to give their families a better quality of life. As soon as this credit experience runs its first cycle through the institution, they look forward to being content that it has brought them economic assistance through improving their income and the quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Suzy Marinkovich, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Funding for operations

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en:
Battulga lives with his wife and two children in Kharkhorin, ancient Mongolian empire's capital. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His two children attend a local secondary school while his wife operates a clothing retail business in the local market.

Battulga owns and operates his own wooden-products business, specializing in 'ger' parts, 'ger' furniture, and other larger furniture pieces. He started his business in 2002 after graduating from a carpenter training course. Most of his profits come from the sale of his larger-sized furniture which is sold at prices between 850,000 and 1,200,000 tugrug (~600-840 USD). All of his products are made with great care and attention to detail which has earned him a reputation among his customers as a quality furniture provider.

He would like to increase his sales so that he can afford to build a house by the end of next year. Battulga is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~1400 USD) loan to purchase more wood so that he can increase the number and variety of large furniture pieces that he can sell.

loans.use: to purchase more wood

loans.name: Kerija

texts.en:
Kerija H. is currently in the business of selling cassava and sweet potatoes and is requesting a loan to purchase carrots and Irish potatoes to sell. Kerija is 28 years old and is married, with a husband who is a clerk. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a building that she will use as a hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase carrots and Irish potatoes to sell

loans.name: Eldaniz

texts.en:
Eldaniz is applying to Kiva for a second loan. He sells clothes. Eldaniz needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy clothes to expand his clothing sales business. At this moment he sells children's clothing. Now he plans to sell clothes for adults also. The weather is becoming cold and he would like to buy the warm clothes for sale.

"I am very thankful to Kiva lenders for the loan. With your help I improved my business and I cannot ever forget that," Eldaniz says.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis P. is 33 years old and married to Lailanie, an Overseas Filipino Worker in Syria. The couple has been married for almost eight years now and has been blessed with two loving kids. Lei Ann is seven years old and Francis is two years old. They are three family members living together at the village of Ramona. He has had a hog-raising business for almost two years. His net income, when he sells one hog is Php 1,500. Aside from hog raising, he also has a part-time job selling fluorescent Philips light bulbs. He desires a loan of Php 7,000, which he will use to purchase some hog feed and a hog to raise. He is thankful to those lenders who reach out to him, especially in times of needs.

loans.use: To buy hog feed and some hogs to raise

loans.name: Magali Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Magali, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Solidarias II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 31 años, es madre de 03 hijos, en etapa escolar y que aún dependen de ella.

Se inicio en la venta de pescado fresco, hace 10 años atrás, llevada por la intención de ayudar a su familia en sus ingresos económicos, contando para esto con un primer capital de S/. 200.00 que fue muy bien invertido, por lo que hoy en día continúa con el mismo negocio pero ya en mayores cantidades y variedad de  especies.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00, comprará pescado seco en kilos tanto los que produce la región como los de la costa del país como: bocachico, palometas, toa, gamitada, tilapias, toyo, pejerey para así mantener surtido su negocio y satisfacer el exigente gusto de su clientela. 

Ella nos manifiesta su complacencia por pertenecer muchos años a un grupo de mujeres que le ha ayudado a superar dificultades que en algún momento tuvo que pasar pero que ahora los enfrenta con mucha fortaleza.
texts.en:
Mrs. Magali is a member of the communal bank “Las Solidarias II.” This bank is located in the Tarapoto district, in the province of San Martin, in the Department of San Martin. She lives with her partner, is 31 years old, and is the mother of three dependent, school-age children. She began selling fresh fish ten years ago to help her family with the bills. She started out with 200 soles of working capital that turned out to be a good investment because today she is still in the same business, but with greater quantities and varieties of fish. With the loan of 1,200.00 soles, she will buy kilos of dried fish, fish that are produced in the region as well as those from the coast like: bocachico, palometas, toa, gamitada, tilapias, toyo, pejerey to keep her business stocked and satisfy the demands of her customers. Mrs. Magali expresses her satisfaction at being part of a women’s group for so many years, a group that has helped her get through a difficult period in her life. She now has the strength to confront difficulties with more strength.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fish.

loans.name: Bartholomen Nzilu

texts.en:
For the last year, Bartholomen Nzilu M. has run “Highway Properties” where he works as an agent selling land, plots and houses to regulars and walk-ins. He has two employees and faces the business challenges of lack of funds to promote his business and strong competition from similar business.

Bartholomen is using the proceeds of 50,000 KES to buy a computer, office stationery and to promote his business. He desires to be the main agent in the Mlolongo area which is near the Kitengela area. He describes himself as hardworking, polite and social.

loans.use: To buy another computer, office stationery and to advertise his business

loans.name: Sayra Esther

texts.es:
En el municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua, la señora Saira A. con mucha dedicación atiende su propia pulpería que ella misma formó desde hace tres años y es la que le permite tener el sustento para el mantenimiento de su familia compuesta por sus tres hijos de los cuales dos de ellos están en edades escolares.

Ella se ha destacado por ser una mujer muy trabajadora en su municipio y hoy en día solicita un crédito para la compra de los productos tales como los comestibles y los productos perecederos para surtir su pulpería y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones de vida tanto de ella como de su familia.
texts.en:
In the municipality of San Rafael del Sur in Managua, señora Saira A. attends with much dedication to her own local store which she started 3 years ago. It is this which permits her to have the support to maintain her family, composed of her 3 children, 2 of which are school age. She has strived to be a very hard-working woman in her municipality and today she seeks a loan for the purchase of products such as comestibles and perishable products to supply her local store and in this way improve living conditions for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for local store

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 28 años y vive en compañía de su madre en la casa de ella.
Desde niña se ha dedicado a la elaboración de bordados para los trajes típicos de su localidad. Esta labor la realiza en su misma casa, todos los días y en el horario que más le acomode; su madre también le ayuda para que sus trabajos sean muy coloridos y de buena calidad, y una vez terminada su producción entrega a los clientes que solicitaron sus servicios. 

Esta es la quinta oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una persona muy responsable con sus pagos, y también es parte de un banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de hilos dorados, plateados y de otros diversos colores.
texts.en:
María is 28 years old and lives with her mother in her mother’s house. Since childhood she has been involved in embroidering the traditional clothing of her region. She carries out this work every day in her own house and according to a schedule which suits her. Her mother helps her. Their work is very colorful and of good quality. Upon finishing work on projects they deliver to customers who have sought their services.

This is the fifth time María has had a loan with MFP. She is very responsible about making her payments and is also a member of a communal bank. She will invest the money that she is now applying for in the purchase of thread of gold, silver and other diverse colors.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of embroidery materials.

loans.name: Estrellita Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal es llamado “Estrellita” y se conforma por 17 socios. Ellos son D. L. ciudad D. Talca y se dedican principalmente a negocios D. venta D. ropa nueva y usada, confección D. uniformes y ropa D. baño, fabricación D. artesanías en aros y accesorios, venta D. alimentos según L. época del año, venta D. hot dogs y repostería.
Claudia es L. secretaria del banco comunal, en L. foto se encuentra por el centro al final, al lado izquierdo del hombre que viste polera celeste. ElL. venD. ropa interior D. hombre, mujer y niño. Además trabaja en manipulación D. alimentos en una institución. Claudia se unió a Fondo Esperanza, luego D. separarse D. su esposo, y nos comenta que para elL. esto significó una nueva esperanza para una mejor calidad vida. Tiene 2 hijos, D. 17 y 5 años. Su motivación son sus hijos y su propia realización personal, ya que este año comienza a estudiar técnico en asistencia social. Sus sueños son tener una casa propia, ya que ahora vive D. allegada, y tener un negocio en su misma casa. Claudia invertirá este préstamo en ropa para L. época que se aproxima (otoño), como por ejemplo chalecos y poleras manga larga.
Talca pertenece a L. región del Maule, ubicada en L. zona centro del país. L. mayor parte D. L. población habita en el sector rural, L. cual se dedica principalmente a las actividades económicas propias del campo. Se caracteriza por su hermosa artesanía y arquitectura colonial. Sus principales atracciones son L. flora, L. fauna, y sus viñedos. A pesar que L. fuerza D. trabajo se ha incrementado, esta región sigue siendo, según el último censo, una D. las más pobres del país.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Estrellita" and is maD. up of 17 members. They are from the city of Talca and they have businesses selling new and used clothing, making uniforms and bathing suits, making handcrafted earrings and accessories, selling food according to the season of the year, and selling hot dogs and pastries. Claudia is the secretary of the communal bank, in the photograph she is found in the center of the last row, on the left siD. of the man who is seen in the blue shirt. She sells underwear for men, women and children. In addition, she works in food handling for an institution. Claudia joined the Fondo Esperanza after separating from her husband, and she tells us that for her this meant new hope for a better quality of life. She has 2 children, who are 17 and 15 years old. She is motivated to work hard for her children, as well as her own personal development, since this year she is beginning to study social work at a local college. Her dreams are to have her own house, since she now lives with a relative, and to have a business in her home. Claudia will use this loan to buy clothing for the coming fall season, such as, for example, vests and long sleeved shirts. Talca is in the Maule region, located in the central area of the country. The majority of the population lives in the rural areas, and they work principally in economic activities found in the countrysiD.. This area is known for its beautiful handicrafts and colonial architecture. The main attractions are the flora, fauna and vineyards. In spite of the fact that the workforce has increased, this region continues to be, according to the last census, one of the poorest in the country.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise (fall clothing)

loans.name: Felisa's Group

texts.en:
Felisa C. is from the village of Sto. Nino, Tukuran, ZDS. She is 38 years old. Felisa is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Felisa is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Felisa owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing shirt making services to local community members. Felisa is just starting this business.

In 2008, Felisa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Felisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Felisa is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Felisa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics & materials.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita A., 46, is making sure that her family has enough for their daily needs. She is married to Prudencio A. Jr., a company supervisor, and they are blessed with five children. She helps her husband support the family so that they can have a better life.  She has been selling door-mats and rags for ten years. She also sells cosmetic products.

Anita has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than four years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Due to her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow 15 times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed as additional working capital for her business. She earns a profit of PHP 15,000 per month.  

Now, with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 50,000 loan. This will be used as additional capital to buy more raw materials for her expanding rag making business.

She dreams that her business will continue to sustain her family, especially the education of her children. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her rag making business

loans.name: Prum

texts.en: Prum C. is married and resides with his wife in Takeo province, Cambodia. He has a one-year-old child. He is engaged in the business of sewing and designing clothes, earning an income of USD 4 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by his wife who always helps him in the business. Their standard of living has been improved since they have had this business. C. is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to purchase a new sewing machine to expand his sewing business and generate a better income. This is his first loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Adom Wo Wim Group

texts.en:
Paul is thirty-six years old. He is married and blessed with three children who are all currently in the basic school. The last born is seven years. Paul lives with her wife and the children in a rented apartment in the community. His wife trades in textile materials and clothes to help him to take good care of the family. 

Paul is a very hard-working man. He trades in Chinese products such as food supplements. He has been running this business for three years and aspires to develop his business to the level of a clinic. He is hopeful to give all his children the best education he can afford. 

He requests a loan to procure additional products in bulk to scale up his business.

Paul is the leader of a four-member trust bank group called ‘Adom wo wim’, meaning 'help comes from above'. The group members are mainly into trading activities. It is the dream of the members of this group to access this loan so as to procure goods in bulk to increase their stocks.

loans.use: to buy Chinese food supplements

loans.name: Nayibe Esther

texts.es:
Cuando Nayibe T. C., expresa que su negocio le ha dado a su familia la posibilidad de apoyar la educación de sus hijas y llevarlas a que sean profesionales produce  en cualquiera una inmensa satisfacción. Ella aprendió este oficio de su cónyuge quien por tradición familiar sabe mucho del arte de preparar las deliciosas empanadas, caribañolas y deditos, negocio del cual vive la familia y al que ha añadido venta de carnes, pescado vísceras y pollo, así como también frutas de cosecha. Ahora espera poder comprar un molino eléctrico y recipientes plástícos para moler el maíz,pues la tarea d emolienda la hace donde otra microempresaria y debe pagar por este servicio, así mismo quiere comprar su principal materia prima, "la yuca" para producir un mayor volumen de pedidos, esta es la razón por la cual aspira a su segundo crédito por valor de $1.100.000 y dice que desde el primero, cumple con mas tranquilidad los pedidos de sus clientes, no le debe a pagadiarios y siempre tiene para solucionar situaciones de emergencia

Nayibe vive en el barrio Loma Fresca en el suroccidente de Barranquilla, con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos,  la mayor esta por terminar su carrera universitaria y el menor estudia una carrera técnica, ahora su sueño es que sus hijos logren finalizar con éxito los estudios por eso ella y su cónyuge trabajan con mucho esmero. Su mayor desafío es trabajar en el reducido espacio donde desarrollan su actividad.
texts.en:
Nayibe T. C. experiences immense satisfaction when she says that her business has made it possible for her family to support her daughters’ education so that they can become professionals. She learned her trade from her husband, who has a family tradition of preparing delicious empanadas, caribañolas (dumplings made of cassava and potato dough, stuffed with meat and vegetables), and finger foods. Her family also sells meats, fish entrails, chicken, as well as harvested fruits. She now hopes to buy an electric mill and plastic containers for grinding corn. The task of milling and grinding is the chance to start another micro-enterprise since people are willing to pay for this service. Therefore, she wants to buy all the primary materials to get started. Nayibe also plans to buy cassava in bulk to grind into flour to fulfill orders. For this reason, she is requesting her second loan in the amount 1,100,000 COP. She says that after receiving her first loan, she was able to complete her customers’ orders more easily because she didn’t have to buy supplies every day and always had enough to address emergency situations. Nayibe lives in the Loma Fresca neighborhood in southwestern Barranquilla with her husband and two children. Her oldest daughter is finishing her college degree and the younger one is studying for a technical degree. She now dreams that her children will successfully finish their studies, so that she and her husband can see the fruits of their hard work. Her greatest challenge is working in a small space from which to develop her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cassava, an electric mill, and plastic containers

loans.name: Rerika

texts.es: Rerika, es una gran mujer, tiene 26 años, está casada con Walter de 29 años, con quien tiene tres hermosos e inquietos hijos, todos viven en una habitación alquilada, dentro de la casa de su suegra. Junto a su esposo desde hace 6 años siembra arveja y papa, productos de mayor demanda en los mercados de la ciudad de Tarma y de mejores precios, además en los días libres se enrumba a laborar como operario en chacras ajenas, donde ganan por día S/. 20.00 soles. Lo que más le gusta es recolectar papa y arvejas, sin embargo lo más pesado del trabajo es tener que regar por las noches sus cultivos, luchando con el frío y hasta con las lluvias. Paralelo a esta actividad, cría también carnero, cerdos, toro y asno, en donde los ceba para luego venderlos en fechas festivas o para tener reservas para alguna situación económica difícil. Es propietaria de vA. hectáreas de terreno agrícola, aún así desea tener un terreno amplio en la ciudad para construir su casa y  puedan vivir cómodamente sus hijos. Esta es su sexto crédito con MFP, además conoce la metodología de trabajo de su grupo  comunal, el cual comparte de manera entusiasta. Con el crédito que solicita aunado a sus ahorros, comprará un terreno para construir su casa dentro de su localidad.
texts.en:
Rerika, 26, is a great woman; she is married to Walter, 29, and they have three beautiful, restless children. They all live together in a rented room within her mother-in-law’s house. For the past six years she and her husband have farmed peas and potatoes which are the items in highest demand and that sell for the best prices in the city of Tarma’s markets. In her free time she hires herself out to work other farmers’ fields where the daily salary is 20 soles. What she enjoys most is harvesting potatoes and peas but what is the heaviest work is having to water her plants at night fighting against the cold and even against the rains. Together with this activity, she also raises calves, pigs, bulls and asses for subsequent sale during festive occasions or to have a reserve in case of some unforeseen economic need. She owns several hectares of farmland but even so would like to have a spacious piece of property in the city to build her house so that her children can live in comfort. This is her 6th loan with MFP. She is well aware of the group work methodology in her communal group which she enthusiastically shares. She will use the funds to add to her savings and buy a lot in the city on which to build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a lot on which to build her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her cinnamon cultivation business

loans.name: Pablo Wualdir

texts.es:
El señor Pablo de 22 años de edad es comerciante, se dedica a la compra y venta de celulares y accesorios, además realiza reparaciones de todo  tipo de celulares, activaciones de lineas y mini cargas.
Empezó gracias a la ayuda económica de su madre la señora Maria de 55 años de edad, ella es empleada de una empresa Estatal.
El joven emprendedor  esta conforme con la actividad que realiza y comenta que tiene pensado recargar su negocio con mas celulares y accesorios para asi cumplir los pedidos de sus clientes.
Solicita el préstamo para la  compra de más accesorios y repuestos para celulares, así también aparatos celulares ya sean de segunda mano para su reparación y venta o nuevos  para poder satisfacer la gran demanda que tiene.
texts.en:
Pablo is 22 years of age and a merchant. He dedicates himself to buying and selling cell phones and accessories. In addition, he repairs all types of cell phones, provides activation and charging. He started thanks to the financial assistance provided by his 55-year old mother, Maria, who works for a government agency. This young entrepreneur is satisfied with the activity he carries out, and comments that he would like to supply his business with more cell phones and accessories in order to meet customer demand. He requests a loan to buy more accessories and cell phone repair parts, as well as new or used cell phones. He can repair the used items to resell, or sell the new phones, to satisfy the high level of demand that he has.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase special tools, replacement parts, and cell phones to resell.

loans.name: Hakob

texts.en:
Hakob Yeganyan was born in 1983 in Azatamut village in the Ijevan area. He is married and has one daughter. 

Hakob works at the village school as a physics teacher and simultaneously he has his own coffee sales business. With his business incomes he fulfills his family’s needs.

He bought a coffee grinder, scales and a packing machine, so now he sells not only coffee beans, but he grinds and packs up coffee as well. He delivers ground and packaged coffee to his village's food shops. 

Hakob is asking for a 400,000 AMD loan to buy a car, which will allow him to deliver coffee to neighboring villages, and thereby to increase his family's income and to develop his business in the future.

loans.use: To buy a car, which will allow him to deliver coffee to neighboring villages

loans.name: Cherryl's Group

texts.en: Cherryl T. is from the village of Brgy. Lawig, Lamut, Ifugao. She is 29 years old. Cherryl is the group leader of a 12-member group loan offered by ASKI, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Cherryl is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Cherryl provides motorcycle transport services. The main source of income for the business comes from operating a tricycle-transport service. Cherryl has been engaged in her business for more than six years and earns approximately 4.000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Cherryl joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cherryl is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be the first loan taken out by Cherryl from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Arely Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Arely del Socorro S. L., habita en el peligroso Barrio de la Capital Laureles Norte tiene 42 años está casada y su esposo se dedica a comercializar llantas, tienen 2 hijos adolecentes, tienen una pulpería el cual es el negocio familiar, anteriormente laboraba en una zona franca al nacer el hijo menor decidió dedicarse a su hijo y las labores del hogar, tras esto y el esfuerzo del esposo lograron invertir en una miscelánea, ellos habitan en una vivienda humilde y es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción que permitan la edificación de un sumidero y cerrar la parte delantera de su hogar, esta inverfsion le permitira mejorar las condiciones precarias en las que habitan favoreciendoles con una mayor seguridad a su familia, mayor ampliación y comodidad a todos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Arely del Socorro S. L., lives in a dangerous neighborhood in the capital, Laureles Norte. She is 42 years old and married. Her husband sells tires. They have 2 teenage children. They have a grocery store, which is their family business. She used to work in a free trade zone; when the youngest child was born, she decided to dedicate herself to her children and her home. After that, and thanks to her husband's hard work, they were able to invest in a variety store. They live in a humble home, and that it why she is asking for a loan to buy construction materials which will allow her to build a drain and close in the front part of her house. This investment will allow her to improve the precarious conditions in which they live, offering better safety to her family, and more space and comfort to all.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a drain and of a wall in the back part of the house

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr:
Femme commerçante de 54 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont l’age varie entre 20 et 35 ans. A la fin des ses études en classe de terminale  par manque de moyen, elle se lance dans le commerce, elle ouvre une petite unité de fabrique de maniocs, ou elle a une capacité journalière de  80 a 100 maniocs par jour.
Elle achète des sacs des tubercules rouis et fait toutes les opérations nécessaires pour faire des maniocs, du pétrissage à la cuisson 
Pour le pétrissage elle utilise un pétrin en bois et une meule, toutes ces opérations de fabrication prennent 3 jours, ses meilleurs clients sont les restaurateurs, des familles, le manioc est l’aliment de base au congo.
Avec ce prêt elle va acheter  20 sacs de maniocs de 50kg, des feuilles, des fils d’attaches et une grosse marmite pour la cuisson.
A l’avenir elle pense acheter 3 autres pétrins  et créer une coopérative de femmes pour la fabrication des maniocs en quantité énorme.
texts.en:
This entrepreneur is a 54-year old woman who is the mother of three; her children are now between 20 and 35 years old. Ending her studies after the last year of high school, due to lack of financial means, she has started a small business preparing manioc [cassava], and has a daily capacity to prepare 80 to 100 manioc tubers. She purchases macerated tubers in bags and performs all the necessary steps to process them, from mashing to cooking. For mashing she uses a wooden mortar and a pestle. All these steps take three days to complete. Her best customers are owners of diners and families as manioc is a staple food in Congo. With this loan she plans to purchase twenty 50-kg bags of manioc, leaves [for wrapping the manioc paste in], thread to attach the leaves and a big pot for cooking. In the future she would like to purchase three additional mortars and create a women’s cooperative in order to process manioc in large quantities.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing 10 bags of macerated manioc tubers, leaves & thread

loans.name: Omar Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Omar Antonio G. L. él es Trabajador de la Empresa Enacal desempeñándose como fontanero tiene  siete años de trabajar para esta empresa, es casada actualmente tiene dos niños en edad escolar. Ha tenido  ocho créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo  ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción y  mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Omar Antonio G. L. works for the Enacal company, as a plumber. He has worked for this company for seven years. He is currently married and has two school-aged children. He has had eight loans with CEPRODEL and has used all of them to buy construction materials and improve the house where he lives. The loans from CEPRODEL have benefited him greatly, since they have allowed him to improve his living conditions and those of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sand, cement, stone and stone blocks

loans.name: Phillis Nyambura

texts.en: Phyllis, who is 38 years old, married to W. Ngigi, and the mother of four children, has been practicing small scale farming in Naivasha town for the last two years. She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend, and this will be her first loan with which she plans to plough her farm and buy bean seedlings to plant.  In order to increase her produce and income, Phyllis is planning to start planting different types of crops in the near future

loans.use: To buy bean seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Vũ

texts.en:
H. Vũ Thị (20209010011) is a 35-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, H. owns & operates a business selling rice products in the local community.  H. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,200,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,048,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering.  H. is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her borrower's business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H. Vũ Thị (20209010011) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, H. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ gạo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 3.200.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các vật dụng mới để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  H. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Chhern

texts.en:
Chhern V., 62, is married and resides with his wife and child in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia: an area known for being the most populated area in the country. V. is a machanic, earning an income of about USD 2 per day. His wife repairs motorcycles, earning an income of about USD 2 per day.
