The family has to spend USD 75 on food, USD 5 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 10 on other necessary expenses every month.  

V. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase spare parts to repair motorcycles and machines. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair motorcycles and machines

loans.name: Mam's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mam H., 50 years old and a married woman, was selected as the village bank president by the twenty-one members of this village bank loan, located in Kaoh Kaev Kraom village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Mam H. is a farmer who owns a plot of land that she uses to grow crops on. Her field is far from the irrigation system, so she would like to use this loan to buy hoses for pumping water to support her farming. With the rest of the loan she wants to buy a battery to light her house. Her husband, Mr. Buth Savy, is 50 years old and works as a furniture maker. With both their occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. This couple has six children: one is a beautician and three are seamstresses in a garment factory while the two others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy hoses for pumping water to support her farming

loans.name: Chhuon

texts.en: Chhuon C. is 27 years old, married to 25-year old Pourn Phat (who we see here) and lives in Phnom Penh City.  She works in a garment factory, where she earns a fixed income to help support her family. Pourn Phat makes a living by selling fruit in a busy market in town, and earns about $3 a day.  Chhuon C. wants to increase her husband's income by expanding his business, and has applied for this loan to allow him to buy more fruit to sell to his customers. (Chhuon C. was not available the day this photo was taken, so we see her husband instead.)

loans.use: To buy a large quantify of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Barnabas

texts.en:
Barnabas married with six children, four of whom are still in school. He is a resident of Kitale Town in Western Kenya and has been practicing mixed farming for over nine years. He produces milk, maize and beans that are sold locally.

One of Barnabas’s challenges is the high cost of artificial insemination. He is requesting a loan of 31,200 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He believes this loan will improve his family’s standard of living since the milk from the cow will be consumed by his family. This will be his second loan from Juhudi Kilimo and he has repaid a previous loan of a similar amount. Within the next five years, Barnabas plans to have five dairy cows and a chuff cutter.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Neil Tamaris

texts.es: La señora Neil Tamaris M. C., es una mujer de 41 años, casada, que habita en el peligroso barrio de Laureles Norte , tiene un hijo pequeño que aun no asiste al preescolar, ellos con su esfuerzo lograron la apertura de una pulpería, y desde hace 2 años han tenido ese ingreso importante en su hogar, es para su negocio que solicita un préstamo para la compra de abarrotes, productos para el hogar, personal y gaseosas, que surtan su tienda y cubran la buena demanda navideña ha beneficio de la economía para futuras inversiones o proyectos con su hijo que tenga en pro de su desarrollo social.
texts.en:
Mrs Neil Tamaris M. C. is a 41 year-old, married woman who lives in the dangerous neighborhood of Laureles Norte.  She has a young son who still doesn't go to pre school.  Through a lot of hard work, she has managed to open a grocery store and she has had this important source of income for her household for two years now.

She is requesting this loan for her business, to buy groceries, household products, personal items and soda with which to stock her store and cover the high demand which exists during the Christmas period.  She has benefited from the money to make future investments or projects for her son, in favor of his social development.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam A. is a 43-year old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store business. She lives in  Brgy. Cansusi, Dalaguete, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 12,000 PHP. Meriam is borrowing 26,000 PHP so that she can continue to purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 29,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Meriam aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Severo

texts.es: El Sr. Severo vive en San Carlos a 25 km del Torno donde trabaja y vive juntamente con su esposa y sus hijos, siembran maíz, sandia, poroto y todo lo que cosecha saca a vender al mercado de el Torno, el es de Cochabamba se vino a buscar mejores vida y lo encontró en San Carlos mediante el sindicato agrario tiene su parcela en la cual esta trabajando, este es su primer crédito, lo utilizara para la compra de semillas, y también para el pago a los peones por el trabajo de preparado de la tierras, es una persona muy trabajadora y esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mr. Severo lives in San Carlos, 25 km from El Torno where he works. He lives with his wife and children. They plant corn, watermelon and beans. They take everything that they harvest to sell in the El Torno market. He is from Cochabamba and came in search of a better life, which he found in San Carlos. Through the agricultural syndicate, he has his own land which he works. This is his first loan, and he will use it to buy seeds and also to pay the workers for their work preparing the lands. He is a very hard-working person and is grateful to the institution for the support offered.

loans.use: for sowing corn

loans.name: Melciades Daniel

texts.es:
Melciades Daniel Marín Chacón, tiene la edad de 42 años, está soltero y tiene 6 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El quiere comprar unas vaquillas de leche para tenerlas en un potrero donde su mamá y que la leche sea para el consumo propio de su familia y lo demás venderlo para generar ganancias economías para el sustento de su hogar. El piensa en el futuro de su familia, por lo cual hará la compra de esas vacas para su explotación y poder mantener su familia. El tiene experiencia en esa area por lo cual tambien quiere invertir.
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Melciades Daniel Marín Chacón, 42, is single and has 6 children who are his main priority.  He wants to buy some milk cows to keep in his mother's pasture.  He will use the milk for his family's personal consumption and also to sell to generate earnings to support the household.  He thinks about the future of his family; he will buy these cows to use so that he can support his family.  He wants to invest in this activity because he has experience in this area.

This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He had not had other loans prior to this from state banks.  FUDECOSUR has provided him with a loan that has easier payment terms and a much lower rate of interest than those offered by the state banks.

loans.use: to buy 2 milk cows

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more dozens of slippers, eggs and bread.

loans.name: Furkatdzon

texts.ru: Хушвахтов Фуркатжон проживает в районе Вахш. Возраст, 25 лет. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Образование-среднее. Зарабатывает строительными работами по найму. В этой области более 10 лет. Кроме того он занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Он в основном разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Уже три года как занимает этим видом деятельности. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Furkatdzon K. lives in Vakhsh district. He is 25 years old and married with two children. He has a secondary (high school) education. Furkatdzhon does construction work on an hourly basis. He has been in this line of work for over 10 years. In addition, he raises livestock on his property, primarily for sale. He has been doing this for three years and is requesting a loan to purchase livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Roy

texts.en: Roy is a forty-eight-year-old married woman with seven children and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling fresh foods for the last eighteen years. Her hardship is high transport costs and  her desire is to set up a food store and educate her children. Roy needs the loan to buy groundnuts and Irish potatoes for resale.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts and Irish potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Zoila Cecilia

texts.es:
La Señora. Zoila Mizquero es socia del banco comunal Luz y Vida, vive por el sector de Monay en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad que es de clima frió, tiene hermosos lugares llenos de  história para visitar, cuenta con una amplia gastronomía que cautiva los paladares de propios y extraños, Cuenca es una ciudad de cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora. Zoila tiene 44 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 25, 18 y 4 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y estudia en la universidad,  su segundo hijo estudia en la universidad y cuida a dos niñas de 11 y 9 años de edad ya que sus padres han migrado a otra ciudad.  Su esposo labora en un taller propio donde elabora cielos rasos, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
 
Doña Zoila se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar en donde cría chanchos y cuyes a los cuales los vende en su comunidad. También ayuda a su esposo en el taller y esta actividad la realiza hace 15 años, trabajan de lunes a sábados.

Es socia fundadora del banco comunal y todos los crédito le han beneficiado para sus negocios, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de material para la fabricación de los cielos rasos en el taller de su esposo.
 
Su meta es de crecer mucho más en el negocio.
texts.en:
Zoila Mizquero is a member of the village bank Luz y Vida. She lives in the Monay neighborhood of the city of Cuenca. The city has a cold climate and many pretty historical sites to visit. Cuenca offers a diverse cuisine which entices both locals and foreigners. Cuenca is a city of culture and tradition.

Zoila is a 44-year-old married mother of three. Her children are 25, 18 and 4 years old. Her eldest child works and is a student at the university. Her second child is a student at the university and takes care of two girls, ages 11 and 9, whose parents moved to another city. Her husband owns his own workshop where he builds ceilings. Working together, they've been able to build their own house.

Zoila takes care of household chores. She also raises pigs and guinea pigs out of her home which she sells locally. Additionally, she helps her husband in his workshop. They've had this business for 15 years now and work from Monday through Saturday.

Zoila is one of the founding members of the village bank. All the loans that she has received have gone to help her with her businesses. She plans to use this loan to buy more material to build ceilings in her husband's workshop.

Her goal is to help the business to grow much more.

loans.use: to purchase materials to build ceilings

loans.name: Wassilétou

texts.fr: Madame Wassilétou à 31ans. Elle est mariée à un conducteur de taxi-moto et est mère de 03 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de céréales. Wassilétou  a démarré l’activité en 2003 et s’approvisionne au marché de l’intérieur et revend dans le marché d’Agoé. Elle veut assurer l’avenir de ses enfants, participer en partie à la charge de la famille, s’épanouir, c’est pour cela elle sollicite ce premier prêt pour acheter des céréales et du charbon.
texts.en: Madame Wassilétou is 31 years old and married to a motorbike taxi driver with whom she has three children. She sells cereals for a living. Wassilétou entered this trade in 2003 and sources her goods from inland, selling them in the Agoé market. She wishes to provide for her children's future, see to her family's needs, and fulfil her potential. She is therefore seeking her first loan in order to buy cereals and coal.

loans.use: To purchase cereals and coal

loans.name: La Trinite Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "LA TRINITE" est formé de cinq personnes qui appartiennent toutes à la même famille. La représentante de ce groupe se nomme Aline Marthe. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Aline Marthe est mariée à un certain Florant. Le couple a quatre enfants à charge, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont leurs propres enfants. Aline Marthe habite au quartier Kpondéhou à Cotonou (Capitale économique du Bénin) avec ses enfants et son mari depuis trois ans. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Il y a près de dix ans que Aline Marthe mène comme activité, la vente de tissus à Cotonou. Aline Marthe s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Aline Marthe désire obtenir un crédit avec les autres membres de son groupe.
texts.en: The group "The Trinity" is made up of five people who all come from the same family.  The representative of the group is named Aline Marthe.  This is the first time that the group has requested ALIDé's financial support in order to raise their business levels.  Aline Marthe is married to a man named Florant.  The couple has four children in their care, all educated, of which two are their own children.  Aline Marthe has lived in the Kpondéhou neighborhood in Cotonou (the economic capital of Benin) with her children and husband for three years.  The couple takes care of the various familial responsibilities together.  It has been nearly 10 years that Aline Marthe has run her business selling cloth in Cotonou.  Aline Marthe stocks up in Danktopa, the international market of Benin.  With the goal of increasing her stock of products and better responding to the demands of her customer base, Aline Marthe would like to obtain a loan with the other members of her group.

loans.use: to purchase pieces of cloth.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy zinc, lumber, cement, bricks, sand, posts, fencing and workers.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en: Violet wants a loan to buy hair cutting tools, a sterilizer machine and cosmetics for her salon that she has run for three years. Aged 30 years, Violet hails from the Kyenjojo District in Uganda. She is the mother of three children, with whom she lives together with their father, in a rented three-room house. Having gotten money from her husband, she started her salon that has grown over the years. Her dream is to build a residential house and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy hair cutting tools, a sterilizer machine and cosmetics for her salon.

loans.name: Nasibu

texts.en:
Nasibu is married to a businesswoman and they live in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 2 years, Nasibu has operated a video shop business, with neighbors and passersby as his potential customers. He has faced a major challenge of theft in his business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. Nasibu plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase a plasma television for his business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase a plasma television for his business.

loans.name: Saron

texts.en: Saron is 52 years old and makes a living as a farmer. She earns only $1 per day and is a single mother with two children. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on rent, $20 on school fees and $35 for other expenses. In order to meet these expenses, she is applying for a loan for $800 to buy a Tok Tok (or motorbike with a cart attached) so that her son-in-law can become a driver and earn money. She hopes that her family can earn enough money to buy supplies for her farm and pay for her younger child to go to university.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her son-in-law.

loans.name: Kotognogontala Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA III sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  39 ans,  3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à SOGODOGOLA, un des quartiers de la commune de KAI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI, préfecture de Kadilo 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide  avec  BINTOU 2ème à droite position assise.
Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et la semence pour entretenir : 2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de LOULOUNI et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 165.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group KOTOGNOGONTALA III are married women who average 39 years of age and three children each. They live for the most part in polygamous families in SOGODOGOLA, a district in the Commune of KAI, in the sub-prefecture of LOULOUNI, Prefecture of Kadilo (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the off-season. The group members are on their fourth loan with the institution. The past loans have been properly repaid.

The crop grown is: peanuts.  Such is the case with BINTOU, who is sitting second from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to pay for plowing and to buy farm inputs and seeds for maintaining: 2 hectare. After the harvest, the produce is sold in villages, at the markets of LOULOUNI and SIKASSO, to a customer base composed of women and men.


BINTOU plans on making an average profit of 165,500 francs CFA per planting. The profits will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

She would like to keep up this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso in order to make use of a larger arable plot, so she can derive better gains.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, farm inputs, and seeds

loans.name: Nazgul's Group

texts.en:
Nazgul is a member of this group. She is 39 and is married to a construction worker. Together with her husband she brings up five sons. The older sons study at school and the younger ones are in kindergarten. To earn money to meet the family's needs, Nazgul breeds livestock and resells it at a higher price. In this way she earns 5000 soms per month. With the loan Nazgul wants to purchase hay to feed livestock. In the future she wants to give all her sons a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase hay

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.en: Anastacio is very industrious and a loving father. He has four children, two of whom are in school. His wife is a fruit and vegetable vendor. They help each other especially in financial matters. Anastacio has been a farmer for five years and earns PHP 2,000 each cropping. However, his income is insufficient to provide a better life for his family. This is why his wife found a way to help him. She buys and sells fruit and vegetables. Anastacio goes into the field everyday and has almost no time for himself. He works hard to earn enough income. He doesn’t want to let his family suffer. Despite his dedication, there are times that he encounters trouble and needs help. He is suffering from financial problems and needs additional capital to operate his business. That’s why Anastacio is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 from ASKI. He will use this to purchase seeds and insecticide. He is very thankful that ASKI exists. He stated that ASKI is very willing to help needy people like him. He assures us that his business will improve and progress. He hopes that there are a lot more people that ASKI can help.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and insecticide

loans.name: Emily Owuor

texts.en:
Emily is 47 years old, married and has five children. Emily owns a second hand business (mutumba) in Githurai-Kahawa Barracks where she sells bedding and furnishings. She has been in this business for the past three years and earns an income of KES 22,700 per month.

Emily was introduced to KADET by a friend. She is applying for her first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD and plans to use the loan to purchase more bedding and curtains for sale. Emily will use the extra profit to expand the business and to educate her children.

Emily hopes to grow the business and to open her own premises. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: To buy stock for sale.

loans.name: Alidod

texts.ru: Алидод житель города Куляб. Он женат. Ему 46 лет. У него трое детей. По профессии он товаровед. На сегодняшний день Алидод занимается торговлей. У него имеется продуктовый магазин. В этой области он уже 15 лет. Кредит берет для покупки газированных напитков, булочек, чая, сахара, конфет и яиц. Алидод хочет увеличить товарооборот.
texts.en: Alidod lives in the city of Kulob.  He is 46 years old, married and has three children.  His profession is a merchandiser.  Today, Alidod is involved in retail sales.  He has a food store.  He has been in this business for fifteen years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of carbonated drinks, buns, tea, sugar, candy and eggs.  Alidod wants to increase his goods turnover.

loans.use: to purchase carbonated drinks, buns, tea, sugar, candy and eggs

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en: Vicenta is 49 years old and married with 4 children, of whom 3 are in school. Vicenta works very hard to provide for them. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 20,000 from Kiva's partner, NWTF, to purchase more items to sell. Vicenta has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of products such as sugar, snack foods and other miscellaneous items. In the future Vicenta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to increase her stock of items to sell

loans.name: Elidonia

texts.es:
La Sra. Elidonia cuenta con 55 años de edad es casada tiene una hija a cargo la cual se encuentra cursando la secundaria se llama Yajaira, su esposo se llama Constantino, él cual se dedica al campo.

Ella se dedica al comercio tiene una cocina económica ella invirtirá su préstamo en la compra de los insumos que utiliza para la elaboración de su comida como son aceite, chile, jitomate, cecina, pollo, verdura, etc.

A la Sra. Elidonia se gustaría que su negocio creciera mas ya que le gustaría ampliar su local para poner más mesas y así tener más clientes.
texts.en:
Elidonia, 55, is married and has one daughter, Yajaira, who is in high school. Her husband, Constantino, is a farmer.

Elidonia has a small restaurant. She will invest her loan in the purchase of ingredients such as oil, chile, tomato, smoked meat, chicken and vegetables that she will use to make meals. 

Elidonia would like for her business to grow because she would like to have a larger space to put more tables and serve more customers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make meals like oil, chile, tomato, cured meat, chicken, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio Cesar de 30 años de edad es casado, tiene una bebé de 9 meses de edad, labora como consultor contable desde hace 1 año. Esta solicitando  su 2do credito con el objetivo de continuar mejorando su casa construyendo un anexo en su casa que le servira como cocina y asi brindar mayor comodidad a su familia.  Cabe señalar que anteriormente fue beneficiado con el fondo kiva y logro poner la ceramica y construir un cuarto, pues como la vivienda es de proyecto es muy pequeña y necesita acondicionarla para su familia.
texts.en: Julio Cesar is 30 years old and married. He has a nine month old baby. He has worked as an accounting consultant for one year. He is requesting his second loan with the objective of continuing to improve his home. He is building an addition on his home that will serve as a kitchen. This addition will bring more comfort to his family. It’s worth noting that Julio has benefited from Kiva in the past and he was able to put tiles down and build a room. The home is small and in the midst of renovations and he needs to equip it properly for his family.

loans.use: build an addition.

loans.name: Madougou Bétché

texts.fr:
Madougou est une femme de 52 ans. Elle est mariée à in revendeur. Elle a 02 enfants qui ne font pas des études scolaires. Le premier a 25 ans et le dernier a 22 ans.  
Madougou travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1996. Elle vend des produits d’alimentation générale  dans sa boutique. 
Madougou a requis son troisième crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de riz, des sachets d’eau minérale et des bidons d’huile.  
Dans les prochaines années, Madougou voudrait agrandir son activité et avoir une bonne situation financière. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Madougou is a fifty-two year old woman. She is married to a reseller. She has two children who aren't in school. The first is twenty-five years old and the last is twenty-two. 
Madougou has worked as a reseller since 1996. She sells grocery products in her store. Madougou received her third loan from WAGES in order to buy bags of rice, packets of mineral water, and cans of oil. In the coming years, Madougou would like to expand her activities and have a good financial situation. She says that with the profits, she foresees providing for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Tit

texts.en:
Tit, pictured here, is 34 years old. He lives with his wife, Saman, in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2000 and have two young children, a son and a daughter. Tit is a construction worker and his wife sells meat balls and sluch, a shaved ice dessert. In addition, they are also rice farmers. 

Tit is requesting a 600 USD loan to purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain his farm.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticide

loans.name: Fortunato

texts.es:
Fortunato pertenece al banco comunal “Del Futuro del Manu” y las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Salvación provincia de Manu departamento de Madre de Dios. 

Fortunato tiene 50 años de edad y está casado y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba y desde hace 28 años que radica en la ciudad de Salvación. 

Fortunato trabaja como empleada pública en el Gobierno Regional del departamento de Madre de Dios sede Salvación en el área de administración. Fortunato también tiene una tienda de abarrotes y un hospedaje. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

En esta oportunidad Fortunato requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar y otras cosas más.
 
Fortunato agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Fortuanto belongs to the Communal Bank “Del Futuro del Manu” (Of the Future of Manu). The meetings of his Communal Bank are held every 30 days in the city of Salvación in Manu Province, Department of Madre de Dios.

Fortunato is 50 years old, married, and has three children. He was born in the city of Quillabamba and moved to Salvación when he was 28 years old.

Fortunato works as a public employee for the regional government of the Department of Madre de Dios in Salvación in the administration unit. He also manages a grocery store and an inn. He has been in business for several years and has done very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work.

Fortunato is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy merchandise such as sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, and other products. He appreciates and values this loan and promises to complete his monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and other products.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Lupe

texts.es: La señora   Lupe es cliente antigua de la institución en sus anteriores créditos demostró   responsabilidad  y puntualidad en el pago de sus cuotas la cliente vive en   la ciudad de La Paz, zona Los Andes, Lupe es casada  y tiene dos hijos que están en la edad escolar, la cliente  vende ropa para niños desde hace varios años, el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de  ropa de niños por estas épocas de fin  de año por mayor ya que tiene mucha demanda,  la cliente se siente muy feliz por ser beneficiada con el crédito y agradecida con la institución.
texts.en: Señora Lupe is a long-standing member of the institution who was responsible and punctual with the repayments of her previous loans. The member lives in the city of La Paz in the Andes. Lupe is married and has 2 children who are of school age. The member has been selling children's clothes for several years. She will invest the loan in buying children's clothes wholesale for the end of year season as demand is high. The member is very happy to be benefiting from a loan and is grateful to the institution.

loans.use: to buy clothes, children's coats for Christmas.

loans.name: Giannina

texts.es: Giannina, de 28 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y decidida, además de alegre y comunicativa, es soltera, vive en compañía de su madre, padre y  su hermano de 25 años de edad, cómodamente instalados en la casa de sus padres. Giannina, es profesional en enfermería, trabajando  en un centro de salud, pero viendo que sus ingresos no le alcanzan, dedicidio incursionar en el negocio de venta de ropa femenina, para eso cuenta con el apoyo de una tía que vive en la ciudad de Lima, que es quien le envía la ropa que será vendida a sus cliente por medio de pedidos. Lo que le gusta de esa actividad es que le generará un ingreso económico extra para sus gastos personales, así como distraerla y socializar con sus colegas y amistades. Por otro lado, lo que no le gusta de esa actividad sería la impuntualidad del pago de los créditos otorgados, pero eso no la desanima y piensa en buscar clientes responsables que le garanticen el pago de sus compras. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, se compromete en ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas como en el crédito anterior. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de ropa femenina en variados modelos y al por mayor, para así tener un mayor margen de ganancias.
texts.en: Giannina, 28, is a working woman who is determined, as well as cheerful and communicative.  She is single and lives comfortably with her mother, father and brother, 25 years old, in her parents’ home. Giannina is a nurse practitioner, working in a health center, but seeing that her income was not enough, decided to break in to the business of selling women's clothing. For this, she has the support of an aunt who lives in Lima, who is the one who sent the clothes to be sold to her customer through orders. What she likes about this activity is that it will generate extra income for personal expenses, distract her and socialize with colleagues and friends. On the other hand, what she does not like about this activity would be the lateness of the payment of credits granted, but that does not discourage her and she plans to look for responsible customers that will guarantee payment for their purchases. This will be the loan number 2 with the institution MFP therefore she hopes the small loan with meet her goals. On the other hand, she is committed to being punctual with the repayment of fees as in the previous loan. With the requested amount of 1500 nuevos soles, she will invest in buying women's clothing in various models, wholesale, so to have a higher profit margin.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Juvy has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Juvy is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Juvy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Betania Auxiliadora

texts.es: La señora Betania Auxiliadora es una emprendedora con éxito, ya que inicio su propio negocio con fuente propio , y ha luchado por salir adelante. Betania en su  negocio, ella ya tiene sus clientes fijos y eventuales que la visita. Su mayor sueño de Betania era tener su propio negocio y salir adelante, lo cual ha logrado y espera ampliarse en un futuro. Betania está solicitando crédito para poder abastecerse y poder satisfacer a sus clientes con la compra de granos básicos, arroz aceite, frijoles entre otros productos que más le demandan.
texts.en:
Sra. Betania Auxiliadora is a successful entrepreneur. Since starting a business through her own efforts, she has strived to move forward. Betania has established customers who visit her on a regular basis. Her greatest wish was to succeed in her own business, which she was able to accomplish. In the future she hopes to expand.

Betania is requesting a loan so that she can restock her inventory and satisfy her customers. She plans to buy basic grains, rice, oil, beans, and other products that are in great demand.

loans.use: o buy basic grains, rice, oil, beans, and other products.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 38 years old and married with four children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.  Evelyn has been raising pigs for six years, and also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Teht

texts.en:
Mrs. Teht, 38, is a married woman who has been living in Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap province. To make a living, Mrs. Teht is selling fast food in and around her community using her old motorcycle connected to a trailer at the side. She always sells different kinds of meatballs and she is able to earn income of approximately $3.50 per day in order to support her financial expenses. Mrs. Teht has three single children and most of them sell some mixed items.

Mrs. Teht is requesting this loan to buy a second-hand motorbike to replace the broken one. With the rest of loan funds, she will support her children’s mixed product selling business. As for her future plans, she intends to expand her children's business to large size and to build a new house which is bigger than their current house.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand motorbike to replace the broken one used to transport food for sale.

loans.name: Marietou's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois qui abrite a été crée le 18 Septembre 2010. Il est composé de membres qui habitent la même zone et cultivent un bon esprit solidaire entre elles. 

Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, l'emprunteur en vedette Oury est âgée de 32 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants dont 01 fille et 01 garçon. 

Avec le prêt reçu, elle achète une barrique de 100 kgs d'arachide qui lui donnent 30 litres d'huile à revendre. 

Les bénéfices générés par l'activité lui permettent de renforcer ses épargnes et de payer ses intérêts.
texts.en:
The banc villageois that houses this group was created on September 18, 2010. It is made up of members who live in the same area and maintain strong group solidarity between themselves. Standing on the right in the photo and raising her hand, the lead borrower Oury is 32 years old. She is married and the mother of 2 children, 1 girl and 1 boy. 

With the loan she recieved she is buying a cask of 100 kgs of peanuts which will produce 30 liters of oil for resale. The profits generated by the activity will allow her to increase her savings and pay interest.

loans.use: to buy peanuts from which she produces oil to resell

loans.name: Foyer De La Femme Ndande Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois Foyer de la Femme Ndande existe depuis le 16 décembre 2011; le groupe PC 01 est constitué de vingt neuf femmes qui habitent le même village et qui mènent diverses activités telles que l'élevage, la couture et le petit commerce.

Madame Bousso l'emprunteur vedette est âgée de 33 ans; mariée elle est mère de trois enfants un garçon et deux filles; elle mène une activité d'aviculture et de couture. Sur la photo elle est debout à droite habillée en tissu noir et blanc et a levé la main gauche.


Elle se ravitaille dans les marchés environnants Ndande, Kébémer ou Mékhé pour les besoins de la couture et de son aviculture.



Avec son prêt elle souhaite acheter des poussins pour une valeur de 37250 F et aliments pour 55000 F pour l'aviculture et ainsi se faire plus de revenus à la vente.


Elle souhaite avec ses bénéfices renforcer son épargne afin d'obtenir un prêt plus consistant.
texts.en:
The Banc Villageois, "Foyer de la Femme Ndande," was created on December 16, 2011. The PC 01 group is made up of 29 women who all live in the same village and who are involved in various types of business such as livestock farming, sewing, and small-scale trade.

Bousso is the featured borrower for this loan. She is 33 years old, married, and mother of three children (one boy and two girls). She runs a sewing and poultry-farming business. Bousso is the one dressed in black and white, standing on the right-hand side of the photo with her left hand raised.

She stocks up on goods for her sewing and poultry-farming business at the markets around Ndande, Kébémer, and Mékhé.

She wants to use her loan to buy 37,250 F of chicks and 55,000 F of food for poultry so that she can increase her revenue.

She wants to use the profits to increase her savings so that she can obtain a more substantial loan.

loans.use: to buy chicks and food for poultry

loans.name: Bahaba

texts.en:
Bahaba is a married woman with four children; she describes herself to be honest. 

Bahati operates a firewood retail store, where she sells firewood. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a populated area, and her primary customers are locals. 

She describes her biggest business challenges to be the scarcity of firewood, and harassment from law enforcers. Her business goal is to expand the business within five years.

She will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy a stock of firewood to sell.  

Bahaba hopes that in the future she will own a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy a stock of firewood to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is married with seven children, and all  children attend school. She also takes care of additional family members, grand children. Sarah sales charcoal at market on retail basis. She gets additional income from rental houses . She has been in this business for several years. She works at the market seven days a week . Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality of charcoal. She has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings MCDT - SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. She would like to build more rental houses. She resides in her own house with access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent for a market stall,feeding the family, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Dildora

texts.ru: Дилдора жизнерадостная женшина. Она родилась в рабочей семье. Ей 31 год. Она мать двоих детей. Она очень позитивная женщина. И всегда стремиться понять настроение своих близких и окружающих . С целью помочь  мужу для содержание семьи она решила работать.   Для того чтобы достойно вырастить ребенка она стала искать работу. Но достойную работу не нашла. Так как у неё не было диплома. После этого с помощью мужа и близких  она открыла свой бизнес. Она начала куплю и продажу  цитрусовых  фруктов. Так как в зимний период  этот бизнес  очень  актуальный. Дилдора кроме позитива очень общительная девушка. По этому она быстро нашла и поразила своих клиентов с добротой и дружеским общением.  И  для этого Дилдора хочет расширить ассортимент фруктов. Но у нее появились финансовые трудности. С целью расширения своего бизнеса она обратилась в МДО Арванд за кредитом. Получив кредит она расширила ассортимент фруктов.

loans.use: to expand his business

loans.name: Dolly

texts.en: Mrs. Dolly I. is a 50 years old woman with seven children, she acquired the knowledge of this business within two year training and she finally opens her own in 2002. She lives at Benin City of Nigeria. The above amount is to help her improve her business

loans.use: To buy more food item

loans.name: Korkor

texts.en: A. sells children's wear in her locality. She buys from producing companies and sells to her customers in the market. She wishes to have her own shop where she can sell her goods. She wants a loan of $900.00 to enable her to open a shop and buy more goods.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 31, married, has four children, and is waiting her fifth. Her husband works as a driver for public transportation. She sells pottery at a stand in the local market in the city. To sell her products, she must travel 30 minutes and now especially, it is dangerous for her while she is pregnant. She wishes to use the loan money to buy her own stand and to purchase more merchandise and when she is in the condition to travel again, she will resume her merchant activities as before. Mercede is a member of the group De P. 1.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

MERCEDES TIENE 31 AÑOS DE EDAD, CASADA, TIENE CUATRO HIJOS Y ESTA ESPERANDO EL QUINTO, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA DE CHOFER DE UN TRANSPORTE COLECTIVO, ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE PRODUCTOS DE ALFARERIA EN UN LOCAL UBICADO EN EL MERCADO DE LA CIUDAD, PARA VENDER SUS PRODUCTOS ELLA TIENE QUE VIAJAR 30 MINUTOS Y AHORA ES MUY RIESGOSO QUE VIAJE POR SU EMBARAZO, POR ESTO MISMO EL PRESTAMO LO INVERTIRA PARA PAGAR LA RENTA DEL LOCAL Y PARA COMPRAR MAS MERCANCIA, PARA CUANDO ELLA ESTE EN CONDICIONES DE VIAJAR TOMARA EL RITMO DE TRABAJO QUE HASTA AHORA HA LLEVADO. MERCEDES FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO DE P. 1.

loans.use: Pottery

loans.name: Delina

texts.es:
Delina is twenty-two and single. She sells perfumes, cosmetics, and home furnishings. With her earnings, she helps her parents meet household expenses. She would use the loan to buy more inventory, increase her earnings, and continue her studies. She belongs to the group San Vicente 1, along with Rosa Jiménez Hernández (who sells clothing). Rosa would use her part of the loan to travel to the border to stock supplies, so that she could avoid further trips.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

DELINA, tiene 22 años, soltera, se dedica a la venta de productos de perfumería, cosméticos, artículos para el hogar, con sus ganancias apoya a sus padres en el mantenimiento del hogar y espera con el préstamo comprar mas mercadería para aumentar sus ganancias y de esta manera continuar con sus estudios. Pertenece al grupo San Vicente 1 junto con Rosa Jiménez Hernández (venta de ropa) con su parte del préstamo viajara a la frontera abastecerse de mercadería para evitar mas viajes

loans.use: To buy supplies for a cosmetics business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her food vending business.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya has a small business selling women’s coats and shoes at a busy market in Pavlograd, Ukraine. She decided to start her own business because of a low salary at her previous job. In business now for ten years, she makes about $400 in profit per month. Nataliya sells products that are in good demand in Ukraine. This past year she decided to diversify her inventory and increase her income by selling shoes. Nataliya and her husband Alexander have two daughters. One daughter was married not long ago. Nataliya would like to use some of her income to help them buy a place to live.

Nataliya has requested a loan of $1200 to purchase new inventory. As the cold season approaches, this loan will help her increase her profits and be prepared for a busy time of year.

loans.use: Purchase new inventory

loans.name: Robert

texts.es:
Robert is a 22-year-old student in a prestigious university in the city and dedicates himself to selling many styles and colors of men's and women's shoes. The desire to have his own funds has caused him to engage in a variety of commercial activities from a young age, and he hasn't done poorly because now he is a good merchant of shoes of all brands and occasionally sells door to door. For Robert, there are no limits on his work and studies, and already his classmates from the university e attends are those who buy products from his shoe store. Besides being a good student and a good son, he uses his small income to purchase food for his family and pay for his studies. He wants to finish his work and show many young people that we can reach what we set out to do. That's why Susana and Americo, Robert's parents, are very proud of him. He has a goal to expand into clothing sales because many of his clients have requested that he do this. We support this young student who wants to progress and collaborate in supporting his home.

Translated by Princeton University Language Project.

Robert de 22 años de edad es estudiante de una prestigiosa universidad de su ciudad, se dedica a a la venta de zapatos de diversos modelos y colores para hombres y mujeres.Los anhelos de conseguir sus propios ingresos hicieron que desde muy joven se introduzca en diversas actividades comerciales y no lo hizo mal, porque ahora es un gran vendedor de zapatos de todas las marcas y en ocasiones los ofrece también de puerta en puerta.Para Robert no existe limites para su trabajo y estudios ya que son los mismos estudiantes de la universidad a la que él asiste los que compran sus productos de zapatería.Él además de ser un buen alumno es un buen hijo, ya que aporta sus pocos ingresos a la alimentación de su familia y el pago de sus estudios ya que desea terminar su profesión y demostrar a muchos jóvenes que si se podemos conseguir lo que nos proponemos.Es por ello que Susana y Américo, padres de Robert, se encuentran muy orgullosos de él. Tiene una meta, incursionar en la venta de prendas de vestir, debido a que por el buen gusto que tiene sus clientes le han solicitado que incursione en esta actividad y desde ya cuenta con una amplia lista de pedidos.Apoyemos a este joven estudiante que desea progresar y colaborar con el buen sostenimiento de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for a shoe and clothing  store

loans.name: Sulaina's Group

texts.en: Fatuma intends to buy a fridge and construct a house from the profits of her business. She and her friends, Sulaina, Jalia, Safina, and Ramla, will each receive a share of this loan so that they can invest in their businesses and increase their profit. They will support each other in repaying the loan in a timely manner. They all are intent on improving the financial situations of their families.

loans.use: To expand the individual businesses of each group member

loans.name: Arubaine Cb Group

texts.en:
The leader of this group is Rispa L.. She has a drug shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more drugs for sale. Rispa is 27 years old and is married. Her husband owns a retail shop. She has one child aged 6 who goes to school. Each week, Rispa makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan she hopes to add more stock to her business. Rispa has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 and the loan was paid back on time.

Rispa is joined in her group by Frida O., Hadija M. and Hadija M.. Frida O. has a business selling new clothes and wants to expand her business. Hadija M. has a retail shop and wants a loan to increase stock. Hadija Muhamed operates a charcoal business she wants to expand.

loans.use: To expand drug shop business.

loans.name: Thai Thi

texts.vi:
At her age, Mrs. Thái Thị Sáu, 55 years old, a member of the TYM Fund, branch number 13, looks young and very healthy. Her 5 children are grown up and able to support for themselves. She still raises pigs, the work she’s been doing for 10 years now. She releases pigs for pork regularly 3-4 times a year. She also has few cows for meat. She said that she would not depend on her children as long as she still healthy and able. She is applying a loan of 400USD to invest in her livestock business. 

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.  
  
Bước vào tuổi 55 nhưng trông chị Thái Thị Sáu, thành viên chi nhánh 13 Quỹ Tình thương còn rất khoẻ mạnh. 5 người con đều trưởng thành và có khả năng tự kiếm sống, chị Sáu vẫn tiếp tục công việc chăn nuôi chị đã làm từ hơn 10 năm nay. Hàng năm chị vẫn đều đặn cho xuất chuồng vài ba lứa lợn. Thêm vào đó, chị cũng mua vài con bò và bán lại khi được giá. Thu nhập bình quân 130USD hàng tháng đủ cho cuộc sống của hai vợ chồng già. Chị Sáu tâm sự: Mình đang còn khỏe, vẫn lao động tốt thì không nên phụ thuộc vào con vào cháu. Với suy nghĩ như trên, chị Sáu vừa đề nghị xin vay mức vốn 450USD để mua lợn con và thức ăn gia súc.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Lino

texts.es:
Lino C. is 45 years old and has been married to Domitila Morel for 20 years. They have three children. Lina worked as a chauffer at a company for 15 years. Seeing the need to earn a higher income, he decided to become self-employed, selling blankets and hammocks which are woven by his wife. 7 years ago he managed to establish a signifant client base in the area where he markets his products.

It’s worth mentioning that thanks to Lino’s efforts, he was able to build a house and provide his children with an education. He is applying for this loan so that he can buy cotton thread in different colours - to produce and sell bedspreads and hammocks.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr Lino C. tiene 45 años está casado hace 20 años con la Sra. Domitila Morel, tienen tres hijos. Lina trabajo durante 15 años trabajó como chofer en una casa comercial y viendo la necesidad de contar con más ingreso decidió trabajar por cuenta propia en la venta de frazadas y hamacas que su señora teje. Hace 7 años que se dedica a actividad por lo que ya pudo lograr formar una cantidad muy importante de clientela en la zona donde comercializa sus productos.

Cabe mencionar que gracias a su esfuerzo pudo construir una casa y darles educación a sus hijos. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hilos de algodón de distintos colores para la confección de sobrecamas y hamacas para la venta.

loans.use: To buy cotton thread in different colours

loans.name: Jane's Udugu Group

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with a 1-year-old child. Jane owns a small grocery store, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $65 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Fatuma, Frida, and Siwema, who have grocery stores and a studio.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Comité San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
The "San Cayetano" Committee is formed by neighbors of the neighborhood of Villa Bonita of the city of Villa Elisa. This is one of the committees that is well organized and is stable. Even though they are only in their fourth cycle, during this time the have displayed the ability to together.

All of the members are working mothers. All of them have their own activities and some of them have full time jobs, in which case they perform their activity during their free time in order to earn extra money. The committee members get along very well and they have shown their unity in several occasions, whether working together in different activities or solving any problems.

The loans received from the Fundación Paraguaya were invested in the purchase of a variety of articles, the majority of them materials and merchandise for the businesses of the members. Some of these products are: meats, drinks, rice, noodles, etc. These products were purchased by the members that have small grocery stores and such. The members that have other types of businesses, such as the manufacture of cleaning products, sawing, etc. used their loans to buy the materials to make their products. These products are: fabric, thread, chemical products, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

El Comité “San Cayetano” se formó a partir de la unión de vecinas del barrio Villa Bonita de la ciudad de Villa Elisa, éste es uno de los comités que ha logrado una buena organización y estabilidad en dicha ciudad, si bien solamente están con el cuarto ciclo, en este tiempo han demostrado bastante capacidad.

Todas las integrantes del comité son madres y trabajadoras. Todas las integrantes tienen sus actividades propias, aunque algunas tienen trabajos formales, desarrollan sus emprendimientos en un tiempo extra para acrecentar sus ingresos. El comité lleva la mas armoniosa relación entre todas sus miembros y han demostrado su unidad en varias ocasiones, ya sea desarrollando actividades en forma conjunta, como solucionando cualquier inconveniente siempre bajo la decisión de la mayoría.

Los créditos recibidos de la Fundación Paraguaya fueron invertidos en la compra de varios artículos, la mayoría de ellos, materia prima o productos de mercancía para las actividades de las integrantes del comité. Algunos de estos artículos son: carnes, bebidas, arroz, pastas, etc.; estos artículos fueron comprados generalmente por las señoras que se dedican a su comercialización, o sea las que tienen despensa, casilla, etc., mientras que las otras personas dedicadas a otros rubros ( fabricación de productos de limpieza, costureras, etc.) utilizaron su crédito para la compra de materia prima para su actividad: hilos, telas, productos químicos, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of materials  and merchandise for their different businesses.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Nguyen Thi C. is 55 years of age. She has 4 grown children. In 2003, she joined the organization to help her invest in buying livestock in which she raises at home. From a small investment, she is able to expand her business after 5 seasons. Presently, she is able to increase her business by raising a variety of farm animals; cows, pigs and chickens all in large amount. Every month, she is able to retain a steady income and her family finance has since been stable. Besides raising livestock, she was able to purchase cows from other countries to breed. All of her children all grown and have job stability. Every month they are able to contribute some of their earnings to the family business. The family past income has gone from being average to a dramatic increase with the business success. This time, she is asking for a loan of 15.000.000d to buy more chickens and cows to raise. A small portion of this loan will be use to buy animal food in bulk at a wholesale price. Her income is 3.500.000d/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Cảnh năm nay 55 tuổi. Gia đình chị có 4 người con đều đã trưởng thành. Năm 2003 chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi tại gia đình. Từ việc đầu tư nhỏ lẻ, đến nay sau 5 vòng vốn quy mô chăn nuôi của gia đình chị đã được mở rộng hơn. Hiện nay gia đình chị đã mở rộng và chăn nuôi kết hợp nhiều loại con như trâu bò và lợn gà với số lượng lớn. Hàng tháng công việc chăn nuôi lợn gà của gia đình cho thu nhập rất đều đặn và ổn định. Ngoài việc chăn nuôi lợn gà, gia đình chị còn đầu tư mua bò giống nhập ngoại về nuôi. Các con của chị đều đã trưởng thành có công việc ổn định vì thế hàng tháng đều hỗ trợ thêm cho gia đình. Kinh tế gia đình chị từ trung bình hiện nay đã dần vươn lên ổn định và khá giả. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị mong muốn được vay thêm 15.000.000 đ để đầu tư mua thêm gà, bò về nuôi. Ngoài ra gia đình sẽ sử dụng 1 phần nhỏ để mua thức ăn dự trữ giá rẻ trong vụ mùa để phục vụ cho công việc chăn nuôi phát triển kinh té. Thu nhập bình quân 3.500.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Raising and buy Chickens  cows

loans.name: Nali

texts.en:
Nali is 39 years old. She is a married woman with 4  children aged between  16 and 4. She became a clothes seller in 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Nali now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes (Khanga) for her business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Moeung

texts.en:
Moeung S. H. is 56 years old and sells fruits and vegetables in the market to earn approximately $4.00 profit per day. Selling fruit has been a difficult business, as there is high inflation and weather conditions that have not been conducive to a good growing season. She is asking for a loan of US$600 to make two investments. She would like to  invest US$100 in her fruit business, and also use US$500 to purchase a grinding mill to service for extra profit. She sees these investments as opportunities to increase her daily income. (Mrs. Moeung is pictured with her daughter.)

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: $100 in fruit business and $500 to purchase a grinding mill to service for extra profit

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Mrs. Kong S. was born in 1963 and lives in Khvet Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She owns a small restaurant where she sells beer, drinks and food to support her household. Her husband, Mr. Dy Nheurn, is a farmer who has a hectare of rice-land to cultivate. Aside from farming,he also raises cattle. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it, so his wife is requesting a loan to buy another cow for her husband's cattle business. The couple has three children, two of whom are employed in different businesses while the youngest is a student at the local school.

loans.use: To buy another cow for her husband's cattle business.

loans.name: Ramzan's Group

texts.en:
Ramzan baji, the wife of A. L., lives in Chichawatni, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 40 years. Ramzan baji completed her education throught the 8th standard grade. 

Ramzan baji’s husband sells clothes. He has been in this business for the past 15 years. He buys clothes from different cities (Multan and Faisal Abad). Ramzan baji is a housewife who prefers to do household work. 

Ramzan baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to resell.

She is joined in her loan group by four more members. Mumtaz baji wants a loan to buy goats and sheep to resell. Azra baji wants a loan to buy material (beads, colored thread and sketches) for her decorative embroidery business. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit-selling business. Bakht baji wants a loan to buy a welding machine for her workshop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Baji, which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Khusnidin

texts.en:
S. Khusnidin is 44 years of age, married with 5 children and lives with his family in Shahrituz, Tajikistan.  He is dedicated to agriculture, having 5 years of experience in this activity.  

He has sown different kinds of vegetables and wheat.  A part of his crop is destined for personal use, and the majority he sells in the different markets of Shahrituz.  The income that he generates with this activity varies depending on the season in which the product is harvested.  That is why his wife supports him in paying the household expenses.  She is dedicated to the sale of their products. 

The economic situation of the country has affected the acquisition of the supplies for productive work.  The costs of fertilizers, supplements and insecticides have been increased to the point where he needs a loan to be able to buy them.  For this reason, he is asking for a loan of 4000 Somoni (1200 USD) for the term of 12 months.  You could become an important part of his family's life.  Khusnidin deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Mina

texts.en:
Mrs. Mina M., a resident of Thecho, Lalitpur, lives in an extended family. She has five members including herself in her family. Her father-in-law is a farmer. She has one daughter who attends pre-primary school.

Both Mrs. and Mr. M. are engaged in brass idol-making. They also employ two workers to help with their job. Their job is to decorate brass religious idols. They have got almost three years of experience in this job.

Now Mrs. M. is requesting a first loan of Rs 10,000 to buy different types of raw materials such as wax, bronze, and tools for their work.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for their work

loans.name: Lai Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Lai, 23 tuổi, ở Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Vợ chồng chị có 1 con nhỏ. Chị tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2003, tuy còn trẻ nhưng với sự cần cù, chăm chỉ và sử dụng vốn vay có hiệu quả trong những năm qua đã giúp gia đình chị xây được nhà mới. Nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình chị là từ dệt chiếu và chăn nuôi. Mỗi ngày gia đình chị dệt được 4 đôi chiếu thu được 100.000/ngày. Vòng vốn tới chị Lai xin vay 9000.000 để mua thêm nguyên vật liệu dệt chiếu.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lai Thi N. is a 23 years old woman in Quang Xuong, Thanh Hoa. The couple has a small child. Mrs. N. has been the TYM fund’s partner since 2003. Though young, she is a hardworking person and has been using the loans effectively; therefore they could afford to build a new house. The family’s income mainly comes from production of sedge mat and breeding animals. On average, they can produce 4 pairs of sedge mat per day, selling for 100,000 VND. Mrs. N. plans to make the next loan of 9,000,000 VND to buy more raw material for the production.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy material to produce sedge mat

loans.name: Chantal

texts.fr:
La signification d’ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique d’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux a 0% d’intérêt aux gens très vulnérables et il est dans un groupe qui lancent bientôt un programme de la microassurance santé. 
 
K. Chantal a 43 ans et elle a 4 enfants qui s’appellent Cervne, Mraain, Rosone, Yocovona. Trois enfants sont scolarisés et un est à l’apprentissage. Chantal vend les divers et les vivres comme le maïs, le riz, les haricots, l’huile d’arachide et les divers depuis 17 ans. Chantal achète ses produits au Marche Tokpa, le marché central de l’Afrique d’Ouest  et à la gare de Gbegamey, un quartier de Cotonou, Bénin. Dans le futur, Chantal voudrait commencer par vendre les sacs de riz.
texts.en:
Ms. Chantal K. is 43 years old and has four children named Cervne, Mraain, Rosone, and Yocovona. Three of them are in school and one is in an apprenticeship. For seventeen years, Chantal has been selling various goods and staple foods, such as corn, rice, beans, peanut oil, and more. She does her buying at the Tokpa Market, the central marketplace of West Africa, and at the station in Gbegamey, a district in Cotonou, Benin. In the future, she would like to start selling sacks of rice.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria, and it has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans at an interest rate of 0% to highly vulnerable people. It is part of a group that will soon launch a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various good, rice, beans, corn, and peanut oil

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia T. is forty-two years old. She is married with six children, two daughters and four sons. She says the last born is currently in senior high school while the rest have all completed school and are engaged in commercial activities.

Cecilia’s husband is a cocoa farmer. Cecilia is a petty trader to make some income to help her husband financially. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Dormaa is an agricultural-dominated town. It is about forty-five minutes' drive from Sunyani, the regional capital.

Cecilia sells "gari" and dried pepper. "Gari" is a local delicacy produced from cassava dough. It can be eaten raw with sugar and roasted groundnuts or with cooked beans. She procures bags of gari and dried pepper all the way from the borders of Cote D'Ivoire where she claims the cost is more reasonable.

Cecilia treks to other markets to sell her goods, mostly to food vendors. She says retailers also come to buy from her. Cecilia has been in business for seven years. She wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure bags of maize and pepper in bulk.

loans.use: To buy ‘gari’ and dried pepper for re-sale

loans.name: Mongolmaa

texts.en:
Mongolmaa O., 28, lives with her parents and younger sister in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Since 2007, she has been running a cellular phone sales business through a rented stall at the Tedy center. Tedy is the biggest cellular phone sales center in Ulaanbaatar.

When she began her retail business, her working capital was 1.5 million MNT ($1USD=1,600 MNT). She pays $230 monthly to rent her stall. Mongolmaa's average monthly income is 3 million MNT, and her average monthly profit from her business is 300,000 MNT. Once every three months she visits Ereen, a Chinese border city where many Mongolians who run businesses buy their goods, and brings back cheap cell phones to resell. Now, her working capital has increased to 5 million MNT. Her business has become quite successful. She is the only one in her family who brings in an income, as her parents are retired. Her younger sister is a university student and Mongolmaa pays for her tuition. "My sister will graduate from university next year. Then she will begin to work and become a salaried employee. At that time I hope my family's living condition will be improved," Mongolmaa says in Mongolian. She is a hard-working and humble personality. With this loan, she will buy more cellular phones.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones

loans.name: Sad Wasay Group

texts.en:
S. Wasay is the group leader of S. Wasay group. There are four members in this group, all of whom hope to expand their businesses:

S. Wasay wants to take out a loan for his general store business in order to purchase more materials for the store, thus significantly expanding its offerings. S. S. would like to obtain a loan for his taxi business and he wants to take on a new mechanic for his taxi. Gul Laden wishes to use his loan for his general store, to which he hopes to attract more clients. Talab Jan would like a loan to use for his car part shop.

The group wants to take out a loan of 56,000 Afghani over a term of 10 months. They are happy to have the opportunity to access the kind of lending process that can support entrepreneurs.

loans.use: For expanding the entrepreneurs' individual businesses.

loans.name: Yadira

texts.es: Yadira tiene 30 años, vive con sus hijos en casa de sus padres. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de útiles de escritorio, empezó vendiendo de manera ambulante, y actualmente se ha instalado en su misma casa donde vende su mercadería a sus clientes, que son en su mayoría, sus vecinos. Vende todos los días, solo descansa los domingos, y en ocasiones sus padres la ayudan en la atención de su establecimiento, pero la mayor cantidad del tiempo ella está presente para ofrecer una atención cálida a sus clientes. Sus ventas  han estado yendo muy bien, como en esta época de inicio de clases escolares que fue muy beneficioso para Yadira que incrementó sus ventas satisfactoriamente. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y se compromete, una vez más, a seguir trabajando con mucha responsabilidad para la devolución de su préstamo. Yadira está solicitando este dinero para invertirlo en la compra de mercadería en útiles de escritorio, regalos de ocasión, adornos y demás artículos para implementar su local y convertir su negocio en un bazar.
texts.en:
Yadira is 30 years old and lives with her children in her parents’ home.
She has sold stationery supplies for 2 years. She started as a street vendor, but currently sets up shop in her home, where most of her customers are her neighbours. She’s open every day, only resting on Sundays; sometimes her parents help, but most of the time she’s present to offer warmhearted service to customers.
Her sales have been going very well since the school year is just starting. This is the second time that she has requested a loan through MFP and she is once again committed to continue working responsibly to repay her loan. Yadira is requesting the money to purchase stationery supplies, occasional gifts, decorations and other items to stock her store and convert her business into a bazaar.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Née en 1964 dans le village de Zafi, localité située  à  47 Km de Lomé, dame A. Yawa est une veuve avec trois enfants. Elle a pour activité la vente de poissons fumés. Ce type de poisson est apprécié par la plupart des populations de Lomé. Elle s’approvisionne au Ghana et est une revendeuse ambulante c’est-à-dire qu'elle vend de maison en maison. Voulant augmenter son stock, elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 10 paniers de poissons fumés et payer les frais de transport. Avec le revenu de son activité, elle pourra prendre en charge les frais scolaire de ses enfants et assumer les autres dépenses domestiques.
texts.en:
Born in 1964 in the village of Zafi, situated 47 km from Lomé, Yawa is a widow with three children. Her business is selling smoked fish. This type of fish is appreciated by most of the inhabitants of Lomé. She buys her merchandise in Ghana and, as an ambulant saleswoman, she sells it door-to-door. Wishing to expand her stock, she is requesting this first loan to buy 10 baskets of fish and pay the transport costs. With the revenue from her business, she will be able to pay school fees for her children and cover other household expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of smoked fish for resale

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Mrs. Chantha N. lives in Srae Ampil village in Kandal province. She owns a small business in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Sok Thol, is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare field of land to cultivate rice. This couple earns little income to support their family's living. Now they want to add a business to earn more income for their family. Thus, Mrs. Chantha N. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to purchase an electric cow for her husband to plow their own field and the other villagers' fields. She hopes to improve and provide a better life for her family. She has two children who are too young to work or study. Her husband is shown in the picture.

loans.use: To add to her savings to purchase an electric cow for her husband to plow their own field and the other villagers' fields.

loans.name: Marieme

texts.fr: marieme D. est parent beneficiaire acamberene vendeuse de poissons depuis 1997.elle capitalise plus de dix ans d'experience dans ce domaine.elle sollicite ce pret de 50 000frs pour ameliorer ses conditions de travail.avec l'achat d'un frigo elle pourra assurer la conservation de ses produits.
texts.en:
Marieme D. is a client parent in Camberene and has been a fish seller since 1997. She capitalizes on over ten years of experience in this field. She is requesting this loan of 50,000 francs to improve her work situation. With the purchase of a refrigerator, she will be able to ensure her products are preserved.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 19-year-old man living in the town of Saida in South Lebanon. Abdallah supports his family because his father can no longer work due to his age. Abdallah has been a carpenter for two years, and he recently started a new business.

This is his second loan with A. Majmoua, which he always repaid with timely payments. With his first loan, he built a mini-train that he attached to his motorbike to give little kids rides on the Saida pier. This was the only business of the like in the area. This business has proven to be profitable, and he would like a second loan of $1,000 to create a second mini-train so that he can expand his business to the other parts of the pier.

loans.use: To create a second mini-train for his kids'-ride entertainment business

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma P. owns and operates a business making and selling dried food in her community. She is 25 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Sibula. Alma is just starting this business.

In 2008, Alma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Alma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase inventory and for working capital. Alma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of ingredients

loans.name: Ipogolo C Group

texts.en:
Teo is a member of the Ipogolo C borrower group,in Ruaha,Iringa she is 29 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children,Her children are aged 10,7, and 4 years.she also cares for other 2 dependents.

Teo started her own clothing business selling clothes 5 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Teo`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Teo hopes  to save money and expand her business.

Paida is another member of the same borrower group,she also requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to expand her clothing business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty tiene 24 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y persistente en sus metas, vive en la casa de uno de sus familiares (alquilada) y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida. La actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de golosinas, actualmente es la responsable de un kiosco escolar, en el cual ha puesto mucho empeño para que esté bien surtido de productos. Su kiosco es muy concurrido por los niños en los recreos, a quienes atiende con mucha paciencia y cariño. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender y lo hace muy bien ya que tiene bastante tacto para tratar a los niños, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su kiosco, ya que la escuela funciona en los turnos de mañana y tarde.
