Para el futuro espera tener una tienda de abarrotes con la cual pueda tener mejores ingresos.
Este es el quinto préstamo de Betty con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo, puesto que quiere acceder a otros préstamos en el futuro. En su banco comunal es una persona muy alegre. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más mercadería para que su kiosco luzca más atractivo.
texts.en:
Betty is 24 years old and is a very hard-working woman who is persisent in meeting her goals. She lives in the house of one of her family members, and what she desires more than anything is to excel in life. She makes a living by selling candy. Currently she is in charge of a school kiosk, in which she has put a lot of effort so that it is well-stocked with products. Her kiosk is very popular among the children during recess, and she attends to them with a lot of patience and care. The thing that she likes the most about her job is selling, and she does it very well since she has enough tact to deal with the children. She has been performing this activity for four years, and she considers the most difficult part staying inside her kiosk all day, since the school operates during the morning and afternoon shift. In the future she hopes to have a grocery store with which she can earn a better income. This is Betty's fifth loan with MFP. She knows that she has to pay it on time and is disposed to do so, since she wants to have access to other loans in the future. She is very happy in her communal bank. With the 2,500 nuevos soles requested, she will purchase more merchandise so that her kiosk appears more attractive.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the increase of merchandise.

loans.name: Agnes Wangari

texts.en: Agnes Wangari is 34 Years old. She is married and is the mother of three school-going children. Agnes has a clothes-selling business which she has been running for the last five years on a busy street in Narok where most residents do their shopping. Agnes learned about KADET from a friend who is already a registered client. This will be her third loan which she is planning to use to rent a permanent store where she will be able to sell her clothes without shifting the business since it is at a semi-permanent shed. With the profits she hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, she plans to expand her business to meet her clients’ demands. She also plans to have her own pick-up truck so that she will be able to sell her clothes even in the interior markets which she is currently not able to reach due to transport problems. Agnes’s future dream is to become a self-reliant woman who can also employ more people and uplift their living standards. She believes she is a courageous woman who is ready to work hard despite life's challenges. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes and to rent a permanent shop

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta D. is from the village of P-9, Luinab, Iligan City. She is 49 years old. Violeta is single. To make a living, Violeta sells purified drinking water in the local community. Violeta has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Violeta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Violeta is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Violeta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: P-9A, Luinab, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Ireda Agali 2 Among Jenate Group

texts.en: A. Jenate is twenty-four years old. She is married with three children, of which, two children are going to school. She is dealing with produce and it is, so far, three years that she has had her business. She is using the loan to purchase produce such as beans, maize, etc. to add stock to her business. She is interesting and active and her dream is to construct a new house.

loans.use: To purchase produce such as beans, maize, etc to add stock to her business.

loans.name: Ma

texts.en: Ma V. is a 55-year-old farmer and mother. She is widowed and blessed with one daughter. Her daughter is married and employed in a garment factory. Ma V. is applying for capital to buy rice in bulk to store. She will sell the rice when it commands the highest price.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk to store her stock supply.

loans.name: Roxana Elizabeth

texts.es: Roxana Elizabeth A. D. C. D. 29 años D. edad, resiD. en Colón departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo y su pequeña hija D. cuatro años D. edad. Roxana posee una venta D. verduras en el mercado D. Ciudad Arce, lo posee desD. hace cinco años, justo el tiempo que tiene D. vivir junto a su esposo. DesD. hace cuatro años Roxana se siente más comprometida por mejorar su negocio, ya que esta es la edad D. su hija, el motor que la hace seguir adelante cada día. Ella solicita un préstamo con el fin D. poder comprar más verduras, ya que desea aumentar las ventas D. su negocio, puesto que Roxana es una mujer que se proyecta a futuro y sabe que debe mejorar su fuente D. ingresos para brindarle una vida mejor a su hija.
texts.en:
Roxana Elizabeth A. D. C. is 29 years old and lives in the Colón department of La Libertad with her husband and four-year-old daughter. Roxana has a vegetable stall in the Ciudad Arce market. She has had this stall for five years - since she and her husband began living together. For the last four years, Roxana has felt more committed to improving her business, because since then her daughter has been the driving force giving her the strength to keep going every day. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more vegetables as she wants to increase her sales. Roxana is a forward-thinking woman who knows that she must improve her source of income to proviD. a better life for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of vegetables

loans.name: Monica Atieno

texts.en: Monica runs the MJ Tailoring business and sells clothes to frequent and new customers.  She has one employee and has been in the business for fourteen years.  Her business challenge is a lack of funds to buy materials for making clothes.  She is using the proceeds of KES50,000 to buy more materials.  In the future, she wants to open a big shop in a good location.  Monica is a widow and has two children.  She describes herself as hardworking and dedicated to her work.

loans.use: To buy more material for making clothes

loans.name: Mrs. Yorn Heab Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Y. Heab is the group leader of five members who all live in Chrouy Chey village in Kandal province.

Mrs. Y. Heab and her husband, Mr. Sou Sorn, are farmers who own a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) piece of land on which they cultivate rice to earn a living. On this farm they have a problem so Mrs. Y. Heab decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and fuel for her farm.

This couple has two children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study being only two years old.

Although this family tries to work hard, they still earn less income than needed to support their living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fuel for her farm

loans.name: Ret

texts.en: Mrs. Ret K. is 30 years old and she lives in Phngeas village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 3.5-hectare field to cultivate rice to earn for living. Her husband, Mr. Narn Orn, is duck breeder. Since her husband’s business is going well, he wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Ret K. decided to ask for 2,000,000 Riel from AMK to buy more ducklings and duck food, and the rest of the loan she would use to buy fertilizers, rice seed, and pesticides to support her rice field. Mrs. Ret K. is a mother of a child. This child is still too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, rice seed, and pesticides.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: El señor Miguel Ángel R. V., es un  productor que reside en la comunidad de gualiqueme a unos 15 km  de Condega, tiene una propiedad de 10 manzanas de extensión con diferentes tipos de aéreas para explotación, tiene 3 manzanas que las utiliza para cultivar granos básicos (frijol y maíz), y 7 manzanas apta para el cuido y manejo de ganado, el se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos de consumo como cultivo de frijol y maíz, también al manejo de ganado. La razón para la cual utilizara este financiamiento. Es para comprar 3 toretes los que espera que aumenten de peso para después venderlos a un mejor precio del que él los adquirió. Este cliente todo el tiempo se ha dedicado a esta actividad de trabajo,  inicio o comenzó  a cultivar granos básicos frijol y maíz,  únicamente en épocas de invierno,  esto lo hacía con ayuda de su esposa quien le apoya a realizar otras actividades importantes en el hogar,. Actualmente continua en esta actividades de agrícolas y ganaderas, con esto el espera seguir mejorando su actividad de trabajo y poder aumentar más su operatividad en todo tiempo ya que su principal fuente o forma de trabajo es la agricultura en épocas de invierno y en verano con esto del manejo de ganado el obtiene  otra alternativa o fuente que le genera ingresos,  Don Miguel Ángel R. V., lleva 8 créditos para este tipo de rubro o actividad de trabajo tiene 5 años de trabajar con Ceprodel. El impacto y beneficios que tiene el y su familia es de una forma positiva ya que con esta otra alternativa el obtiene otros ingresos que le permitirán mejorar su actividades de trabajo y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Miguel Angel is a Farmer who lives in the community of Gualiqueme, about 15 kilometers from the city of Condega. He has 1000 square meters of land split into different areas of production. He uses 300 square meters to grow the basic grains (beans and corn) and the other 700 square meters to raise livestock. He needs this loan in order to buy three young bulls to fatten up and sell at a profit. He has been doing this for a long time and began growing the basic grains only during the winter months with the help of his wife, who also helps him doing other important things around their home. He currently continues farming and raising livestock and would like to be able to do this year round, as his principle work is farming in the winter and raising livestock in the summer, which gives him another source of income. Miguel has had eight previous loans for this type of activity and he has been working with Ceprodel for the past five years. This has had a very positive impact and provided additional benefit to him and his family, now that he has other options that allow him to improve his income and lifestyle.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase three young bulls to raise and resell

loans.name: Keji

texts.en:
Keji P. is currently in the business of selling simsim in the market and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of simsim and groundnuts to sell. Keji is 24 years old and is married. Her husband is working in the ministry. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for renting.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of simsim and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Tung

texts.en:
Mrs. Tung S. is 54 years old, married, and the mother of five children: two are still single and attending school and the others are married. Two of them are employed as grocery sellers.

Tung S. and her husband currently cultivate rice and vegetable crops. In addition, Tung S. is also a local tailor and is hired by her nearby villagers to repair their clothes.

Tun S. is taking out her loan to purchase a motorcycle which she will provide to her employed kids for commuting to their work location.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her children to use for commuting

loans.name: Satya Laksana Group

texts.en: Ni Ketut S. (0) is a 62-year-old female living in the town of Melaya, Bali. She is the group leader of a fourteen-member group loan offered by MUK. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Satya Laksana Group (MUK-0014). Ni Ketut is married and has two adult children. She owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over a year and earns approximately 150,000 IDR a month. In 2010, Ni Ketut joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 1,500,000 IDR which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. The loan will be her first from MUK. Ni Ketut plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About MUK: The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives. ***************************************************** ni ketut S. (0) merupakan 62 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota melaya-bali. ni ketut adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 14 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah satya laksana (MUK-0014). Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. ni ketut sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 1 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, ni ketut menghasilkan sekitar 150,000 IDR. Dalam 2010, ni ketut bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. ni ketut meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,500,000 IDR. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK. Tentang MUK: Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Napier Group

texts.en:
Secondhand clothes are in high favor with many people in Uganda. Not one to be left out of this lucrative opportunity which had presented itself in her home area of Napier in Jinja, an enterprising and lively 35-year-old woman going by the name of M. Rashida made a decision to try to cash in on this craze.

In 2000, Rashida laid the starting foundation stone for her business. With the money she had saved working in a local beauty salon, she bought her first consignment of garments. With these she took root and, though her business has had its fair share of ups and downs, she has emerged as a resilient woman who has refused to buckle under any sort of pressure.

With this kind of spirit in tow, Rashida has made enormous headway as is manifest in the 60,000 shillings she purportedly makes in a week. She is one lady who likes taking a long view and as such she has drawn up a blueprint to expand her business selling secondhand clothes into a wholesale franchise.

With this loan, Rashida is optimistic she will be empowered financially to see her dream come true.

loans.use: To buy bales of additional garments

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose Luis M.  es un señor de 55 años de edad que vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijas en una comunidad llamada San Ramón de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Es una pequeña comunidad rural. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche, la agricultura principalmente de café, plátano y también se da mucho la cría de cerdos. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. 
Don Jose  se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra de Hortalizas como Banano, plátano y  cítricos. Dice que el mercado para este producto es muy bueno. Comenta que gracias a este proyecto sus condiciones de vida han mejorado considerablemente y dice además que ha crecido como persona y ha adquirido mucho conocimiento.
En estos momentos Don Jose desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢605,000 (seiscientos cinco mil colones), para agrandar su plantación con una hectárea de Platano, darle mantenimiento, además comprar fertilizantes entre otros insumos. Con esta inversión  espera lograr una buena cosecha, con un producto de características apropiadas para conseguir un precio de venta alto poder incrementar la producción. 

Don Jose Luis es socio de la Asociación de Productores Agrícolas Ramonenses, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su tercer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Jose Luis M. is 55 years old. He lives with his wife and two daughters in a community named San Ramón de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, in the Cartago province. It is a small rural community whose members work in milk production, agriculture (primarily coffee and bananas), and the raising of pigs. It has an irregular coast, and much of its terrain is a humid tropical forest. Jose works in agriculture, specifically fruit and vegetable cultivation like plaintains, bananas and citrus. He says the market for these products is very good. Thanks to this project, he says his quality of life has improved considerably. He also says he has grown as a person and has acquired a lot of knowledge. Currently, Jose wants a micro-loan of ¢605,000 (six hundred and five thousand colones) to increase his plantation with a hectare of plantains and maintain it. Additionally, he wants to buy fertilizers among other input costs. With this loan, Jose plans to have a good harvest with produce that will obtain a high sale price, so he can increase production. Mr. Jose Luis is a member of the Association of Agricultural Producers of San Ramón, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his third loan, and with it, he hopes to continue growing personally and economically and to participate actively in his community's loan organization.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying seeds and paying transport costs

loans.name: Omar

texts.es:
el sr. Omar C. tiene 46 años de edad, vive en el Cacerio San Juan contiguo al Mercado Municipal de el Triunfo Choluteca. 
Omar se dedica a la compra y venta de Carne de res, dicha actividad que realiza desde hace varios años.
el compra su carne en destazaderos y al por mayor asi obtiene mejores precios.
los dias en que tiene mejores ventas son los fines de semana, en estos momentos esta vendiendo una buena cantidad de carne pero necesita comprar mas ya que a veces se queda sin producto y pierde de vender.
el credito lo utizara para la compra de carne.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos de su hogar y de su familia.
texts.en:
Omar C., 46, lives in the San Juan settlement next to the El Triunfo Choluteca municipal market. He has been a beef merchant for several years; he buys meat at the butcher shops at wholesale to get better prices. His best days for sales are weekends; he is selling good quantities of meat but needs to buy more because sometimes he runs out of product and loses sales. He will use the funds to buy meat. He needs the profits to cover household and family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beef.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia P. is from the town of Banga. She is 48 years old. Sylvia is married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Sylvia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Sylvia has been engaged in her business for over four years already.

Sylvia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sylvia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Sylvia is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Sylvia from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve ad expand her business. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Rosa de 48 años vive en una zona periurbana de Guayaquil, ella tiene una tienda de vivieres pero antes de tenerla tuvo que esforzase y trabajar muy fuerte con sus hijos para lograrlo porque era madre soltera. 

Hace años atrás ella tuvo que invertir sus ahorros porque los pocos ingresos que tenia eran del padre de sus hijos, comenzó vendiendo algunos víveres en su casa a sus vecinos y conocidos, poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo convertir sus ventas en una pequeña tienda. Por esa buena decisión ahora ella tiene una tienda un poco surtida y trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días, aunque sus hijos ya crecieron y se casaron ella sigue trabajando.

Para poder agrandar su tienda ella quier comprar con el préstamo arroz, aceites y vegetales para su tienda, en el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa, 48, lives in a suburb of Guayaquil. She has a general store, but to start it she had to work very hard along with her children, since she was a single mother. She had to invest her savings because what little income she had was from the father of her children. She began selling provisions from her house to her neighbors and acquaintances, and little by little with hard work she was able to make those sales into a small store. Because of this good decision, she has a fairly well-stocked store, and works from 7:00am to 11:00pm every day. Even though her children have grown and married, she continues working. To grow her store, she wants to use the loan to buy rice, oils, and vegetables for her store, and in the future wants to finish building her house and continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Powell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, oils, and vegetables

loans.name: Future Traders Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Future Traders” group from Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

Also included in the photo is loan officer Edna B. C., pictured in the left handing over the loan.

Memuna B. (who is pictured second from left) is the leader of this group. The 33-year-old was born in Godrich, Freetown and is married with three children. She has been a businesswoman for ten years now. She sells charcoal which she buys from the provinces and sells in Freetown.

Memuna will use her share of the loan to buy bags of charcoal to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal to add to her business

loans.name: Flordelina

texts.en:
Flordelina P. is a widow who lives in Purok Kasoy, Brgy. Tabugon, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  a general store and a mobile vending businesses.  Her only child is 28 years old. 

Flordelina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Flordelina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 20th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500, which she intends to use as additional capital for the development of her business, to provide for their basic needs and continue to save for the future.  Flordelina P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Ngô

texts.en:
Thư Ngô Thị is a 35-year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To make a living, Thư owns & operates a business making & selling food.  The main source of income for the business comes from selling rice products in the local community.  She has been engaged in this business for over 11 years and earns approximately 3,600,000 VND a month.


In 2008, Thư  joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,600,000 VND from SEDA, which was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,496,000 VND, which will be used for the same purpose.  This will be Thư’s 4th loan from SEDA.  She  plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve and expand it.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 47 años de edad, ella vive junto a su esposo Víctor de 56 años y su hija Yobana de 17 años en su casa, que gracias a mucho esfuerzo lograron adquirir. El trabajo al que se dedica es el arrendar cuartos, que tiene disponible en su domicilio para personas que vienen de otros lugares, mayormente de provincia a encontrar oportunidades laborales o de estudios en la ciudad de Lima. Lleva 5 años y hasta el momento le ha sido muy rentable, actualmente es la encargada de administrar los ingresos de su negocio y con ello poder construir otras habitaciones para ser alquilados en el futuro. Ana se siente contenta con su trabajo pues le resulta muy cómodo realizarlo aunque muchas veces también le han tocado malos inquilinos que malogran la infraestructura y logran irse sin pagar por ello procura ser mas cuidadosa. Es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete de a ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, terminará de construir el piso del cuarto que próximamente alquilará.
texts.en:
Ana is 47 years old and lives with her 56 year-old husband, Victor, and her 17 year-old daughter, Yobana, in a home that they managed to buy with a lot of effort. She makes a living by renting rooms that she has available in her house to people that come from other places, primarily from the provinces to find work opportunities or to study in Lima. She has done this for 5 years and it has been profitable. Currently, she is in charge of managing her business’s income. She is using this income to build additional rooms to rent in the future. Ana is happy with her work, and she is very comfortable with it even though many times she has had bad tenants that have damaged the infrastructure and managed to leave without paying for the damages. For this reason, she is trying to be more careful. This is her first credit with MFP and she promises to be punctual with all of her payments. With the credit that she is requesting, she will finish construction on the floor of the room that she will rent out next.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish construction on the floor of the room that she will rent

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina, de 62 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su esposo José de 65 años y de sus 4 hijos mayores, de los cuales 2 son casados, pero aun viven con ella. Esta trabajadora mujer se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y accesorios de una reconocida marca, desde hace 1 año, recuerda como al principio, como en  todo negocio no fue nada fácil empezar. Ahora luego de algunos meses tiene regulares ganancias pues sus clientes que son fijas le hacen pedidos con regular frecuencia y le pagan a crédito, pero le gusta porque son puntuales. Lo que no le gusta es captar nuevas clientes, pues muchas veces ha pasado que no le cumplían en el pago, y eso le ocasionaba grandes pérdidas. Pero aun así no perdió la esperanza de continuar en la comercialización de productos por catalogo, con mayor esmero y dedicación para mejorar sus ganancias. Paralelamente a este negocio también se dedica a la compra y venta de productos al por mayor en provincias del Perú, en este negocio trabaja en sociedad con su nuera y dice que obtiene regulares ganancias que le permiten vivir cómodamente. Es el quinto crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere defraudar a todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Dina tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería de productos de belleza para mantenerlos en stock cuando una de sus clientas requiera algo.
texts.en:
Dina is 62 years old and lives in her own home with her husband José, age 65, and their four grown children. Two of her children are married even though they still live with her. Dina earns her living by selling beauty products and accessories of a well-known brand for the past year. She remembers that her business was difficult to get established at first. Now she generates a steady stream of income from her regular customers who place orders with her on a frequent basis. She extends credit to her customers and likes those occasions when they pay on time. What she does not enjoy is having to attract new customers since there have been several instances when she did not get paid and accumulated heavy losses. In addition to this business, she buys and sells products in bulk in other provinces of Peru with the help of her daughter-in-law. She says the income she generates from her businesses helps her to live comfortably.

This is her fifth loan with MFP. Dina promises to complete her payments on time because she does not want to disappoint everyone who made this loan possible so that she can continue working and making progress. She plans to invest the loan she requested in a large purchase of beauty products to maintain her inventory for whenever one of her customers needs anything.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products to restock her inventory

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 52 year-old Mohamed. He is married and has five children (aged 27, 21, 17, and 8 year-old twins). He has three additional dependents who live with him because they came for education since there is no opportunity for education in the village.  

In 1985, Mohamed established his bread business as a means to support his family. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about 1,379,000SLL every month. He would like a loan of 4,000,000SLL. Mohamed needs the loan to buy more bags of bread flour. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 206,850SLL. 

In the future, Mohamed plans to give his wife some capital to start a new business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase bread flour

loans.name: Mapinduzi Group

texts.en:
Happiness C. is in her mid-thirties and is married with four children. She has run a tailoring business since 1997. The business is open between 10 a.m. and 6 p.m. and earns her a good monthly profit.

This will be Happiness's tenth loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Her previous loans were used to change her business location and to buy cloth and lining, loans which she have successfully repaid. Happiness aims to use this loan to increase her stock of Vitaba (cloth), zippers, and other tailoring material. Happiness's dream is to one day earn enough profit to improve the premises of her business. 

Happiness will share the loan with her loan group, Mapinduzi, which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans. 

In the picture, Happiness is seen wearing green, sitting to the far right.

loans.use: Increasing stock of cloths, zippers and other tailor materials.

loans.name: Chem

texts.en:
Chem S., 47, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia: an area known for palm products. S. sells baskets, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. Her husband is a carpenter, earning an income of USD 2 per day. The family has to spend USD 83 on food, USD 10 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 25 on other necessary expenses every month.  

S. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a plot of farmland to produce more rice. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland to produce more rice

loans.name: Bol's Group

texts.en: Fourteen people are part of this village bank loan in Damrei Chhlang village in Kandal province. Mrs. Bol C. is a 39-year-old married woman and the group's president having been selected by its members. C. is a pig breeder while her husband, Mr. Mark Moeun, who is 39, works as a fisherman and also helps with his wife’s business. They still earn less income than is needed to support the family so C. would like to ask for a loan to buy more piglets to raise and pig food. The couple has four children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory and two are laborers, while the fourth is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and pig food.

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long S., 59 years old, is a rice and vegetable grower from Phnom Penh, the capital. Long S. is a widowed mother blessed with five children. Three of them are now married and the other two are single, and they all are employed at different occupations. She runs her business on her own farmland where she grows different kinds of crops like cabbage, rice, and potatoes, which she sells to a buyer when they have matured. She now earns an average of US$1.00 a day and has been running the business for years.

Currently, her crops are not growing well because they need more fertilizer. To remedy the situation, she would like a loan to buy two sacks of fertilizer for her crops to grow well.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of fertilizer for her crops to grow well.

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida lives in Multan, which is the fourth largest city in Pakistan, known for its sweetmeats and shrines. She lives in the area of Hazuribagh, which is a small residential area of the city. She has been living there for the past 10 years. Her husband’s name is M. S., and he is a rickshaw driver. He provides transport services for passengers and earns income for the family. Zahida has given birth to two sons and a daughter. Her eldest son works in a motor workshop as a motor mechanic, while her daughter does a bank job. Her youngest son is studying in 5th class. 

To support her family financially, Zahida operates a little boutique at home where she displays her stitched and embroidered clothes. She is a very active business woman who has a good number of business contacts. Due to her kind behavior and good business sense, she attracts a good number of clients every month and improves her sales. She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her boutique business. She will use the loan to purchase unstitched clothes and embroidery materials such as beads, colored thread and sketches to make more dresses of good designs to sell. She is confident that this investment will bring positive changes to her business and her income will further increase. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her. 

In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah passbook) is Zahida.

loans.use: To buy material for a boutique business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is forty-four years old.  She lives in the district of Las Lomas in the province of Piura in northern Peru.  It is a semi-tropical zone, primarily populated by farmers and ranchers.  Many residents own small fruit plantations or raise cattle or other animals.  Nancy maintains a stable home, living with her husband and their daughter.

Nancy raises sheep and hogs in corrals behind her home.  She has a small herd which she feeds with various local plants and feed from local mills.  She cares for the animals until they reach the appropriate size and weight to be sold in local markets or to neighbors.  The animals serve as an important part of many traditional dishes and the nutrition of the local populace.  The family has a small parcel of agricultural land which they inherited.  Nancy’s husband works on the land raising crops and also works as a farm hand on local plots during varying seasons and harvest times.

This will be Nancy’s first loan with Edpyme Alternativa.  She plans to use the loan to purchase additional feed for her animals in order to ensure their proper growth and maturation.  She hopes to be able to increase her family’s income over time in order to ensure that they are more stable economically and less dependent on the labors of her husband outside of the home.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed for her animals in order to ensure their proper growth and maturation.

loans.name: Jude

texts.en:
Jude R. is from the village of Dist. 4, San Manuel, Isabela. He is 44 years old. Jude is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Jude owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jude has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 30,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Jude joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jude is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jude from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Carla Ninoska

texts.es: Carla de 37 años de edad es soltera, labora para la Alcaldia de Juigalpadesde hace 10 años como responsable del departamento de fiscalizacion. Esta solicitando su 2do credito con el objetivo de terminar la construccion de un cuarto de su casa, pues desea poner el piso y repellarlo, para asi brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Carla is 37 years old, single, and has been working for the Juigalpadesde town hall for 10 years, responsible for the inspections department. She is requesting her second loan with the objective of finishing construction in a room of her house. She would like to install the flooring and plaster the room, to give her family better living conditions.

loans.use: Plaster of a room

loans.name: Bernarda De Jesus

texts.es: La Señora Bernarda De Jesús tiene 62 años. La actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 29 años que posee este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante y en su vivienda, por lo que sus inicios surgen con muy poco capital,  y con fondos propios pero con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Por lo que tenía que pagar las cuentas de su vivienda y además buscar el alimento diario. Poco a poco fue incrementando su inventario con las pocas ganancias que su negocio le generaba, hasta que se le presento la oportunidad de trabajar con Fundación León 2000. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas y camisetas ya que se acerca la temporada de entrada a clases. Su mayor sueño es seguir con vida para mantener esta actividad.
texts.en: Bernarda De Jesús is 62 years old. Her work is selling general merchandise. She has operated this business for more than 29 years. She sells both as a mobile vendor and from her home, so that she was able to begin with very little capital, using her own funds combined with a strong desire to get ahead. She had to work to pay her household bills and provide for her daily bread. Little by little, she increased her inventory with the small profits her business generated, until the opportunity arose to receive a loan from the León 2000 Foundation. The financing she is requesting is for working capital, so she can buy pants, shirts, skirts and t-shirts, since the back-to-school season is approaching. Her greatest dream is to live a long life so she can continue running her business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bernard Wekesa

texts.en:
Benard Wekesa M. is 31 years old and is married to Brigid Naliaka. They have four children. His wife runs a grocery store, while Benard is a tailor in Soy Sambu in Kitale town. He has been in this business for seven years now and makes a monthly income of KES.12,000.


This will be Bernard's first loan from KADET LTD. He will use the entire loan to buy material for making clothes. With the income he is going to get he plans to expand his business by buying various tailoring equipment. 

In the future Benard hopes to grow his business and to educate his children to the highest level.

loans.use: To buy material for making clothes

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es: La señora Valentina es una cliente que tiene mucho entusiasmo D. trabajar con nuestra institución "emprender",  ella se siente beneficiada D. gran manera con el préstamo que se le otorga, ella se dedica a  la   venta D. comida se levanta muy temprano para preparar los alimentos y poderlos vender a los niños que van al colegio que queda cerca a su vivienda, para ella es un trabajo sacrificado debido a que debe levantar ollas con bastante peso para poder salir a su negocio que se encuentra ubicado en la puerta D. su casa. Con los ingresos que percibe mantiene y paga los estudios D. sus  dos hijos  debido a que hace poco tiempo falleció su esposo y quedó viuda. Ahora el crédito lo  destinará  para comprar  una movilidad y hacerla trabajar en el transporte público y así mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Señora Valentina is a client who has a lot of enthusiasm to work with our institution of entrepreneurship.  She feels greatly benefited by the loan that she is offered.  She is dedicated to the sale of food.  She rises very early to prepare the food and to be able to sell to the children that go to the school that is located close to her dwelling.  For her it is difficult work due to the fact that she must carry heavy pots to her place of business that is located in the door of her house.  With the income that she earns she maintains and pays for the studies of her two children.  A short time ago her husband passed away and left her a widow.  Now, the loan will allow her to buy a car to be able to work in public transportation and thus to improve her income.

loans.use: To buy a car

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María Elena, es socia del Banco Comunal Alelí, tiene 19 años y un hijo.
Maria Elena se dedica a la venta de ropas y calzados para damas y niños. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías. María Elena viaja a Lima y trae ropas y calzados de Lima y los vende entre sus vecinas, le pagan a diario o semanal, ingreso a Finca Perú, por la invitación de su tía, con este es el tercer ciclo que está, le gusta porque le dan un capital para trabajar, puede ahorrar y le enseñan valores y le capacitan a como invertir su capital, a mejorar en su familia y matrimonio.
Su sueño es poder ahorrar para su casa y que su hijito tenga una buena educación.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is a member of the communal bank named Aleli. She is 19 years old and she has a son. 

Maria Elena sells ladies' and children's clothing and shoes. The loan that she requests will be invested in the purchase of merchandise. Maria Elena travels to Lima and brings clothing and shoes from Lima to sell to her neighbors. Her customers pay her daily or weekly. She joined Finca Peru (Kiva Field Partner) following an invitation by her aunt. This is her third loan cycle. She appreciates it because she is given working capital and she is able to save. They teach values and how to invest their capital funds, as well as how to improve their family life and marriage.

Her dream is to save enough money for a house and that her little boy will have a good education.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing for the season

loans.name: Saul

texts.en:
Saul M. is from the village of Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 43 years old and married with two school-aged children. Saul owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. The main source of business income comes from manufacturing and selling firewood products to local businesses and community members. Saul has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Saul joined Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to access financial services to improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Saul is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP that he will use to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This is Saul's first loan request to GDMPC.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC):
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es: Magaly  D. L. C. D. 66 años casada y madre D. 5 hijos, es una mujer  muy trabajadora que aplica toda su creatividad innata al desempeño D. una actividad que le genera ingresos: L. Confección; su negocio nació cuando procedente D. su natal Punta D. Piedra, en el departamento del Magdalena, llegó a L. ciudad D. BarranquilL. a los 19 años, donD. inició trabajando en una empresa D. confecciones y devengando un salario por producción, allí desarrolló toda su creatividad y 4 años después conformó su hogar y así mismo empezó   su necesidad D. adelantar una actividad que le permitiera atender sus hijos y generar ingresos simultáneamente;  D. esa manera nace el negocio que hoy sostiene y que  le ha permitido no solo su crecimiento productivo, sino también su crecimiento personal en términos D. desarrollar su autonomía y D. haber adquirido muchas amistades que hoy son sus principales clientes y que son muy fiel a sus servicio; por ello se esmera en diseñar cada día nuevos productos que estén a L. moda y que ayuden a que otras personas manejen una imagen personal y profesional adecuada.  Este es su quinto financiamiento con L. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con L. que ha logrado hacer cambio significativos en su familia y para su familia, como las adecuaciones D. su vivienda que son posible gracias al crecimiento del negocio que esta organización ha apoyado,  con L.  cual permanece actualizada y  ha logrado cambiar toda  su  maquinaria y ofrecer productos cada día D. mejor calidad. Su sueño es continuar apoyando el buen desempeño D. sus hijos, elL. especialmente  tiene como meta lograr que su hija  culmine estudios universitarios, pues su sueño es que sea una profesional D. éxito.  En L. actualidad  Magaly quiere aprovechar L. infraestructura locativa comercial, en L. que se encuentra ubicada y el número significativos D. clientes para ofrecer nuevos servicios, pues está muy cerca a 3 centros educativos que comprarían sus servicios D. fotocopiaje, transcripción, internet e impresiones y esta es L. razón por L. cual está acudiendo a su credikiva, inversión que generará otros ingresos y mayor rotación D. su efectivo.
texts.en:
Magaly D. L. C., 66, is married and the mother of five children.  She is a very hard working woman who applies her innate creativity to an income generating activity: Dressmaking.  

Her business arose when she arrived in BarranquilL. at the age of 19 from her native Punta D. Piedra in Magdalena Department.  She started working in a dressmaking firm earning a salary based on production.  She developed her creativity there and four years later started her own home and needed a way to earn income while caring for her children at the same time.  Thus is born the business she has to this day that has maD. not only her productive growth possible but also her personal grown in terms of developing her autonomy and having gained many friends who are now her main customers and who are faithful to her.  Because of this she strives daily to design new items that are fashinable and that will help others to have adequate personal appearance.

This is her fifth loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization with which she’s managed to make significant changes in her family and for her family like some home improvements that have been possible thanks to her business’ growth that this organization has supported and that permit her to be up to date modernizing all her equipment in order to offer better, higher quality products daily.

Her dream is to continue to support her children’s development.  Her main goal is that he daughter complete her university studies because her dream is that she becomes a successful professional.

Currently, Magaly wants to take full advantage of the commercial prospects the privileged location of her business has for it’s located near three educational institutions with significant numbers of potential customers to whom she can offer the new services of photocopying, transcriptions, Internet access and printing.  This is the reason she’s requesting a Kiva loan, an investment that will generate other income and improve cash flow.

loans.use: to buy a computer, a photocopier and a printer.

loans.name: Gustavo Antonio

texts.es:
A sus 45 años de edad y como padre de familia responsable de sus dos hijos y de su esposa, Gustavo Antonio P. C. ha sido un gran emprendedor toda su vida. Inicialmente tuvo una carnicería la cual se quebró debido a la competencia, después para empezar de nuevo se desplazó hacia el municipio de Betania al suroeste de Antioquia con la ilusión de empezar de nuevo y ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su familia. 

Fue entonces cuando con lo poco que tenía compró un coche para realizar acarreos en el municipio y las afueras del mismo, debido a la difícil situación económica que enfrentaba se vio en la necesidad de innovar y convertir su coche en una legumbrería ambulante, lo que le ha permitido mejorar sus ingresos y así cubrir los gastos familiares. 

Actualmente, Gustavo necesita realizarle algunas adecuaciones a su coche para mejorarlo, aunque sus aspiraciones son el furo son comprar una moto de carga para transportarse hasta otros municipios, por ahora va creciendo en la medida de sus posibilidades y sabe que su perseverancia harán que su sueño sea una realidad.
texts.en:
At 45 years of age and as a responsible husband and father to two children, Gustavo Antonio P. C. has been a great entrepreneur all his life. He originally had a butcher's shop which went bankrupt due to the competition. Afterwards he moved to the municipality of Betania in the south east of Antioquia with the idea of starting over and offering his family a better future.  

It was then that he purchased a car to provide a transport service in the municipality and the outlying areas. Due to the difficult financial situation he was faced with, he saw it necessary to innovate and turn his car into a travelling vegetable cart which helped him to improve his income and cover the family's cost of living. 

Gustavo currently needs to make some repairs to his car, even though his future aspirations are to purchase a motorbike which he can use to travel to other municipalities. For now he is concentrated on expanding the possibilities of his business and he knows that his perseverance will turn his dreams into reality.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Cristian Enrique

texts.es:
Cristian es soltero y vive en casa  de sus familiares en el distrito de Olmos a  2 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Cristian vive en una zona urbana con gran concurrencia de público.

Cristian empezó trabajando con moto alquilada, poco a poco fue ahorrando su dinero hasta que pudo obtener lo necesario para  poder comprar una mototaxi (moto con una cabina para trasportar personas).

Cristian  ahora tiene su mototaxi propia y se dedica a transportar pasajeros, cuenta con más de un año en el negocio, con esta mototaxi Cristian realiza fletes de frutas y otros y también ofrecer los  servicios de movilidad escolar.

Cristian está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 para que pueda realizar un mantenimiento a su mototaxi, solucionando algunas averías que se le habían presentado   

Cristian ha demostrado su espíritu ganador y sobresaliente. Tiene buenas regencias laborales y  muestra gran capacidad y voluntad de pago. Este préstamo le ayudara mucho para su vida y para su negocio.
texts.en:
Cristian is single and lives at the home of his relatives in the District of Olmos, which is two hours away from the city of Chiclayo. He lives in an urban area that has plenty of public activity.

Cristian started working with a rented motorcycle. Gradually over time, he saved enough money to purchase a motorcycle taxi (a motorcycle with an attached cabin for transporting people).

Now that he has his own vehicle, Cristian has been in the business of transporting passengers for more than a year. He also transports loads of fruit and other products. Cristian even offers rides to students who need to get to school.

He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN so that he can maintain his motorcycle taxi. This will repair a few problems that have started appearing.

Cristian has demonstrated that he has an entrepreneurial spirit and the desire to succeed. He has good work references and has shown that he has the capacity and willingness to pay. This loan will be a great help to him in his business and in life.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Efrain Enrique

texts.es: Efrain es un  hombre de 57 años que tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 15 a 27 años y vive en el municipio de Malambo, donde se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada, cuadros al óleo, fritangueria y venta almuerzos. Él  inició su experiencia de negocio hace 7 años  con una tienda, pero otorgó muchos créditos irrecuperables y debió cambiar de actividad para lograr alternativas más rentables y menos riesgosas; fue así que con el apoyo de sus dos hijos menores, empezaron a vender productos mediante guías especializadas a la que  luego agregaron sandalias, bisutería y elaboración de cuadros al óleo;  Efrain siempre buscando oportunidades de ingresos donde obtuviera dinero diario,  comenzó a vender fritos  diariamente y los fines de semana almuerzos, porque su meta es progresar en su negocio poco a poco y lograr habilitar un local, para surtirlo con toda la mercancía que él vende, pues su mayor desafío es ofrecerles una educación de calidad a sus hijos.  Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el comprará 5 docenas de sandalias, 7 oleos,  artesanías, cerámica, bisutería relojes y materia prima en mayor volumen para elaborar fritos y los almuerzos que vende con una freecuencia semanal, en la actualidad  su clientela se ha incrementado  día a día y mientras cumple con su sueño, continua esforzándose en la generación de ingresos familiares mediante sus negocios a través del cual obtiene una rentabilidad no menor del 51%.
texts.en:
Efrain is a 57-year-old man who has three children between the ages of 15 and 27. He lives in the city of Malambo where he works selling a variety of merchandise such as oil paintings, fried snack foods and prepared lunches. He began his business experience seven years ago with a shop, but he extended credit that in many cases was unrecoverable, and had to change the business so he could achieve alternatives which were more profitable and less risky. Thus, with the support of his two younger children, they began to sell products through specialized guides to which they later added sandals, costume jewelry and the making of oil paintings.  Efrain is always looking for income opportunities to bring in money every day. He began selling fried snacks on a daily basis and lunches on the weekends. 

His goal is to progress in his business little by little, and be able to set up a shop, and stock it with all the merchandise he sells. His greatest challenge is to be able to offer a quality education to his children. This Kiva credit is his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it he will purchase five dozen pairs of sandals, seven oil paintings, handicrafts, ceramics, costume jewelery and a large volume of basic ingredients for making fried foods and the lunches he sells weekly. Currently his customer base is growing day by day, and, as he makes his dream come true, he continues on diligently to bring in a family income by means of his business, in which he achieves a profitability of no less than 51%.

loans.use: to buy five dozen pairs of sandals, seven oil paintings, handicrafts, ceramics, costume jewelry, clocks and a large volume of basic ingredients for making fried foods.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su novia y sus dos menores hijos en la comunidad rural de Mórrope  en Lambayeque. Este lugar se caracteriza por ser zona de agrícolas y ganaderos.

Carlos se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores contando con 15 años de experiencia en este negocio y con clientela fija, él actualmente posee  un ganado ovino que cría en un corral ubicado en la parte trasera de su casa.

Carlos solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 3000 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra de alimento balanceado, así como, en la compra de más animales para ampliar su producción. Además, Carlos utilizará parte del préstamo en la compra de abarrotes para habilitar su nuevo negocio de venta de comestibles.

Carlos es un hombre emprendedor, con muchos deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida, goza de buenas referencias personales y ya ha trabajado con nuestra institución. Tiene un buen historial crediticio.
texts.en:
Carlos is 36 years old, and lives with his girlfriend and his two young children in the rural community of Mórrope en Lambayeque. This is an area known for agriculture and livestock.

Carlos raises and sells young animals, and he has 15 years of experience in this business with a fixed clientele. At present, he has a sheep that he cares for in a pen located behind his house.

Carlos requests a loan for 3000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa that will be used to buy animal feed and more animals to increase his production. Also, Carlos will use part of the loan to buy groceries to stock his new business, which will sell food products. 

Carlos is an enterprising man, with a desire to improve his quality of life. He has good personal references and has already worked with the institution. He has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy animal feed, animals, and groceries for his business

loans.name: Jorissa

texts.en: Jorissa is married with 2 children. She is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. Jorissa is a farmer who has been raising cows and goats for 3 years to earn a living. She has requested a loan to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Jorissa has become a member of PMPC just this year.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: C4715 Abahujumugambi Group

texts.en:
Thaciana is 28 years old and is married with three children. Her business is well-organized and is well known in the business of selling products like rice, sugar, beans, sorghum, bananas and so on. Thaciana is the team leader of this group which is called "Abahujumugambi". In the picture, Thaciana has raised her hand.

Her business hours are from 7am until 5pm every day except on the weekend, and she currently employs one person to help her.  She has five years of experience in this business.

Thaciana and her team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase their businesses by cultivating more products (rice, sugar, beans, sorghum, bananas and so on) for sale. They will reinvest the profits in their businesses and save for their futures.

loans.use: To cultivate more products.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en: Esperanza is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Esperanza has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has run this business for six years. She has requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks. Esperanza has been a member of Kiva partner, HSPFI, since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
As a father of two children, Armando, 32, manages his hog-raising business well to earn income to support his family. A farmer in the Philippines for almost eight years now, he earns an average income of P30,000 in each sale cycle.

Armando is requesting a loan of P18,000 to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for his hogs. He hopes that the loan will help him raise more pigs to earn a higher income in order to finance his children's education. He also aspires to establish a business in the retail sector and will do his best to achieve his goals for the sake of his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for his hog-raising enterprise.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is 29 years old.  He is married and has 3 children aged between 9 and 2 years old. His wife is a market vendor and they live in their own house in Karuguuza, Uganda. 

Lawrence has been operating a produce business for the last 2 years, selling especially maize and beans. From this business, he has been able to buy land although he faces a challenge in the high inflation rates in the country.  His dream is to buy his own truck to transport his goods. Lawrence needs a loan to buy maize and beans to resell.

loans.use: buy maize and beans

loans.name: Elgen

texts.en:
Elgen is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Elgen has a shop that sells fish like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy fish to sell.
Elgen has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Elgen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 42 years old, and a married woman. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for 14 years. According to her, the income she obtains from this business was used in buying a side car, and some went to her motorcycle transport monthly payments.

Agnes gets up early every morning to feed the pigs, and she feeds them three times a day. She has been doing this to get good earnings. She sells her pigs alive because it saves her from heavier work that she wouldn't be able to do because she looks after her little child.

Her goal in her business is to increase her income. She is asking for additional capital amount of P18,000 to be use in buying two piglets and feed for her raised pigs. She hopes that she will be able to sell her piglets at a higher price so that she could support her school aged children and give them a quality life.

loans.use: to buy two piglets and feed supplies for her hog raising business

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Diana Carolina  tiene 22 años, Vive en Unión Libre vive con el cónyugue y los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 2  hijos de tres y cinco años de edad.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JOSE DE LOS AMARILLOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Amarillos, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Diana se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial Murillo y los vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz,fréjol y poder comprar semillas, insumos,  fertilizantes, urea, abonos agrícolas  para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito anterior le ha ayudado mucho porque ha podido cosechar producto bueno y lo ha vendido en un buen precio y le sirvio para suplir sus necesidades económicas. 
En eltrato con la familia ha mejorado esta estable.

Diana se enfrenta a muchos desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener un negocio propio y que sea rentable.

En los tiempos libres le gusta escuchar música y salir a divertirse.
texts.en:
Diana Carolina, 22, is living with her spouse and two children, ages three and five, in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province. 

The members of the “SAN JOSE DE LOS AMARILLOS” communal bank are located in Amarillos, which belongs to Ventanas Canton.  They are short cycle corn and rice farmers.

Diana farms corn and rice. She buys her products at Comercial Murillo and sells them there as well.

She is requesting the loan to plant corn, rice, and beans.  She will also buy seeds, supplies, urea, and natural and chemical fertilizers for her crops.  Support from the previous loan has helped her a lot because she has been able to harvest a good product and sell it for a good price.  It served to satisfy her financial needs.  In that period of time her family has improved; it is stable.

Diana faces many challenges like pest infestations, illnesses and the variations in the weather. 

Her dream is to have a business of her own, and that it is profitable.

In her free time she enjoys listening to music and going out to have fun.

loans.use: to plant corn, rice, and beans and to buy seeds, supplies, urea, and natural and chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es: Ana Margarita  de 62 años de edad, reside en casa propia junto con su hija de 26 años la cual es empleada y ayuda un poco con los gastos del hogar. Ana se dedica a la confección y venta de diversos estilos de prendas de vestir. Ella es una mujer ejemplar ya que a pesar de su avanzada edad  no se cansa de trabajar y sigue luchando por mejorar su situación económica y la de su familia. Ha trabajado toda su vida en esta actividad y gracias a Dios y a su trabajo esto es lo que le ha permitido salir adelante y dar a su hija lo necesario. Muchas personas la prefieren ya que si de confección de ropa se trata ella es la mejor en la zona. Además ofrece variedad de estilos a los mejores precios. Cuenta con mucha clientela ya que ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer amable y sobre todo dedicada en su trabajo. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su pequeño negocio en la compra de la materia prima necesaria (telas, hilos, agujas, elásticos, etc.) para elaborar diferentes prendas de vestir que ayuden a atraer a más clientes que  le permitan mejorar su nivel de ingresos así como su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana Margarita, 62, lives in her own house with her 26-year-old daughter who is employed and helps a little with household expenses.  Ana is a seamstress and sells articles of clothing in various styles.  

She’s an exemplary woman who despite her advanced age does not tire of working and continues to strive to improve her and her family’s economic situation.  She’s worked her entire life in this occupation and, thanks to God and her work, it’s allowed her to get ahead and provide her daughter with what’s been necessary.  

Many people prefer her because she’s the best clothes maker in the zone.  In addition, she sells a variety of styles at the best prices.  She has quite a few customers because she’s noted for being a kind woman who is, above all, devoted to her work. 

She’s made the decision to ask INTEGRAL for a loan to invest in her small business.  She will buy needed raw materials (fabric, thread, needles, elastic, etc.) to make a variety of articles of clothing that will help her attract more customers that will lead to increased income and improved quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, needles, elastic, etc.

loans.name: Elmira's Group

texts.en:
Elmira is the leader of this group. She is 44 and married to a mechanic. Together with her husband she is bringing up a son and a daughter. The son is a student and the daughter is not yet because she is preschool age (under seven). 

At the moment, Elmira is trying to open a small nice canteen. She is applying for the loan because she needs money to purchase tables for the canteen. In the future, she hopes her business will be successful.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase tables.

loans.name: Anelita

texts.en:
Anelita is married, 41 years old with 2 kids living with her. She lives in San Apolinario, Tangub City.
She sells different kinds of vegetables like eggplant, string beans, and pumpkins to earn a living and has been in this business for more than 16 years. Each month she earns Php 3,000 doing this type of activity.

She requested a loan in the amount of Php 7,000 to purchase more vegetables to sell. She is in her 3rd loan cycle. Anelita acquired a food stall in the market where she is able to display her vegetables.

Anelita has been a member of GDMPC since 2008. In the future, Anelita is wishing that her business will prosper and plans to buy a motorcycle for vegetable delivery. She delivers vegetables to her "suki" customers (regulars).

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
La señora Rosa María tiene 35 años de edad, es originaria y reside en el Barrio San Jorge del municipio de Intibucá departamento de Intibucá,  es madre soltera de dos niños que se encuentra en edad escolar.
Es cliente activa de ODEF desde el mes de junio del año 2005 y no ha presentado ningún problema con sus pagos. Ha manejado un promedio de dieciocho préstamos con la institución, siendo cliente categoría “AAA". 
Las actividades que ella realizan son la venta de productos de la canasta básica (pulpería). El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación y tiene más de nueve años de funcionamiento por lo que demuestra ser un negocio estable.

Actualmente ha solicitado nuevamente un préstamo el que utilizara para surtir su negocio comprando productos alimenticios. Ella espera incrementar sus ventas y con las ganancias mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa María, 35, es originally from and still live in the San Jorge neighborhood of Intibucá municipality, Intibucá Department.  She’s a single mother of two children who are school aged.

She’s been an active ODEF client since June, 2005 and has never had a problem with her repayments.  She’s averaged 18 payments with the institution and she’s a “AAA” category client.

The activity she carries out is selling basic staple items (groceries).  The business is home-based and she’s been in operation for more than nine years so it’s a stable business.

At present she’s asking for a loan once again to stock the business buying foodstuffs.  She hopes to increase sales and improve her quality of life with the profits.

loans.use: Compra de productos alimenticios

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 43 years old and has one child aged 13. She sells foodstuffs in a store she has run for six years. She would like a loan to buy beans, sorghum, and maize to sell in her shop. Florence will use the profits to create savings for her future.

loans.use: To buy more beans, sorghum, and maize.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is married to a tailor and has three children. She sells a local dish popularly known as "kokonte". She has been doing this for the past eight years now. 

Emilia uses her income to assist her husband with their children's upkeep. She will use her loan to purchase cassava and meat for the preparation of the "kokonte".  With the new profit, Emilia will expand her business

loans.use: purchase cassava and meat for the preparation of  "kokonte".

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children.  Ruby has a construction shop that buys & sells sacks of gravel & sand. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy more stocks of sand & gravel.

Ruby has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy sand & gravel

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Juana; Continua con su negocio de venta de pescado y pollo en el mercado de Urcos, la socia tiene sus proveedores de los cuales compra pescado y pollo para la venta, la socia solicita el credito para invertir en la compra de pollos y de pescado y en estas fiesta como es de costumbre la socia compra pavos para venderlos en visperas de año nuevo.
texts.en:
