Juana continues with her business of selling fish and chicken at the Urcos market.  She has her suppliers from whom she buys fish and chicken to sell.

Juana is requesting the loan to buy chicken and fish.  During these festivities she buys the customary turkeys to sell for New Year’s Eve.

loans.use: to buy chicken and fish, and to buy turkeys to sell for New Year's Eve.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cereals for sale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Auntie Gladys sells vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, peppers, and so on from house to house in her community. Recently she is unable to buy from farmers. She is seeking a loan of $600.00 from Kiva to enable her to buy in bulk for re-sale.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa has been separated from her husband for over ten years and she is in charge of raising their only child. For several years her ex-husband would send her money in order to help cover the expenses for her household but now she is fully dependent upon her business. She opened her small store thanks to the support of her aunt who always encouraged her to find a means to sustain herself. From her small store she sells a variety of products ranging from condiments to detergent.

Elsa is a repeat Kiva and Mifex borrower. She has done great with her first loan. Elsa first invested her money in increasing the inventory of her store. Once she made her capital back and increased profits, she went on to make adjustments to her store and home. She finished building a section of the store out of cement and now it is much bigger and accommodates many more goods. She will use her second loan to purchase the goods to fill the new space in her store.

loans.use: Buy goods for her bigger store

loans.name: Juana

texts.en: Juana Sucuquí T., 31, has run her little store for three years. She sells various food items and also new clothes.  She has a refrigerator for cold drinks and a freezer for ice cream and meats. Before she got her first loan and started the store, she worked as a laborer on a farm.  Her husband also sells new clothing and music CDs in the street. Juana has already completed nine six-month loans successfully. She'll invest this loan in new clothes for sale. Juana and her husband have their own house, and her mother lives in back. Her dreams are simple: she wants to see her three children prosper. They're 10, 6, and 1 year old, and the two older kids are doing well in school.

loans.use: Purchase additional clothes to add to inventory.

loans.name: Albino

texts.en:
I have a small business selling used clothes and tennis shoes. My sales are strong, but I would like to invest in clothes for the new season, as I have been unable to meet my customers' demand due to a lack of capital. I am requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 to invest in inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo una venta de ropa usada y tenis mis ventas son muy buenas, pero me gustaría invertir un poco más en ropa de temporada ya que mis clientes me piden cosas que no he podido comprar debido a que me cuestan más caras”. Solicito 1,000.00 dlls para invertirle a mi negocio.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Yem

texts.en: Mrs. Yem S., aged 32, works with her husband to farm a plot of land growing rice crops, earning about $3.20 per day. They have one child, who is a student. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to purchase a hand-tractor to increase the efficiency of their rice cultivation and increase crop output. This will increase the family’s income, which they plan to use to fund their child’s education and reinvest in their farm.

loans.use: To purchase a hand-tractor to increase crop cultivation.

loans.name: Marianella

texts.es:
Marianela is 25 years old and is the owner of a motorcycle-drawn cart and the mother of two children: Lesley (1 year) and Shirley (7 years) who is in the second grade of elementary school. Her husband drives the motorcycle cart, the income from which Marianela uses for daily expenses and for the wellbeing of her children. She, like all mothers, hopes her children will become professionals some day. This noble mother needs to improve her motorcycle cart, which is the only means of support for her home, and needs capital to acquire vehicle parts and open a small bodega soon. With your support we will succeed in helping this young mother reach her goal soon and give a breath of hope to her family.

Translated by Princeton University Language Project.

Marianela, de 25 años de edad, es propietaria de un motocarro y madre de dos niños Lesly de 01 añito y Shirley de 7 años, quien cursa el segundo grado de educación primaria, su esposo conduce el motocarro y aporta con su desempeño diario 15 nuevos soles, los cuales utiliza, Marianela, para sus gastos diarios y sobre todo para el bienestar de sus hijos; ella como toda madre espera que sus hijos sean profesionales algún día.Esta noble madre tiene la seria necesidad de mejorar su motocarro, ya que es la única herramienta de trabajo que tiene para el sustento de su hogar, y necesita un capital que le ayudará a adquirir los repuestos que necesita su vehículo de transporte a fin de instalar una pequeña bodega en corto tiempo. Con tu apoyo lograremos que esta joven madre cumpla su propósito en muy corto tiempo y así dar un aliento de esperanza a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of parts for her motorcycle-drawn cart

loans.name: Zam's Group

texts.en: Zam, the Group Leader, is 38 years old, and married with four children. Her current business is tailoring and selling clothes.  She wants to use the extra profits from the business to buy a sewing machine and also pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Marachi B(Ii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Saida Z.. She is currently in the business of charcoal sales and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Saida is 39 years old and is married to a farmer. She has 6 children ranging from age 12 to 20 and only three go to school.

Each week, Saida makes approximately UGX 200000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children. Saida has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 600000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Saida is joined in her small group by Jane Nansirumbi, Sarah A. and Rose N.. Jane Nansirumbi has a butcher shop and wants to add to her business. Sarah A. is currently operating a business selling new clothes and wants a loan to expand her clothing business. Rose N. operates a business of new clothes and wants to increase the stock of clothes for sale.

loans.use: To expand charcoal business

loans.name: Kimombasa South C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Fatuma Z.. She is currently in the business of running a drug shop and is requesting a loan to stock more drugs to sell. Fatuma is 32 years old and is married. She has 5 children ranging from age 2 to 10 and her children go to school. Each week, Fatuma makes approximately UGX 15000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land for her children. Fatuma has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 150000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Fatuma is joined in her small group by Daudi M., Suzan N., Zaina K., and Nulu K.. Daudi M. has a business selling clothes and wants to boost business. Suzan N. is currently operating a business in charcoal sales and wants a loan to expand to bulk selling. Zaina K. operates a business of cattle trading and wants to add more capital. Nulu K. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to construct a charcoal shade.

loans.use: To add working capital to drug shop business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase different supplies

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia started her business because she has always liked sewing. At first, she only did jobs for her family, but later she started to provide services for other people. This business has been optimal for her because she is doing something that she loves, and at the same time, she is making money to help her husband cover the family expenses.

She started her business 20 years ago, and has been sewing her whole life. Even though she lives in an impoverished area, people seek her services because they like her work and she always completes her job on time. She has always worked from home, and wants to keep doing so because she can take care of her household matters and work at the same time, which she really likes.

She is requesting a loan of $500.00 USD, which will be repaid in 6 months. This loan will help her purchase fabric, thread, buttons, and zippers, the materials she uses most, because it is necessary to have them at hand.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Cecilia inició el negocio porque siempre le ha gustado la costura y inicialmente solo hacia trabajos para su familia, pero ya después empezó a darle el servicio a otra gente y le dio buen resultado porque hace algo que le gusta y a la vez gana dinero para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia. Comenzó con el negocio hace 20 años, y ya tiene toda una vida haciendo costuras y aunque vive en un lugar modesto la gente de todas maneras me busca porque les gusta su manera de trabajar y siempre tiene a tiempo el trabajo de las prendas que le traen. el negocio siempre lo ha tenido en su casa y piensa seguir allí porque le da la facilidad de no descuidar la casa y a la vez trabajar en lo que realmente me gusta.

Solicita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses. Este crédito e servirá para poder comprar telas, hilos, botones y cierres porque son los materiales que mas usa y es necesario tener el material a la mano

loans.use: Purchase sewing materials

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge is a taxi driver in the city of La Paz and it is his primary source of income, covering the needs of his three children (one attending the state university, another is in school, and the last suffers from a mental illness). The family lives in the city of La Paz in the Alto Tejar region.

His loan request is to change his car. The car he currently depends on is in a state of disrepair an it doesn't permit him to work without interruption.

This is his fourth loan through Impro. His previous assessment was favorable.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Jorge es transportista de servicio público (conductor de taxi) en la ciudad La Paz, es su principal fuente de ingreso, la cuál cubre la manutención de sus tres hijos (uno asiste a la universidad estatal, otra al colegio y la última sufre de una enfermedad mental). La familia vive en la Ciudad de La Paz Zona Alto Tejar. Su solicitud de crédito es para cambiar la herramienta de trabajo (el automóvil), la que cuenta actualmente se encuentra en mal estado y no le permite trabajar continuamente. Este es su cuarto crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica favorablemente la solicitud de este cliente.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en: Moeun S., 28, works as a tailor in Kampong Cham where she lives with her husband, Thai Tha (pictured above), and their two young children. Since she must also take care of the children at home, Moeun S. typically makes US$ 2 each day as a tailor. Her husband raises pigs. Her husband is running a profitable business and they believe that if they are given an opportunity to expand, then they can increase their production to meet customer demands. She has asked for a loan of US$ 300 to build a barn for their pigs, allowing them to raise many more pigs at one time. She believes this investment will increase her family’s income and can improve their standard of living.

loans.use: Build barn for pigs

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr:
Maimouna D. is 24 years old, is married and has 2 children of whom she takes care. She has been a member of the Vélingara Foulbé 2 village bank for the last 3 and a half years. She would like to build her trade of palm oil and food staples (dry fish, onions). This loan will be reimbursed in six months in one installment.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Maimouna D., 24 ans, mariée avec 02 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Vélingara Foulbé 2 depuis 3 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son commerce de l’huile de palme et de condiments (poissons secs, oignons). Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Trade of palm oil and food staples

loans.name: Ghulam Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Ghulam Fatima baji is a wife of M. S. and lives in a city named Pakpattan. Pakpattan is famous for its historical and pious places. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 30 years. She is the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Ghulam Fatima baji’s husband is a daily wage laborer. She has a business of making cots from rope. She has been in this profession for the last 10 years. Presently, she is out of stock. This is the season for selling cots because, in the summer season, lots of people go outside from their rooms to sleep in an open space. For that it’s very difficult to lift heavy furniture. She requires a loan to buy rope to make more cots to sell.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Keena baji wants a loan to buy more fruits to resell. Manzooran baji wants a loan to buy fertilizer to resell. Zahida baji wants a loan to buy a rope machine to make cots.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy rope to make cots

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana T. sells garri and corn in Ebute market, located along Ojo Lgbede road, Lagos state, Nigeria. She operates her shop from 7am to 7pm, Monday through Sunday. She is 48 years old and she is a widow with 6 children.  She works hard to pay her children's school fees and provide shelter and clothing for them.  Christiana has the zeal to lift her family above poverty. Christiana has been in this business a long time ago. She is a LAPO client. Christiana needs a loan of $850 to buy more corn and garri to sell. She expresses her gratitude to all Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE.

loans.use: To buy more corn and garri to sell

loans.name: Marhamat

texts.en:
Marhamat is a 55-year-old woman and, after 18 years, still has her own business selling corn and wheat at the market. Her daughter helps her with the business.

Marhamat is asking for a loan of $1200 to expand her business and she promises to pay it back in time.

loans.use: To expand the corn and wheat-selling business

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
U. Hasan is a 38 year old man who lives with his wife.  He has always worked in agriculture, and since his marriage, he has put his experience to work in the fields so that he and his wife might achieve well being in their family.  

Their jobs take up most of their time every day, and require plenty of hard work, but they enjoy it.  They are especially proud of their product, which they care for by purchasing manure and fertilizer which helps them to grow their crops successfully.  

The cost of these necessary items, however, is very high.  Hasan must care for his children every day, and this is his main motivation to work hard.  He would like to make an investment in wheat and potato production, so that he can have a successful enough crop which will provide a bright future for his children.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer for sowing potatoes and onions

loans.name: Bileyo

texts.fr:
Madame K. est une jeune femme âgée de 25 ans.  Elle a pour l’activité le vend des produits cosmétiques dans une boutique dans le marche d’Agoè, un quartier de Lomé, la capitale du Togo.  Elle veut obtenir un crédit afin de reconstituer son stock avec 4 cartons de crème, 3 cartons de lotion, 5 cartons de parfum, et 6 cartons de déodorants.  Commençant ce commerce Depuis  2004, elle a une fois bénéficié d’un crédit au près de WAGES et elle a bien rembourse.
Madame K. est mariée avec un lieutenant et ils ont un enfant.  Avec le revenu de cette entreprise, elle peut aider son mari dans les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. K. is a young woman aged 25. She runs a business selling cosmetic products in a shop at the market in Agoè, an area of Lomé, the capital of Togo. She would like to obtain a loan in order to reconstitute her stock with 4 boxes of creams, 3 boxes of lotions, 5 boxes of perfumes, and 6 boxes of deodorants. Having started this business in 2004, she has benefited from one previous loan through WAGES, which she repaid without incident. Mrs. K. is married to a lieutenant and they have one child. With the income from this business, she is able to help her husband in meeting the family's expenses.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania!  This is 49 year old Rebecca N. from Mwanza. She is married with three children, between the ages of 25 and 28 years old. She is also responsible for supporting a dependant, a child whose parents could not look after. Rebecca N. has been running a Duka business. She owns a small duka or neighborhood shop in the city. She has been selling common household and grocery items since 2004. Rebecca's business is doing well. She works at her business for 13 hours a day, 7 days a week and currently earns about 144USD. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to buy more supplies of her shop like breads, soaps, sugar, biscuits, lotions, and cakes. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Rebecca thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of her shop like breads, soaps, sugar, biscuits, lotions, and cakes

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Dembagnouma sont mariés, âgés de  25 à 51 ans, mères de 5 enfants en moyenne et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier Ganabougou de la préfecture de Yanfolila (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes qui font le commerce des articles divers,  sont partenaires de Soro Yiriwaso  depuis 3 ans .Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe. Tous les prêts précédents  ont été correctement  remboursés.
Les femmes veulent acheter, 10 pièces de pagnes wax et une importante quantité de produits cosmétiques (du parfum, des crèmes pour la peau etc.). Elles s’approvisionnent  à Bamako (capitale du Mali) auprès de divers grossistes dans leur spécialisation. Elles vendent en détail, au comptant et à crédit, les produits cosmétiques et les tissus (découpés en plusieurs  « 3 pagnes ») à Yanfolila à une clientèle essentiellement composée de femmes. Ces activités commerciales peuvent faire gagner aux femmes en  moyenne une marge bénéficiaire mensuelle de 40.000FCFA. Ce qui leurs permet de rembourser l’échéance du prêt et de faire face à certaines dépenses du foyer (santé, éducation, habillement…etc.)
En perspective chacune de ces femmes veut agrandir sa clientèle, posséder une boutique et ajouter d’autres articles.
texts.en:
The members of the group Dembagnouma are 25 to 51 years old, married and have on average 5 children. They live in traditional extended families in the neighborhood of Ganabougou in the préfecture of Yanfolila (Third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These women sell various items and have been partners of Soro Yiriwaso for 3 years. This is their fifth group loan. All the previous loans have been fully reimbursed.

The women want to buy 10 pieces of Wax brand pagnes [traditional wrap around cloth] and a considerable quantity of cosmetic products (perfume, body cream etc...). They stock up in Bamako (The capital of Mali) at specialized wholesalers. They sell retail the cosmetic products and the fabric (cut up in several pieces "3 pagnes"), for cash or credit, in Yanfolila to customers who are mostly women. These commercial activities enable the women to make on average a monthly benefit of 40, 000 FCFA [about USD 78].

This allows them to reimburse their loan and cope with some of the household expenses (Health, education, clothing, etc...). In the future, each one of these women would like to increase their clientele, own a shop and add on other items.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric and cosmetic products

loans.name: San Blas Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo gracias a la Sra.Ester Caballero que es grupo San Blas , quien le comento acerca de la Fundacion y del programa a la Sra Liz Elvira R. Noguera. 
Podemos hablar de la Sra. Del Rocio Antonia Ovelar, tiene 28años, con 3 hijos, ella vive en una casa precaria hecho de tabla y techo de chapas, tambien vive con ella su madre, la Sra. Del Rocio se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras por el Asentamientos y por los barrios .Ella hace su compra del mercado de Abasto se va a las 4:00 de madrugada se y regresa a su casa para las 6:00 de la mañana y realiza su recorrida con su hijo mayor, mientras los otros se queda al cuidado de la abuela.
La Sra.Del Rocio dice que hay poner empeño y coraje para sobresalir adelante, y con esta ayuda que le da la Fundacion espera ella va salir adelante con sus hijos. 

Nº	Nombre y Apellido	Actividad
1	Aidalina C. M. 	Vta de Frutas y Verduras
2	Nicolasa B.. 	Vta de tappers
3	Lorenza M. de C.	Vta de Comida
4	Ermelinda Orue G.. 	Despensa
5	Lilian Maria A. V 	Vta de Ropa

6	Gladys A.R. L.	Vta de Bebida 
7	Liz E.R. N.	Despensa
8	Del Rocio A.G.. 	Vta de Frutas y Verduras
9	Maria F. V. L. 	Vta de Ropa
10	Liz M. L. E.
	Vta de Ropa.
11	Maria D. B. F. 	Vta de Frutas
12	Ramona C.R. N.	Vta de Utiles Escolares
13	Transita G..	Vta de Carne
14	Lucila A. de G. 	Vta de Carbon
15	Nelly L. de Rodas 	Vta de Empanada y Helados. 
16	Francisca Ortiz M.	Modista
17	Alicia B. de G. 	Vta de Prod.Avon
texts.en:
The San Blas Group was formed thanks to Mrs. Ester Caballero, who told Mrs. Liz Elvira R. Noguera about the Foundation and the program. We can talk about Mrs. Antonia Ovelar Del Rocio. She is 28 years old, has 3 children, and lives in a poorly constructed house made of boards with a sheet metal roof. Her mother, Mrs. Del Rocio, also lives with her. She works selling fruit and vegetables in the settlements and neighborhoods. She buys her merchandise from the basic provisions market at 4:00 am and returns home at 6:00 am to complete her sales circuit with her oldest son while the other children stay under their grandma's care. Mrs. Del Rocio says that she has to put forth a lot of determination and courage to get ahead, and with the help that the Foundation gives her she hopes to get ahead with her children. Number Name and Last Name Activity 1 Aidalina C. M. Fruit and vegetable sales 2 Nicolasa B. Plastic storage sales 3 Lorenza M. de C. Food sales 4 Emelinda Orue G. Grocery 5 Lilian Maria A. V Clothing sales 6 Gladys A. R. L. Beverage sales 7 Liz E.R. N. Grocery 8 Del Rocio A.G.. Fruit and vegetable sales 9 Maria F. V. L. Clothing sales 10 Liz M. L. E. Clothing sales 11 Maria D. B. F. Fruit sales 12 Ramona C.R. N. School supplies sales 13 Transita G. Meat sales 14 Lucila A. de G. Charcoal sales 15 Nelly L. de Rodas Pastry and ice cream sales 16 Francisca Ortiz M. Dressmaker 17 Alicia B. de G. Sales of Avon products

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grocery sales of: noodles, rice, flour, oil, powdered soap, salt; Sales of herbal remedies: mint, perdudilla, horsetail, anise, tarope,santa lucia, burrito, malva, salvia, etc.

loans.name: Jurabek

texts.ru: Кабиров Джурабек проживает в районе Джилликуль.Возраст 32 года , женат и имеет пятерых детей.Занимается животноводством . Имеет хозяйство , где разводит мелко рогатый скот. Опыт работы составляет три года. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Jurabek K. lives in Jilikul. He is 32 years old, married, and has five children. He works in animal husbandry. He has a plot of land where he raises livestock. He has three years experience. He plans to take out a loan to increase his flocks. He can pay off the loan in twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the number of likestock

loans.name: Kuini

texts.en:
Kuini S., 28, is married with three children. She has three years of experience in the sewing business. She sells to the village people and the public six days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (approximately 160 USD).

Kuini has two previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are Kuini’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine and material for puletasi (the traditional formal garment worn by Samoan women)

loans.name: Morena

texts.es: Morena M. de 23 años de edad reside en el municipio de El Rosario y vive junto a su madre. Ella posee una tienda la cual esta ubicada en su propia casa y se encuentra frente a una escuela por lo cual cuenta con varios clientes. A pesar de su corta edad y de ser soltera ella trabaja muy duro día con día para obtener el dinero necesario para ella y su madre, ya que en dicha tienda ella comercializa jugos enlatados, golosinas y también hace pupusas (platillo típico salvadoreño el cual esta hecho a base de masa de maíz o arroz, la cual se mezcla con chicharro, queso y frijoles y se le da la forma de una tortilla). Es su madre quien le ayuda en el negocio a Morena, ambas se esfuerzan mucho debido a que esta es la única entrada económica que ellas poseen. Debido a que sus ventas son bastante aceptables, ella solícita un presta para obtener el capital necesario para comprar los productos requeridos para la elaboración de las pupusas, ya que este es el producto que más se vende en su negocio, Morena desea mejorar sus ventas para poder obtener mayores ganancias y una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Morena M. is 23 years old and lives in the municipality of El Rosario with his mother. She has a store located in her home in front of a school. Despite her young age and of being single, she works very hard day to day to earn the necessary money for her and her mother. At the store she sells bottled juices, snacks and also makes pupusas (a typical Salvadoran dish made with corn or rice and mixed with pork rind, cheese and beans in a tortilla). Her mother helps her with the business, and both give a lot of effort because it is the only source of income they have. Because the sales are quite acceptable, Morena is requesting a loan to have the necessary capital to purchase the ingredients to make pupusas since that is the best-selling product. Morena wishes to improve her sales to increase her earnings and have more economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make pupusas, a typical regional dish

location.town: Rosario de La Paz, departamento de La Paz

loans.name: Hector Francisco

texts.es: Don Hector es soltero, de 51 años de edad, trabaja para el Hospital Asuncion desde hace 30 años, esta solicitando su 6to credito para comprar zinc y cambiar el techo de su casa que esta en mal estado y con el invierno se moja; sus creditos anteriores los ha utilizado para invertirlos en su vivienda, como levantar paredes, pintura, etc, no tiene apoyo de nadie, sus 2 hijos son estudiantes universitarios. Don Hector es tecnico en refrigeracion y los fines de semana realiza trabajos a domicilio como son reparacion de equipos dentales y refrigeracion, con lo que obtiene un ingreso aproximado de cinco mil cordobas con los que hace frente a la educacion de sus hijos.  Durante sus 5 creditos ha demostrado moral de pago y un excelente record crediticio.
texts.en:
Hector is 51 years old and single. He has worked for the Asuncion Hospital for the past 30 years. He is requesting his sixth loan from AFODENIC to buy zinc to put a new roof onto his house, since his current roof is in bad shape and leaks in the winter. He has also invested his previous loans in his home (for example, to build walls and to paint). He doesn't receive financial help from anyone else, since his two children are college students. Hector is a cooling system technician, and on weekends he repairs dental equipment and refrigerators, which earns him about 5000 cordobas (US$340) per month to help pay for his children's education. With his previous five loans, Hector has shown himself to be reponsable with repayments; he has an excellent credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy zinc for new roof

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
“Having faith in God and one's own abilities will lead to a successful living,” is the motivation of Remedios A..

She completed a vocational course in sewing and is happily married to Angelito A.. They live in the rural community of Barangay Murong Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya, with their two children. Remedios operates a village store and hopes that the business will someday grow.

Remedios is requesting a loan from ASKI and Kiva Lenders amounting to PHP 10,000 as additional working capital for her business. Her husband's occupation is farming and she is doing her best to assist him with their farm inputs needs. Her weekly income from the business also will be saved for her weekly payments to ASKI.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is 30 years old. She is currently single and mother to one child, currently in school. She divorced out of unfaithfulness on the part of her divorced husband, she tells us. She lives at Suhum, at the eastern region of Ghana with her child. Therefore, the responsibility of the child and business progress rests of her shoulders. She is determined to provide for her child through hard work and commitment. To support her child, she has been selling cosmetics: products like spray, powder, lip gloss, blouses etc. and sells through hawking. She has been in business for a year and a half now. She says selling of cosmetics is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make a good income to sponsor her children’s education. She is sure that your loan support will bring her the desired results she expects. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Gye Nyame’, which literary means Except God.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cosmetics.

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following its development MLF “MicroInvest” transformed into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. In October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” founded the Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”.
“Arvand” continues to carry out its mission, which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

K. Mamlakat first applied to  MicroInvest in 2006 but after its transformation into “Arvand” she started working closely with “Arvand”. Today she is one of the active clients who trusts our organization and intends to help continue our work. Mamlakat is married with 3 children; they live in Zafarabad.  She is a loving mother who does her best to ensure the good future of her children. For the last 6 years Mamlakat has traded dry fruits and rice. She works with the supplier so she can sell her goods at prices lower than in the bazaar. She has repeat and wholesale customers. 
Mamlakat is applying to KIVA for a loan of 2000 STJ, which she will use for importing rice from Iran. Iranian rice is  popular and having it to sell should help her business increase. 
Mamlakat thanks KIVA for the small business support and wishes all the best.

loans.use: importing rice from Iran

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
48-year-old Lorna E. owns a small rice field in their village. She has four children who are all studying and a husband, Leopoldo E., who manages their farm. It was in the year 1980 that they started farming. They have been doing the same thing because they are able to earn a better income from growing rice, which helped sustain their family for years now.

However, she is currently needing additional capital for her business. She would like to ask for a loan worth Php 10,000 to buy fertilizer and chemicals. She hopes that by making this move, she will be able to improve their harvest.

Lorna chose CEVI because of its services. She receives not just loans but education as well to run her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and chemicals

loans.name: La Alternativa 1,4 Group

texts.en:
Juana E. runs a clothing business from her home near Samaná, Dominican Republic. For the past six years, she has been dedicated to providing her neighbors with men’s, women’s and children’s apparel, and has found her business to be quite successful. She took out her first microloan a year and a half ago, and is beginning her fourth loan cycle with Esperanza.

A smart businesswoman, Juana seeks out the best prices for clothing from cities all across the northwestern part of the Dominican Republic – she even travels to the border with Haiti to buy less expensive clothing in order to help garner a profit. She is so well known in her neighborhood that she no longer has to go door to door to sell clothing. Before she goes to Santiago or another location to purchase her inventory, individuals come to her home and request a customized list, and Juana is more than happy to find exactly what they want.

Currently living with just her husband, Juana has seen all three of her children (two daughters and one son), not only get married, but also pursue college education. With her business, Juana has been able to support her children’s education. One wishes to be a nurse and another studies English. Smiling, she adds (as any mom with college-age students might say), “Now they have to pay the university on their own! When you’re married, you pay for your own stuff.”

In the future, Juana wishes to have her own store where she can sell her clothing. She is hoping that future earnings can help her afford to build an extra room on her house dedicated solely to her business. To improve her home, she is also hoping that extra profits might allow her to replace her wood walls with ones made of concrete blocks.

Thank you for your loan to Juana and the others in her group!

loans.use: To buy new men's, women's and children's clothing

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a member of the Lukosi borrower group in Kihesa,Iringa,she is 39 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children,Her children are aged 20,13 years.she also cares for other 2 dependents.

Rehema started her own Grocery business selling beer,soda 3 years ago,she works 11 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 180,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Rehema`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more soda,beer.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Rehema hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more beer,soda

loans.name: Pedro Alfonso

texts.es:
El señor Pedro Alfonso G. posee su negocio de venta de granos básicos en el mercado central de la ciudad de León donde vende arroz, azúcar, maíz y aceite en su establecimiento.

Actualmente, ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los granos básicos ya que le es de necesidad comprarlos tales como el arroz, azúcar, frijoles y maíz con la finalidad de ofertarlos a sus clientes que a diario le visitan.
texts.en:
Sr. Pedro Alfonso G. has a business selling basic grains from the central market of the city of León. He sells rice, sugar, corn and oil from his vending post.

He has come to CEPRODEL to request a loan to purchase basic grains, including necessities such as rice, sugar, beans, and corn, so that he can continue to offer products to his customers who visit him daily.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains

loans.name: Celsa Arelis

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega, especificamente en el Mercado El Bisne, la señora Celsa B. se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de bebidas tales como jugos, gaseosas, agua entre otros siendo ofrecidas ambulantemente con un termo ofreciéndolas principalmente en las estaciones de buses.

La razón por la que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para la compra de las bebidas y de esta manera continuar ofertándolas ambulantemente para llevar el sustento a su hogar.

loans.use: Compra de las bebidas

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 43 years old and married with a child. She is a farmer. She is requesting a loan for the amount of 30,000 NGN to purchase more seedlings, to plant and cultivate her farmland. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their help.

loans.use: To purchase more seedlings, to plant and cultivate her farmland

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson B. is 51 years old. He has been engaged in mushroom production for almost three weeks now and he also has a vegetable plantation. He has been selling fruits and vegetables for three years in the public market and earns a net income of PHP 400.00 per week. He would like to request a loan from KIVA lenders in the amount of PHP 5,000.00 to buy more goods to sell. He would like to earn enough money to pay for the schooling of his three children. Nelson is married to Emilyn B., who works as a midwife in their town. They have blessed with loving children. The eldest, named Scarlet, is 28 and a third year college student. She is followed by Kelvin, who is 19 and also a third year college student. Their youngest, Kimberly, is 12 and a second year high school student. Their family is happily residing in the rural village of Sta. Maria. Their house is near the rice fields. Nelson hopes that KIVA lenders will grant him this loan.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Borey

texts.en: Mrs. Borey B. lives in Samchat village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Mrs. Borey B. has decided to ask for a loan to buy pig food for her breeding business since it is doing well. She is 33 years old and a widow without any children.

loans.use: to buy pig food for her breeding

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet S. is a very wonderful businesswoman rendering tailoring services since the year 2006. She is 35 years of age and living with her spouse. S. Juliet is blessed with four children all going to school and she aso looks after two dependents, one who is schooling. She is using the loan to purchase clothing material for designing different clothes for sale. She says with the loan, she has learned to think very fast as well work very hard to meet her target. She wishes to obtain a plot of land in Ntungamo town and build a house in her name, S., so that she can remain proud of herself and the Kiva loan the rest of her life.

loans.use: To purchase clothing material

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary B. is from the village of Balanlinao, Plaridel Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Rosemary is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosemary owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Rosemary has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosemary joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemary is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosemary from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Nervith

texts.es:
La señora Nervith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Siempre Unidas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 56 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Nervith, lleva 25 años dedicándose a la confección de vestidos, ya que teniendo conocimiento en este tipo de actividad, no dudo en implementar su propio taller de costura, ubicada en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, donde diariamente atiende a sus clientes fijos, que ya la conocen y necesitan el servicio. Trabaja con pedidos que con anticipación sus clientes le solicitan y siempre regalando una sonrisa y con amabilidad sus clientes se sienten muy contentos y satisfechos. En la actualidad, esta muy contenta y orgullosa por lo logrado. 

Con el préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies y colores, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, hilos en carretes grande y de variados colores, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Nervith is a member of the “Siempre Unidas” (“Always United”) Communal Bank in the Tarapoto district of the province of San Martin. She is 56 years old, married, and has 2 dependent children.

For 25 years, Nervith has been a dressmaker. She has her own sewing studio in a very well-appointed area of her home. Every day she attends to her regular customers, who know her well and need her services. She takes orders for garments in advance and her customers always smile happily upon delivery, very satisfied with her work. She is currently very pleased with and proud of what she has achieved.

She will use this loan for 3,000 Peruvian nuevos soles to purchase lengths of fabric in a variety of styles and colors as well as sewing supplies, including scissors, thread, needles, pins, and buttons.

Today, Nervith feels very fulfilled, and really wants to get ahead and realize the rest of her dreams. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her begin her business and for helping other women who want to be entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sewing supplies

loans.name: Phun

texts.en: Phun K., 45, is married and lives with her two school-aged children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. K.'s business is selling brooms in the city, earning an income of US $3 per day. She has been in this business since 1998. Her husband sells brooms as well, earning US $3 per day. He travels everywhere in his province to sell his broom products. K. and her family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well as cover their necessary daily expenses. Therefore, K. is requesting a loan of US $1000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to buy cows to plow her rice field and to transport the rice to store at home. This is her first loan from CREDIT. (Her husband is pictured here.)

loans.use: Purchase cows to help plow rice field and transport rice

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es:
El banco comunal 12 de Abril está formado por 15 socias activas, se caracterizan por ser mujeres  trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan tener y ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida  a sus familias,  todas las socias del banco comunal tienen su negocio de venta de comida o venta de frutas y verduras.

 Este banco está ubicado en la ciudad de Cuenca, siendo la tercera ciudad más importante del Ecuador, es reconocida por sus escritores y artistas, su belleza arquitectónica, los 4 ríos que bañan la urbe, las hábiles manos de sus artesanos y su suculenta gastronomía, así como por la calidez de su gente siempre amable acogiendo al turista nacional y extranjero.

La señora  Luz R. es socia otra de las socias activas de éste banco, se encuentra en su quinto ciclo trabajando con la Fundación, ella  vive en la urbe Cuencana,  tiene 34 años de edad y se encuentra casada además tiene  tres hijos que se encuentran de 14, 8, 6 años, su  esposo es empleado privado trabaja en la fábrica de Cerámicas Graiman, no poseen casa propia por lo que viven en  casa de su mamá pero de manera independiente.

 Luz nos  comenta que los créditos recibidos le han permitido ponerse al día en sus deudas  e invertir en su negocio de venta frutas y granos en el que lleva  21 años en su local ubicado en el mercado atendiendo de lunes a domingo de 7am a 6pm. Con el dinero que reciba de la institución va a comprar papayas, piñas, naranjas, arvejas, maíz, etc.  para abastecer su negocio.

Su mayor sueño es acabar le pagar sus deudas.
texts.en:
As of April 12th, the community bank has 15 active members. The members are women entrepreneurs who seek to have, and be able to offer a better quality of life for their families. All members of the community bank have businesses selling food or selling fruit and vegetables. This bank is located in the city of Cuenca, the third largest city in Ecuador. Cuenca is renowned for its writers and artists, architectural beauty, the 4 rivers that bathe the city, its delicious cuisine, and by the warmth of the people, who are always friendly and welcoming to local and foreign tourists. Luz R. is one of the active members of this bank, and is in her fifth term working with the Foundation. She lives in the city Cuencana and is a 34 year old wife and mother. She has children who are 14, 8, and 6 years of age. Her husband is a private employee of the Graiman pottery factory. They do not own their own home, since they live in her mother's home, but manage all their expenses independently. Luz tells us that the loans, which she has received thus far, have allowed her to catch up with her debts and invest in her own business selling fruits and grains. This is a business she has had for 21 years. Currently, Luz works Monday to Sunday (from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m.) in a market. With the funds she receives from this loan, she plans to purchase papayas, pineapples, oranges, peas, corn, etc. and will supply her business. Her biggest dream is to finish paying off her debts.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar papayas, piñas, naranjas, arvejas, maíz, etc. (To purchase papayas, pineapples, oranges, peas, corn, etc.)

loans.name: Gisèle

texts.fr: A. Gisèle est née en 1971 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Il y a un an que Gisèle s’est installée avec son mari, DAH Epiphane, et ses trois enfants au quartier Yagbé à Cotonou.  Gisèle n’a fait que l’école primaire, mais tous les enfants sont scolarisés.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Il y a huit ans, Gisèle s’est mise dans la vente de pâtes dentifrices de façon ambulante.  Gisèle est à son troisième crédit à ALIDé.  Gisèle a bien remboursé les deux premiers crédits qu’elle a obtenus de ALIDé.  Gisèle voudrait renforcer le stock de ses produits.  Mais compte tenu du peu de moyens financiers dont elle dispose, Gisèle sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Gisèle A. was born in 1971 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. One year ago, she moved in with her husband, Epiphane Dah, and his three children in the Yagbé district of Cotonou. Gisèle only attended primary school, but all of the children attend school. The couple shares the family responsibilities. Eight years ago, Gisèle began selling toothpaste as an itinerant vendor. Gisèle is on her third loan with ALIDé. She fully repaid the first two loans that she took out through ALIDé. Gisèle would like to build up her product inventory. Because of her very limited financial means, Gisèle is requesting a third loan through ALIDé.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase toothpaste

loans.name: Ngoem

texts.en: Mrs. Ngoem S. is 61 years old and a villager who lives in Angk Prasat village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Moeun Nao, are farmers who own a 1-hectare field to cultivate rice. Although they try to work hard with their farming, they still earn little income to support their family's living. Thus, Mrs. Ngoem S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. Mrs. Ngoem S. hopes that this loan will increase her income and improve her family's conditions. This couple has a child who is a painting student. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Sambo

texts.en:
Many Cambodian people earn a living by working in the garment industry. One of these citizens, Mrs. R., 29, works by sewing clothes in the garment industry, earning a suitable salary. She was married several years ago but she doesn’t have any children. Besides her current job, Mrs. R. also helps her husband to produce cement jars when she is not at work.

Her husband is a significant financial earner for the family, manufacturing jars and selling them to the middlemen who take the jars to retail. Recently, he has used up his stock of raw material. Mrs. R. is taking out a Kiva loan for her husband so he can resupply his stock by purchasing more cement for making jars.

loans.use: To purchase more cement for making jars

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
el sr. Luis Antonio Garcia tiene 41 años de edad, vive en la aldea San Geronimo, Namasigue departamento de Choluteca. Luis se dedica al comercio tiene un negocio de ventas varias como ser relojes de mano y de pared, calculadoras, pastas dentales, cepillos, focos de mano, baterias, termos, llaveros, peliculas en dvd, fajas, naipes, corta uñas, billeteras y otras cosas mas. todos los dias se levanta muy temprano para arreglar todos sus productos y salir a venderlos, su negocio esta ubicado en una calle muy transitada y esto hace que las ventas sean buenas.
Luis utilizara el credito para comprar mas mercaderia, las ganancias que obtenga de las ventas son para cubrir con los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Luis Antonio is 41 years old and lives in the village of San Gerónimo Namisigue, in the department of Choluteca. Luis is a merchant who sells various items, including wrist watches, wall clocks, calculators, tooth paste, tooth brushes, flashlights, batteries, thermoses, locks, DVD film, band aids, playing cards, nail cutters, wallets, and other things. Every day, he rises very early to arrange all his products and venture out to sell them. His business is located on a heavily traveled street and this helps to give him good sales. Luis will use the loan to buy more merchandise. The earnings he obtains from his sales are used to cover household costs.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING WATCHES, FILM, ADORNMENTS, CALCULATORS, NAIL CUTTERS, CARDS, FLASHLIGHTS, TOOTH PASTE & BRUSHES TO SELL

loans.name: Karla Maria

texts.es: La Sra. P. R. Karla, vive en Santa Dominguita, perteneciente al distrito de Santiago. Tiene un hijo, su esposo es cobrador del agua de la zona de Santa Dominguita. La Sra. Karla Trabaja como obrera de campo en las parcelas de la zona de santiago. Cuenta con casa propia a la cual le esta realizando acabados. Solicita el financiamiento para realizar acabados a su vivienda a fin de cumplir su sueño de brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. La Sra.  P. R. Karla, agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Karla lives in Santa Dominguito, which belongs to the Santiago district. She has one child, and her husband collects water fees in the Santa Dominguita area. Karla is a field worker on the plots of land in the Santiago area. She has her own house, and she is working on finishing it. She is requesting the loan to finish her house. This will fulfill her dream of giving her family a better quality of life. Karla is grateful for the support that we are able to give her through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve her house

loans.name: Angel Francisco

texts.es: Ángel Francisco tiene 52 años, con 2 hijos a su cargo. su actividad económica de Ángel es la venta de de mercadería en general hace mas de  28 años que se dedica a esta actividad, pues siempre le ha gustado ser una persona muy responsable y disfruta el conversar con sus clientes. Por lo que no ha sido fácil ya que tiene mucha competencia pero ninguno ofrece el carisma y simpatía de Ángel. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento así podrá mantener a sus clientes y comprara una amplia variedad de productos. El sueña con mejorar cada día su actividad.
texts.en:
Ángel Francisco is 52 years old and has two dependent children. For more than 28 years he has had a business selling general merchandise. He has always liked his worked, as he is very responsible and enjoys talking with his customers. Although none of his competitors has Ángel's charisma and charm, he faces a lot of competition for business. He is therefore requesting a loan to serve his customers better by offering a wider variety of products. His dream is to improve his business every day.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya H. is from the village of Brgy. 23, Gingoog City. She is 46 years old. Ligaya is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Ligaya owns and operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling coconut, dried fish, and variety of processed food in the local community. Ligaya has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ligaya joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ligaya has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Ligaya is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Ligaya from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Néstor Fabián

texts.es:
Néstor Fabián P. A. tiene 23 años de edad. Vive con su esposa e hija de 2 meses, Neyda, en el cantón de San Miguel, en la provincia de Bolívar.

Néstor es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Santiagopamba, que se encuentra en San Pablo, a media hora del pueblo de San Miguel. La ventanilla esta compuesta por personas que en su mayoría se dedica a la agricultura, como fuente de ingresos de su familia.

Néstor estudia y trabaja en la agricultura. Realiza las compras de sus productos en San Pablo y las ventas a los comerciantes en el terreno. 

Solicita el préstamo para comprar abonos para sus sembrios. Piensa que el crédito le ayudará para poder sacar mejores productos al mercado. Su sueño seria mejorar su situación económica para vivir bien con su familia. 

Enfrenta desafíos como enfermedades que atacan a los cultivos. 

Le gusta hacer deportes en su tiempo libre como jugar voleibol, y las fiestas tradicionales como carnaval, donde se reunía todo la familia.
texts.en:
Néstor Fabián P. A. is 23 years of age. He lives with his wife and daughter of 2 months, Neyda, in the village of San Miguel, in the province of Bolívar. Néstor is a member of the Santiagopamba rural assocation, which is located in San Pablo, half an hour from the town of San Miguel. The group is composed of people that are mostly dedicated to agriculture as the source of income for their family. Néstor attends school and works in agriculture. He purchases his products in San Pablo and sells them to the merchants in the surrounding area. He requests a loan to buy fertilizer for his crops. He thinks that the credit will help to be able to bring better products to the market. He would like to improve his economic situation and to live well with his family. He faces challenges such as diseases that attack his crops. He likes to play sports in his free time, such as volleyball, and attend the traditional festivals like carnival, where the whole family meets.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy pants, T-shirts, underwear, skirts and shirts and plantains, flour, oil, eggs and other supplies for a fried food stand

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina E. is from the town of Talibon. She is 43 years old and married. She has a 22-year-old child who is still in college. She hopes for her child to graduate soon. To make a living, Merlina prepares and sells cooked food for daily meals. 

In 2009, Merlina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Merlina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. This will be her 3rd loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells

loans.name: Rom

texts.en:
Mr. K. is a 30-year-old married man and a local villager. He lives in a medium-sized home with his family members in the capital, Phnom Penh. He owns a piece of farmland that he inherited many years ago from his grandparents. He uses this land to grow different kinds of crops. Additionally, K. also takes time to operate a motor-taxi service for extra income. Another source of family income is from his wife’s job; she sews clothes.

Recently, K.’s taxi has been breaking down, which has negatively affected his income. Thus, K. is seeking a loan to replace his old taxi. K. will invest any remaining cash from the loan in his farm.

Mr. K. was busy working when the photo taken, so his wife is pictured instead.

loans.use: To replace an old taxi.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: Andrea tiene 44 años de edad, vive junto a su pareja Wilder de 37 años y sus tres pequeños hijos, en su casa que es propia y que gracias a mucho esfuerzo lograron adquirir. Hace más de 3 años se dedica en la venta de cereales, producto que lo adquiere en provincia, posteriormente son ofrecidos a sus amistades que viven dentro de su zona. De esta manera Andrea se desenvuelve y se dedica en dar información de los beneficios que le genera estos productos nutritivos. Gracias al gran carisma de Andrea los clientes siempre prefieren comprarle, pues sabe que es muy honesta y trabajadora. En un futuro desea tener un gran puesto donde ofrecer su mercadería y así llevar mejores ingresos a su hogar. Es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de cereales para así aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Andrea is 44 years old and lives with her partner Wilder, age 37, and their three small children. She has her own house that she bought after much effort. For more than three years, she has been acquiring grain throughout the province and then selling it to friends who live in her area. By working in this manner, Andrea is able to pass along information regarding the nutritional benefits of these products to her customers. Thanks to her charisma, Andrea has customers who always prefer to buy from her and they know that she is honest and extremely hardworking. In the future, she wants to have a large vending post where she can offer her merchandise and generate more household income.

This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to complete all of her payments on time. With the loan she requested, Andrea will buy a larger quantity of grain so that she can increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more grain to complete her orders

loans.name: Angela Margarita

texts.es:
En la Ciudadela Comercio de la Ciudad de Portoviejo, se reúnen cada 15 días las socias del  Banco Comunal Mujeres Solidarias Exitosas.

La señora Ángela nos cuenta que está en el Banco desde sus inicios, está casada y tiene seis hijos, viven hace 10 años en una finca que es de un señor que vive en EEUU y que la dejo a su cuidado, allí ellos crían  ganado vacuno.

Se dedican a la venta de leche, queso manaba (producto típico de la región) ella elabora el queso por las tardes para que al otro día su marido lo entregue a sus clientes junto con la leche que llevan a vender, también a la compra y venta de ganado.

Ella trabaja dos horas al día en la preparación del queso y el las mañanas en repartir los productos, el resto del tiempo lo dedican al cuidado de la finca y a criar sus animalitos.

El dinero que van a recibir lo van a utilizar para comprar dos vacas para aumentar su producción.

Sus sueños son tener su casa propia para bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
In the shopping district of the city of Portoviejo, the members of Community Bank Mujeres Solidarias Exitosas (Successful Women United) get together every 15 days. Ángela relates that she has been involved with the Bank since its founding. She is married with six children and for 10 years has lived on a farm owned by a man residing in the United States. Ángela looks after the farm in the man’s absence and raises dairy cows. The farm sells milk and Manaba cheese (typical from the region). Ángela makes the cheese in the afternoons so that her husband can deliver and sell the cheese and milk to his clients the following day. They also buy and sell cattle. Ángela works for two hours per day making cheese and in the mornings she delivers the products. The rest of the time is spent taking care of the farm and raising the livestock. The loan will be used to purchase two cows in order to increase production. Ángela’s dream is to own her own house for the benefit of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cows.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline W. is 35 years old. She is single and has one child, aged eight years old. Her business is located in Juja, in a residential area in Thika. Thika is the region in Kenya known for the production of pineapples. Pauline sells assorted items which include sweets, paraffin, charcoal and others. She has been in this business for the last 15 years. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is that there are many people in the area with the same kind of business as hers; hence, customers are spoilt by the choice. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more paraffin and charcoal to expand her business. In the future, she hopes to buy a pick-up for car rental. She is a very hardworking and humble lady.

loans.use: To buy paraffin and charcoal

loans.name: Amos Kioi

texts.en:
Amos Kioi N. is a 34-year-old single man, who has been in the business of operating general stores from which he distributes a variety of shop items to small scale retailers at a wholesale price. His general store (warehouse) is based at Kangemi, just few kilometers from Nairobi City center. Most of his customers own retail shops in the Kangemi shopping center. He has been in this business for twelve years with a very good and stable income. The other source of income for the family is building and construction.  

N. was introduced to KADET LTD by a Credit Officer and he has no history with any other MFI. He is applying for his first loan of 20,000 KES with KADET LTD and he intends to add more stock of goods to the general stores, so that he will have enough items to supply to his clients. He plans to use the profit gained to establish stable general stores.

He is very ambitious to own a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: Add more stock of goods to the general stores

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita B. is from the village of Divisoria Santiago. She is 46 years old. Teresita is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling scrap metal & other used products in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jogoo Group

texts.en:
Victoria K. (pictured, in the middle row on the left, with the brown shirt) is in her early thirties and is married with two children. To earn a living and to support her family, Victoria runs a small restuarant, where she sells ready-made food for lunch and dinner. Victoria has been running this business for the past three years. Her business is open daily between 5 am and 4 pm and earns her modest monthly profit.

This is the first loan Victoria has sought with Tujijenge Tanzania. Victoria would like to use the loan proceeds to buy a cooler box. The cooler would allow her to begin selling cold soft drinks along with the food, which she is sure will improve the reputation and profitability of her business. Victoria's dream is to keep expanding the business so that she can open a larger restaurant.

Victoria will share this loan with her loan group, Tujijenge Tanzania, which includes 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying their respective portions of the loan.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing a cooler

loans.name: Burulcha's Group

texts.en:
One might think that a country that exports food supplies in large quantities has plenty of products for local consumers. That is not true for Kyrgyzstan. The most necessary food supplies like meat, fruits, and milk products are a luxury for a typical rural family. The government regulations fail to efficiently allocate locally-made products, while most of it goes for cheap export. Local citizens purchase goods at quite a high price.

Burulcha N., 53, is a leader of this group. She is a junior nurse in a sanitary-epidemic hospital in the small town of Toktogul. She is a widow and has four grown children. She worked hard her entire career in a hospital but still could not provide a good life with the salary of a social worker. She did a tremendous job in satisfying all the needs of her children, and now it is her children’s turn to bring some fresh air into their mother’s life. 

Burulcha’s youngest son spent his salary to purchase cattle. Together, they managed to gradually increase the number of cattle. The biggest challenge for this family is to find capital for conducting business, because the input prices rise every year and sometimes it gets hard to cover production costs. Burulcha has organized a group of people, each of whom has unique financial hardships. Burulcha is asking for a loan of 10,000 soms so that she can buy additional cattle and make general repairs on her house. 

 --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Martha Verónica

texts.es:
La Señora Martha S. es socia del banco comunal Corazón de María y vive en la comunidad de San Juan Loma que  pertenece a la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia se encuentra al suroeste de la ciudad de Cuenca, siendo de clima frió, tiene como atractivos turísticos la laguna de Cochapamba la que se encuentra llena de Totora, la colina de Tasqui la que tiene una hermosa vista de la ciudad de Cuenca y de la parroquia. Su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales.

La Señora. Martha se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa pero solo los fines de semana, esta actividad la desempeña hace 4 años, el resto de su tiempo se dedica a trabajar desde su casa en el arreglo de toda prenda de vestir, actividad que aprendió sola.

Doña Martha tiene 29 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos de 11, 9 y 6 años de edad,  todos estudian en la escuela. Su esposo labora como carpintero, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de sus suegros compartiendo gastos.
 
Es nuestra socia hace 3 años y se siente muy bien de pertenecer al banco comunal ya que cuenta con muy buenas amigas. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más ropa para surtir su negocio para la temporada navideña. Su meta es  tener un  local propio.
texts.en:
Martha S. is a member of the 'Corazón de María' (Heart of Mary) community bank.  She lives in San Juan Loma community, in El Valle parish.  This parish is in the south-west of the city of Cuenca.  It is an area with a cold climate which has as its tourist attractions the Cochapamba lagoon which is filled with bulrushes and Tasqui Hill which has a beautiful view of the city of Cuenca and its parish.  The people here work in farming and raising livestock.

Martha sells all kinds of clothes but only on weekends.  She has been in this business for 4 years.  The rest of the time she works from home mending garments, an activity which she taught herself.

Martha is 29 years old.  She lives with her common-law husband and three children aged 11, 9 and 6.  All her children are in school.  Her husband works as a carpenter.  They don't have their own home but live in her in-laws' house, sharing expenses.

Martha has been a member of her community bank for 3 years and she feels very happy to belong to her bank as she has some very good friends there.  She will invest her loan in buying more clothes to stock her business for the Christmas period.  Her goal is to have her own premises.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmer es un padre de familia de 23 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a su menor hijo en el caserío Hornitos del distrito de Mórrope, una localidad agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en la crianza y venta de animales desde hace más de tres años. El cría ovejas en su domicilio alimentándolas de pastos naturales, cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. La actividad es una de sus principales fuentes de ingreso, por lo que siempre trata de mantener su negocio del mejor modo posible.

El desea adquirir más animales y alimentos, asimismo desea realizar algunas mejoras en sus corrales, todo ello con la finalidad de mejorar su negocio y percibir mayores ganancias al momento de realizar sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Wilmer, 23, is a father living with his wife and minor son in Hornitos, Mórrope district, a farming area located in Lambayeque province over an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

He has been raising animals to sell for the last three years.  He raises sheep at home feeding them natural grasses.  When they reach a good level of development he sells them to merchants that tend to visit the area where he lives.  This activity is one of his main sources of income so he always strives to run the business the best way possible.

He wants to acquire more animals and animal feed.  He also wants to make some improvements to the corrals to improve his business and earn better profits when he makes his sales.

He has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan.

loans.use: To buy animals and animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 38-year-old married man. He is from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and three children. He has been working as an experienced taxi driver since 2001. He offers his private transportation services to students and employees.  He obtained his first Kiva loan, and he was an excellent client with payments on the dot. He represents the only financial support to his family.

 Today, he is requesting to borrow a bigger amount of $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to change his car’s engine and complete the needed amends so he can grant his clients an enhanced and more comfortable service.

loans.use: to change his car’s engine and complete the needed amends

loans.name: Margarita Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
En el sector conocido como el Cadí de  la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Juntas Creceremos, este lugar es muy hermoso y las personas muy agradables.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora, Margarita ella tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 5 hijos, tres de ellos mayores de edad y de 16 y 15  los mismos que estudian en colegio, todos sus hijos aun están en su casa. Su esposo es comerciante de electrodomésticos.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo  por catalogo, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local, nos cuenta que  le realizan pedidos sus clientes. Trabaja cinco días en la semana, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la compra en Portoviejo cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Nos cuenta que lleva en este negocio 8 años y que ha tenido temporadas buenas y malas pero siempre ha salido adelante.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa camisas,  pantalones, blusas, ropa de niños, entre otras prendas. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución. Sus sueños son tener su local.
texts.en:
In the Cadí section of the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the Juntas Creceremos (Together We Will Grow) communal bank meet every two weeks.  This is a very beautiful place and the people are very likeable.

We met Margarita, 46, here.  She is married and has five children.  Three of them are adults and the other two are 16 and 15 years of age and in school.  All the children still live at home.  Her husband is a home appliance salesman.

She sells all kinds of clothing via catalogue sales.  She sells door to door and also from her house where she has a small store.  She tells us that her customers place orders with her.  She works five days a week and grants her customers credit; she collects payment every two weeks.  She buys her merchandise in Portoviejo every two weeks or once a month depending on her needs.  She tells us that she’s been in this business for 8 years and has had both good and bad seasons but she has always gotten ahead.
