Ruby T. R. is from the city of Pulot, Ozamiz City. She is 34 years old. Ruby is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Ruby owns & operates a business operating a motor transport service. Ruby has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ruby joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruby has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Ruby is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Ruby from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del NorT. and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*NoT.: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a templaT. to automaT. the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this templaT. for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accuraT. information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Rosa Jakeline

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 19 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un pequeño hijo de año y medio de edad, vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la ciudad de Chepén, capital de la provincia del mismo nombre, perteneciente a la región La Libertad, ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

La necesidad de apoyar al sostenimiento de su familia hizo que iniciara un negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes instalado en su vivienda, ella trata de ofrecer a sus clientes productos de calidad y un buen trato, en el tiempo que lleva trabajando el negocio ha crecido y goza de buena acogida en el sector donde vive, sobretodo porque pone al alcance de la mano de sus clientes productos de consumo diario por los cuales tendrían que movilizarse hasta el mercado de la ciudad para adquirirlos.

Ella desea ampliar su negocio para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, por eso se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de más productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes.

Rosa es una mujer bastante conocida y estimada en la zona donde vive, sus vecinos y conocidos la consideran una mujer responsable y entregada a su familia; su mayor anhelo es entregarle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida. En la imagen aparece junto a su menor hijo.
texts.en:
Rosa, 19, is a single mother; she has an 18-month-old son. She lives with her parents in the city of Chepén, capital of Chepén province, La Libertad region, located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region capital. In order to support her family, she opened a general store in her dwelling; she tries to offer quality items and kind customer service. During the time she’s been in business, business has grown and she is well-received in her neighborhood, above all because she makes accessible to her customers everything they need on a daily basis thereby ridding them of the need to travel to the city to market. She wants to expand her business to better meet customer demand so she is asking Edpyme Alternativa, for the first time, for funding. She is asking for 1000 new soles to buy stock merchandise for her store. Rosa is quite well-known and well-liked where she lives; her neighbors and acquaintances consider her to be responsible and dedicated to her family. Her greatest wish is to provide her son with a better quality of life. She appears in the photo with her young son.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Mrs. Channy Chea Village Bank Group

texts.en: In Samar village in Kandal province is a village bank loan group which consists of eighteen people. All the members will use a loan for different purposes that will support their businesses. Mrs. Channy C. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. She is a farmer who owns a veR. small piece of land to grow rice to support her family's living situation. Her husband, Mr. Vanna Khoem, is a seamstress in garment factoR. who receives a low salaR.. In the rice field she has a problem: her field is reaD. to farm, but she does not have enough money to plant. Thus, Mrs. Channy C. decided to apply for a loan to hire a plow machine to plow her rice field. She is the mother of a two-month-old child.

loans.use: To hire a plow machine to plow her rice field.

loans.name: Juanita's Group

texts.en:
Juanita D. is from the village of Brgy.Aurora, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 38 years old. Juanita is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Juanita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Juanita owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Juanita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Juanita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juanita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Juanita is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the second loan taken out by Juanita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Saroem

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroem M. is 59 years old and lives in Trapeang Prei village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She is also grocery seller who owns a small store to support her business. 

Since her grocery business is going well, Mrs. Saroem M. wants to expand it. Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase more groceries to enlarge her business activities. 

Her husband, Mr. Nat Eam, practices traditional medicine to add a little income to his wife's to support the family. This couple has four children: two are car mechanics; one is staying at home; and the last one is attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin, de 33 años, convive con su pareja Rosa (24), con quien tiene una pequeña hija. Juntos  viven en una casa alquilada. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, y  ahora con mayor razón pues, su motivación diaria es la nueva familia que está conformando. Cada día sale a las 5 de la mañana a trabajar en una tienda comercial, donde vende  productos comestibles, en asociación con su tío. A diario le pagan de 20 a 22 soles, también por trasladar la mercadería, desde la ciudad hasta otra localidad, donde está ubicada la bodega. Además atiende a los clientes y eso es lo que más le gusta, porque considera que tiene un trato especial, ya lleva trabajando 3 años en este negocio, mientras su pareja labora preparado comida, junto a su madre. Esta joven pareja tiene planeado, para más adelante, empezar con su propio centro comercial, y empezaran  por instalar una tienda, ya  que esta actividad es muy rentable, si se sabe administrar bien el dinero.Es  la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y quiere pagar puntualmente cada una de sus cuotas porque, refiere que está haciéndose conocido por tener un buen historial crediticio y eso le importa mucho, al igual que al resto de integrantes de su banco comunal, con quienes les gusta trabajar.Edwin tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado, en la compra de  insumos necesarios para que su esposa continúe preparando comida, y así  generarse más ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Edwin, 33 years old, lives with his partner Rosa (24), with whom he has a small daughter. They live in a rented house. He is known as a hard working man, now with more reason, as he is motivated daily by his new family. He leaves every day at 5 in the morning to work in a commercial store where he sells food products with his uncle. Additionally he makes 20 to 25 soles daily, transporting the merchandise from the city to another locality where the general store is located. He also takes care of the customers, which is what he likes the best, he believes that he has a good sales manner after being in this business for 3 years. His spouse works at preparing food with her mother. This young couple has plans in the future of having their own business by opening a store, since this activity is profitable if one know how to manage the money. This is the third loan with MFP and he wants to be punctual with his payments because he is getting to be known as having a good credit history, which is important to him as well as to the other members of the community bank, with whom he likes to work. Edwin plans to invest the proceeds in the purchase the necessary products needed for his wife to continue preparing meals, this way generating more income.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy pants, blouses, shirts, underwear, and shoes, etc.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim K., 30, is married and resides with his wife and a child in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known as the most populated city in the country. He sells groceries, gasoline, and gas, and provides money exchange for an income of USD 3 per day. His wife is a garment factory worker, earning an income of USD 2 per day. K. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane R. is from the village of Bagong Silang, Iligan City. She is 50 years old. Jane is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Jane owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income from the business comes from buying and selling used clothing and ready-to-wear clothes to the local community. Jane has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Jane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Jane is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to build her working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Jane from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to build working capital

location.town: Bagong Silang, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca tiene 40 años de edad, madre soltera y vive en compañía de su dos hijos en su casa que es propia, que gracias a mucho esfuerzo logró adquirir. El trabajo al que se dedica es la fabricación y venta de zapatos en un taller que tiene en su domicilio, trabajo por el cual lo hace por medio de pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, quienes se dedican a vender calzados. Lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que este trabajo es muy rentable para solventar los gastos de su familia. En un futuro desea continuar trabajando muy duro para hacer crecer su taller y contratar más personas y así aumentar su producción. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete en ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, desea comprar mayor cantidad de materiales como cuero, pegamento para continuar con la fabricación de calzado.
texts.en:
Francisca is a 40 year old single mother. She lives with her two children in her own house, which she managed to get thanks to a great deal of effort. She makes and sells shoes in a shop she has in her house. She works by orders that her customers, who sell shoes, make. She has been doing this for three years. She considers her work to be very beneficial in paying the family expenses. In the future she wants to continue working very hard in order to make her shop grow. She also wants to hire more people to increase her production. This is her first loan with MFP, and she pledges to be very punctual with all of her payments. She wants to use the loan to buy a greater quantity of materials like leather and glue to continue making footwear.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials like leather and glue

loans.name: Brenda José

texts.es: La Sra. Brenda C. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, actualmente se desempeña como secretaria en el colegio Simeón Pereira de dicho municipio el cual es un centro de estudios de primaria donde tiene 10 años de laborar. Tiene tres años de trabajar con ceprodel donde se le han otorgado tres créditos para gastos personales. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de medicamentos para la buena salud de su mamá.
texts.en:
Mrs. Brenda C. is from the city of El Sauce. She is currently employed as a Secretary at Simeón Pereira public school. It is a primary school and she’s worked there for 10 years. She has collaborated with Ceprodel for three years and has had three loans for personal expenses. The requested loan is to buy medicines for her mother.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For medical expenses.

loans.name: Djantoyerela Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djantoyerela, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 51 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Djinina, sous préfecture de Fana, région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage et font le commerce du charbon de bois d’habillements etc.                                                                                              
Ces femmes du groupe Djantoyerela sont à leur treizième prêt solidaire et tous les douze prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.                                                             
KADIA  T., la présidente du groupe Djantoyerela compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des sacs de charbon de bois
Elle s’approvisionne auprès des charbonniers du village et environnants et effectue sa vente au village et au bord du goudron et au marché de Fana, au comptant, en gros et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 75.000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the group named Djantoyerela are all married and on average they are 51 years old and have three children. They all lives in large traditional families in the village of Djinina in the Fana and Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are known through their families and through neighbours. They sell wood coal, clothing etc. The women of the Djantoyerela group are on their thirteenth loan cycle, having successfully repaid the twelve previous loans. Kadia T. is the leader of the Djantoyerela group. She will use her loan to purchase sacks of wood coal. She purchases the product from coal producers in the village and the surrounding regions and she resells in the village and along the tar pit and in the market in Fana. She completes her sales in cash, in wholesale, and in credit, to a clientele make up of men and women. She foresees a monthly income of 75 FCFA which will be used to cover the family's daily expenses and the rest will be reinvested back in the business.

Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood coal.

loans.name: Nurulo

texts.en:
T. Nurulo is a hard-working, 50-year-old man who has considerably improved his economic situation due to growing potatoes, onions and other vegetables. He feels happy to have the privilege of being a father to eight children. 

Nurulo grows a variety of different native vegetables and sells them at the market. He is saving money in order to become a taxi driver in the future, when his efforts in the field no longer are fruitful. In order to have a successful harvest, Nurulo is asking for a loan of $1,500 USD to buy sacks of seeds and organic fertilizer for his crop. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients can run successful businesses. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie O. is from the village of Mahayahay, Iligan City. She is 34 years old. Melanie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Melanie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, junk foods and other types of snack products in the local community. Melanie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Melanie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melanie is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Melanie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Mahayahay, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Alinhinkira Women's Association-Jinja Group

texts.en:
N. Joy is affliated to Alinhinkira Group-Jinja. She is happily married with nine children. The trade of welding has mostly been a male preserve, but it is fascinating that in today’s Uganda you will find women who are eager to turn a hand to even the hardest of jobs, which often involve a lot of elbow grease. Joy has been involved in this trade for ten years now. Her operating headquarters are in Ivunamb trading center-Jinja.
The need for self reliance, she says, is what got her started in this business. Her story of transformation from a housewife into a fully fledged businesswoman is something in which she takes pride. She says young underprivileged girls can look up to her and emulate her. Her weekly income is 70,000 UGX. Joy also runs a charcoal sales business. With this loan, she wants to purchase metal materials for welding doors, windows and chairs.

loans.use: To purchase metal material for welding doors, windows and chairs

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina T. is 46 years old, single and has one grown son. She lives in Sokuluk village in the northern part of Kyrgyzstan. Irina began her business in cattle breeding in 2005 in order to find an additional means of subsistence. With her initial capital of 6,000 KGS, Irina bought a bull. Today, she manages to earn about 5,000 KGS per month by selling meat products.
Irina is applying for a loan of 80,000 KGS to purchase bull calves for fattening and resale. In the future, she plans to broaden her business by purchasing more cattle.

About Bai-Tushum and Partners
Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 45 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a sus cuatro hijos en una zona rural de la localidad de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola que se encuentra situado en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

El cuenta con ovejas y aves de corral, los cuales cría en algunos ambientes dentro de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Adicionalmente cuenta con un terreno de cultivo producto de una herencia en donde suele sembrar mango y limón. Su esposa se dedica a trabajar preparando y vendiendo comida. Con los ingresos que ambos perciben de estas actividades se encargan de sacar adelante a su familia.

Juan desea ampliar su negocio comprando más animales y alimento balanceado de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas durante esta temporada navideña, que es cuando la demanda por sus animales aumenta, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Juan is 45 years old, is married and lives with his wife and their four children in a rural area of Tambogrande, a farming district in the Piura region, which is located more than four hours from Chiclayo, the capital city of the Lambayeque region.

He has sheep and poultry which he raises in enclosures at home.  When the animals have reached a good size, he offers them for sale to the general public and to businessmen who visit the area regularly.  Juan also has a field which he inherited and where he grows mangoes and lemons.  His wife works preparing and selling food.  With their combined income, they try to make ends meet for their family.

Juan wants to expand his business by buying more animals and balanced feed so he can increase his sales during this Christmas season, which is when demand for his animals increases.  For this reason he thought it was a good idea to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 new soles.

loans.use: Purchase animals to expand business growing and selling animals

loans.name: Susana Del Socorro

texts.es:
Susana de 41 años, tiene 4 hijos, una mayor de edad, y 3 que tiene a cargo, la mayor trabaja como docente, dos estudian en la Universidad, el otro hijo de 14 estudia en la Secundaria, ella trabaja como docente de educación secundaria desde hace 23 años, es importante mencionar que Susana con los creditos anteriores otorgados por AFODENIC ha mejorado su vivienda y sus condiciones de vida, a la vez agradece a Kiva por el financiemiento anterior ya que con este pudo realizar los servicios higienico e ir mejorando su vivienda.

Ahora solicita su credito para continuar sus mejoras en su Vivienda y de esta manera poder realizar una habitacion para el hijo mayor y brindarles mejor comodidad y privacidad. 

Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos gocen de buena salud, de estabilidad laboral y que lleguen a disfrutar de una casa bonita y comoda y sobre todo estar bien con Dios.
texts.en:
Susana is 41 years old and has four children.  Her eldest daughter is grown up and her other three children are still in her care.  Her eldest works as a teacher, two are studying at university and her youngest son, who is 14, is in high school.  Susana has been working as a high school teacher for 23 years.  We should mention that, with previous loans from AFODENIC, Susana has improved her home and her living conditions.  She is grateful to Kiva for her last loan because she was able to use it to do some work on her bathroom and further improve her home.

Susana is now requesting a new loan so that she can continue improving her home and build a room for her eldest son to provide him with more comfort and better privacy.  Susana's greatest dream is for her children to enjoy good health and stable jobs, for them to enjoy a nice, comfortable home and, above all, for all to be well with God.

loans.use: To build a room

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a 21-year-old single woman living with her parents in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her desire is to be economically independent from her family. Jackline has a retail shop and has been in business for two years now, first as an employee and now as the shop owner. Jackline is requesting a loan to buy salt, sugar, and soap.

loans.use: to purchase salt, sugar, and soap

loans.name: Deysi Diana

texts.es:
Deysi de  28 años, es una joven trabajadora que comenzó hace 3 años atrás con su pequeña tienda  con un capital de $ 300.00. Poco a poco y con ayuda de su esposo ha incrementado la mercadería que vende en la tienda ya que está ubicada en la parte delantera de su casa.

Viviendo en una zona muy turística llamada Playas (conocida porque tiene uno de los mejores climas en todo el mundo) continúa trabajando para darles una buena vida a sus tres hijos que están estudiando. En su tienda tiene a la venta arroz, bebidas, enlatados, azúcar entre otros. Trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso que por ahora quiere el préstamo para comprar arroz, enlatados y otros víveres de primera necesidad. En el futuro quiere tener nuevas instalaciones en su tienda para su mejora de ingresos.
texts.en:
Deysi is 28 years old. She is a hard working young woman who opened her small store 3 years ago with $300 of capital. Little by little, and with her husband's help, she has increased the merchandise she sells in her store, which is located in the front of her house.  

Living in a very touristy area called Playas (known for having one of the best climates in the world), she continues to work to give a good life to her children, who are in school. In her store, she sells rice, beverages, canned goods, sugar, and more. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. every day.  

She aspires to a lot of things for her business. That is why she wants the loan to buy rice, canned goods and other basic necessity products. In the future, she wants to have new facilities in her store to improve her income.

loans.use: Rice, sugar

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es:
Verónica tiene 32 años de edad, es casada, y tiene cuatro hijos, vive junto a su esposo en el del distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito de la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, caracterizado por que sus pobladores se dedican principalmente al cultivo de frutas.

Verónica se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, ella cuenta con un grupo de clientes que le compran sus productos con frecuencia, mientras más pedidos le realizan obtiene mas puntos de parte de la empresa que le provee los productos y por consiguiente obtiene mayores ganancias. Por este motivo siempre se esfuerza por obtener cada vez más clientes.

Verónica desea implementar su stock de productos de belleza para poder satisfacer la demanda con la que actualmente cuenta, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Verónica is 32 years old, she is married and has four children. She lives with her husband in Tambogrande, a district of the Piura province, located in the region by the same name whose main characteristic is the fact that its inhabitants mainly engage in growing fruits.

Verónica engages in selling beauty products by catalogue. She can count on a group of customers who frequently buy her products: the more requests she satisfies the more points she gains form the company that supplies her with the products, consequently earning more. This is why she constantly works hard to win more customers.

Verónica wishes to increase her stock of beauty products in order to satisfy the requests she is currently receiving, and for this reason she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 PEN.

loans.use: To increase her stock of beauty products.

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en:
Faustin is 50 years old and is married.  He has ten children aged between 1 and 25 years old.  He takes care of two children aged between 2.5 and 6 years old.  

Faustin has a cow trading business. He has been in this business for about four years.   His working hours are from 7am until 5pm every day. His business is well-organized and he employs two people to help him.

Faustin has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding his business through adding more cows to sell.

With this loan, Faustin has a vision of growing his business to the extent where he can even start wholesaling.  If he starts wholesaling, he hopes to earn more profits than before,  which in turn will be used for further reinvestment in his business. He will then also be able to renovate his house.

loans.use: To expand his farm

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.es:
El grupo Génesis está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedora una de ellas es la señora Sandra Carolina R. quien tiene una serigrafía y vende cosméticos. Ella inicio con la serigrafía de calzado desde hace 15 años junto con su esposo y a sus tres hijos les han enseñado el oficio de decorar zapatos.
Ella invertirá el crédito en pinturas y otros materiales para la serigrafía.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Elisabeth Cruz quien vende plata y cosméticos y Juana Cristina M. vende verduras en el oriental.
texts.en:
The “Génesis” group has three hard working, enterprising members.  One of them is Mrs. Sandra Carolina R. who has a silk-screening printing shop and also sells cosmetics.  She started out silk screening footwear 15 years ago with her husband and they have taught their three children the shoe decorating occupation.  She will use the loan for paints and other silk screening supplies.

The other group members are Elisabeth Cruz who sells silver and cosmetics and Juana Cristina M. who is a vegetable merchant at the Oriental Market.

loans.use: For paint.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan C. tiene ya más de diez años dedicándose a dar mantenimiento y reparación de llantas para autos. 
Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso para el y su familia, esta solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en el negocio ya que le están haciendo falta mas variedad de llantas y herramientas.
Pero por  el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para llevar a cabo la inversión, es por eso que esta solicitando su cooperación en este crédito.
Planea pagar el préstamo con una parte de las ganancias del negocio.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan C. has more than ten years of experience maintaining and repairing car tires. This business is the source of income for himself and his family. He is requesting a loan to invest in his business since he lacks equipment and a variety of tires.

At the moment, he does not have the necessary funds to follow through on this investment. For this reason, he is requesting assistance through this loan. Juan plans to repay this loan using some of the profits from his business.

loans.use: To invest in equipment and tires for his business.

loans.name: Cenon

texts.en: Cenon C. runs a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling snack foods, candies and biscuits in his community. He is 37 years old, single and has an infant child. He is from the village of North Poblacion, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. Cenon has been in his business for over one year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Cenon joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Cenon is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional snack foods and candies. This will be his second loan from HSPFI. He plans to use additional income to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional snack foods and candies.

loans.name: Sandra Adriana

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo encontramos un lugar conocido como los arenales, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Generación. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos la señora Sandra, tiene 34 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de  19,  17, 15 y 11 años, uno es mayor  de edad y estudia en Universidad y los menores en colegio y escuela. El marido de dedica a la pesca.

Ella además de atender su hogar también tiene un local en el cual ofrece el servicio de internet (cibercafé), allí vende jugos naturales, sodas, golosinas y bocadillos de picar a sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00, sus hijos le ayudan en su negocio, nos cuenta que lleva 7 años dedicada a esta actividad y que le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas, sodas, aguas, golosinas y bocadillos. Ella lleva en el Banco Comunal cinco años y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado a mejorar su negocio.
 
Su sueño es arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
Los Arenales is located in the parish of Crucita in the canton of Portoviejo. Every two weeks the members of the Nueva Generación (New Generation) Community Bank meet there. It is a place known for its beautiful beaches, its food, and the warmth of its people.

34-year old Sra. Sandra is a member of the bank. She lives with her partner and their four children aged 19, 17, 15, and 11. The eldest attends university and the younger ones go to college or school. Sandra’s husband is a fisherman.

As well as looking after the household, she runs an Internet cafe (cybercafe) where she sells natural juices, soft drinks, candy, and snacks to her customers. She works there every day from 8am to 8pm. Her children also help with the business. She’s been doing this work for seven years and it is going well.

This loan will be used to buy fruit, soft drinks, water, candy and snacks. Sandra has been a member of the bank for five years and enjoys having access to loans which have helped her improve her business. Her dream is to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy fruit, soft drinks, water, candy and snacks

loans.name: Lorena Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lorena de 36 años, es una mujer inspirada en su familia decidió encontrar una actividad economica. Comenzo con la preparación de condimentos y también en la venta de víveres para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.

En la actualidad trabaja sola de 7:30am a 9h30pm  en la preparación de condimentos y la mercaderia de la tienda. Su esposo trabaja de taxi amigo y tienen 2 hijo que estudian en escuela. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, colas y asi incrementar la productividad del negocio. En el futuro desea seguir prosperando y mas ventas en su negocio.
texts.en:
Lorena, 36 years old, is a woman inspired by her family who decided to find an economic activity. She began by preparing condiments and also, selling provisions, in order to help her husband with household expenses.

At present, she works alone from 7:30 am until 9:30 pm in preparing condiments and merchandise for the store. Her husband drives a taxi and they have 2 children, both in school. 

Lorena has many aspirations concerning her business. For this reason, she desires a loan to buy rice, sugar, and colas, in hopes of increasing the productivity of the business. In the future, she wishes to continue prospering by increasing sales.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and colas to sell.

loans.name: Adriana Beatriz

texts.es: Adriana Beatriz de veinte años de edad vive con su familia; Ella posee una tienda en el lugar de su residencia la cual es muy visitada por las personas del lugar. Adriana es una joven entusiasta que quiere ayudar a su familia a salir adelante, para ella trabajar todos los días es su inspiración. Últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues da el mejor servicio, siempre con una sonrisa en el rostro y vende sus productos a un buen precio, quiere ver crecer su negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar más productos como pan, golosinas, bebidas, granos básicos entre otros para abastecer la tienda y para satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes. Adriana sueña con que su trabajo le ayude a superarse como persona y también le ayude a darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en: Adriana Beatriz is 20 years old and lives with her family.  She has a store in her home in which she serves the people in her area.  Adriana is an enthusiastic young woman who would like to help her family get ahead in life.  She is inspired to work every day.  Lately she has had a lot of customers since she provides a very good service.  She always has a smile on her face and she sells her products at a good price.  Adriana would like to see her business grow and so she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to buy more products such as bread, candies, drinks, basic grains, etc. with which to stock her store and meet her customers' needs.  Adriana dreams of improving herself as a person and providing her family with a better life through her work.

loans.use: to buy bread, candies, drinks and basic grains

loans.name: Agatinde Group

texts.fr: Simon  est client d’ACB depuis 2011, il est membre du groupe Agatinde, il est né au Rwanda, son éducation est de 8 ans de l’école primaire, il est marié, il est cultivateur de riz, il a 30 ans, il a 3 enfants entre 12 et 1 an, 2 de ses enfants va  à l’école. C’est son premier cycle de prêt, Simon va utiliser le prêt pour l’agriculture de riz en paiement de main d’œuvre et achat d’engrais chimique. Sa stratégie est suivre les étapes appropriées et selon la saison pour augmenter la production. Dans l’avenir, il veut un augmenter la surface à cultiver.
texts.en: Simon has been an ACB customer since 2011 and is a member of the Agatinde group. He was born in Rwanda and attended primary school for eight years. He is married, 30 years old and has three children between one and twelve years old, two of whom attend school. He is a rice grower by trade. This is the first loan that he has sought and he will use it to pay labour costs and to purchase chemical fertiliser. His plan is to follow the necessary steps and to harvest his crops during the correct seasons so that he can boost production further. In future he would like to extend the area of land that he cultivates.

loans.use: to purchase fertilisers and pay labour costs

loans.name: Félicité

texts.fr: Née le 10 juillet 1976 au Bénin, Félicité  est mariée à un enseignant  du nom de Noel. Le couple  a  cinq enfants, tous scolarisés dont trois restent encore à leur charge.  Félicité  vit ensemble avec  son mari et  ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Félicité a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Félicité prépare de la nourriture (pâte de maïs, riz, accompagné de sauce aux poissons, etc.) qu’elle vend à son domicile. A côté de cette activité qui lui génère des revenus,  Félicité  vend des boissons non alcoolisées.  Félicité s’approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le but de rehausser son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Félicité sollicite auprès de ALIDé un troisième prêt. Les deux premiers crédits ont été tous bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Born on July 10, 1976 in Bénin, Félicité  is married to a teacher named Noel. The couple have five children. All of them have been or are presently in school and their parents are still responsible for three of them. Félicité lives together with her husband and children. The couple share in supporting the family. 

Félicité left her studies when she was in secondary school. To support herself and her children, Félicité prepares food (maize porridge or rice accompanied by fish stew, etc.) that she sells out of her home. Alongside this income-generating activity, Félicité  sells non-alcoholic drinks. She buys her supplies in a marketplace in Bénin. She is requesting her third loan from ALIDé. The two other loans were both reimbursed correctly.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs, condiments for stews, fresh fish and drinks.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is married and 33 years old. She has 2 school aged children. She has a retail shop where she sell a variety of products that she can offer to the people in her community.

Irene is requesting a loan of PHP11,000 to buy more products as inventory like coffee, creamer, detergents, etc. Each month, Irene earns about PHP300 per day doing this type of work.

In the future, Irene hopes that her business will improve more so that she can sustain the need of her family.

loans.use: to buy more products as inventory like coffee, creamer, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Buisson Ardent Plus Group

texts.en: Christine, age 44, is the chairwoman of the community bank named Buisson Ardent Plus, which consists of 19 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through the microfinance institution, HOPE RDC, with the goal of developing their businesses. Christine has been in the microenterprise world for years. She has been running a restaurant located southeast of the city of Kinshasa. She is a loyal client of HOPE RDC, who has already received nine different loans and has repaid them properly. She intends to use the next loan to increase the stock of her restaurant by buying a sack of flour, fish and beans with the aim of increasing her profits. Each week, her business brings in a profit of $70. Her ambition is to open a big restaurant in her area. Christine is married and has three children whose ages are between 6 and 12 years old. Two of them go to school.

loans.use: to increase the stock of her restaurant by buying flour, beans and other goods.

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 10 children. For the past 3 years she has had a food shop where she serves dishes like afritada & caldereta. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for cooking.

Leonita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for cooking.

loans.name: Narangerel

texts.en: Narangerel is 47 years old and lives with her two children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. Her older son works in a private company and her younger one is a student. She manages a meat trading business at a rented stall at a trading center. She started her business in 2001 and is planning to continue her business in the future. She bought 10 sheep to sell this coming fall. She is an honest woman who says, "I want my older son to have valid education." She is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to purchase more sheep to increase her business sales.

loans.use: To purchase more sheep

loans.name: German

texts.es: El señor German trabaja como chofer de minibús de transporte de pasajeros en el radio urbano de la ciudad de La Paz y es socio del sindicato de choferes “litoral”; su esposa se dedica al comercio de ropa. El crédito lo requiere para la reparación de su vehiculo, específicamente la caja del mismo, pues tiene algunos problemas. Vive en casa de sus padres  la misma queda ubicada en la zona Alto San Pedro en la ciudad de La Paz; es casado y  tiene  dos hijos. El cliente esta satisfecho por los créditos que obtuvo hasta la fecha y esta es la segunda vez que su crédito se canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. German works as a chauffeur and drives a passenger minibus within the urban radius of the city of La Paz. He is a member of the “Litoral” transportation union. His wife is a clothing merchant. The loan he is requesting will be used to repair his vehicle, specifically the gearbox, because it has been experiencing a few problems. German lives at the home of his parents in the District of Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz. He is married and has two children.

German is pleased with the loans he has received to date. This is the second time his loan has been referred to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to pay the cost of repairing the gearbox in his minibus.
